</question from>



<question>



Other files were messed up after using system restore?



After system restore finishes restoring, one of the folders on the desktop that has many files in it were messed up. Some of the files in the subfolders have been placed in the desktop.



</question>



<answer from>



Denz
Member since: 16 September 2006
Total points: 629 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



system restore is like a time machine it makes your computer go back to its original state. so if files and programs are not in the original setting it will not be there.



you should always backup you data or files before restoring your sytem because you will defenitely lose this files. (and programs)



</answer>



<answer from>



ALAN T
Member since: 26 December 2007
Total points: 2724 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



Just undo the restore and save them elsewhere first, to a disc or memory stick, then redo the system restore and then put the original files back where you want them



</answer>

<question from>



ldruttar...
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 95 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



What is microsoft silverlight?



</question>



<answer from>



Aneliya K
Member since: 29 September 2008
Total points: 158 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



programming language. Platform.



</answer>



<answer from>



QQQ
Member since: 11 May 2008
Total points: 12274 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



It's Microsoft's answer to Adobe's Flash.



It's a new programming platform that drives interactive ads, menus, apps etc that you see on the web.



Silverlight is still only in Beta, so the only place where you'll see Silverlight in action is on Microsoft's websites.
http://silverlight.net/



</answer>



<answer from>



boOm
Member since: 08 August 2008
Total points: 99 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Microsoft Silverlight is a programmable web browser plugin that enables features such as animation, vector graphics and audio-video playback that characterize rich internet applications . Silverlight competes with products such as Adobe Flash, Adobe Flex, Adobe Shockwave, JavaFX, Curl and the JavaScript programming language.



Version 2.0, now in beta-testing, brings additional interactivity features and support for .NET languages and development tools.
Silverlight was developed under the codename Windows Presentation Foundation/Everywhere (WPF/E). It is compatible with multiple web browser products used on Microsoft Windows and Mac OS X operating systems. Mobile devices, starting with Windows Mobile 6 and Symbian (Series 60) phones, will also be supported.



A third-party free software implementation named Moonlight is under development to bring compatible functionality to GNU/Linux.



Source(s):



From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia



</answer>

<question from>



gta
Member since: 01 June 2007
Total points: 3168 (Level 4)



</question from>



<question>



Adobe Flash Player 9?



How to use it to download Youtube videos?



Are they stored in a library?



</question>



<answer from>



QQQ
Member since: 11 May 2008
Total points: 12274 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



The Flash Player is just... a player. It plays Flash videos in your web browser.



To download videos from Youtube, you need certain programs like http://vixy.net/. The videos are stored on Youtube's website and Vixy allows you to download them directly to your computer.



To use it, copy down the Videos URL address and paste it into the Vixy website. Hit the Start button on the Vixy site and it'll begin converting, once its done you can download it in AVI format.



</answer>



<answer from>



Freatinssbus F
Member since: 25 September 2008
Total points: 437 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Here is a step by step guide about how to download YouTube videos and convert YouTube videos to other video and audio formats for iPod Video, iPod Touch, iPod Nano, iPhone, Zune, PSP, etc
http://www.youtubetoipod.org/download-yo...
Also, you can find some other software:
http://www.ask.com



</answer>

<answer from>



sn0zb0z
Member since: 20 April 2008
Total points: 4028 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Video & Online Games



</answer from>



<answer>



For sims you need a product code. Even with a disc you may not be able to play them - it all depends on where you downloaded it from and exactly what you downloaded



Football manager might be playable without it being put on disc



</answer>



<answer from>



QQQ
Member since: 11 May 2008
Total points: 12274 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



What filetype/format are they in?



If it's just an installer/.exe file, double click to run it. You will probably not need a disc at all.



If it's an ISO file, or a kind of disc image you'll need a Disc image loader like DaemonTools 3.47 to mount it.



</answer>



<answer from>



broderm2...
Member since: 10 January 2007
Total points: 1299 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



there is no way you can do that,for games in order to run they need to be register them on the system registry,some will need a full installation and some will run from with the exe. file only, the thing is for games like sims and football manager,these games actually store some of their files on the pc,for example profile files and progression, so as far as i know you cant run such games from an external source(cd,memory stick)



</answer>

<question>



Help please.............CD-ROM 's?



CD-ROM drives over the past several years have been sold as 2X, 8X, 16X, 32X, etc., such that this label represents the speed of the drive; 8X means 8 times the base line unit. What is meant by the baseline unit?



can you describe what this unit is ?



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



its the speed of your cd rom drive. the speed of how fast will it read/write the cd. the higher the number the faster.



</answer>

<answer from>

<answer>

Once a screen pops up saying "Press any key to boot from cd or dvd. 2.press any key.
3. If yoy have Windows Vista erase your hard drive then format it.



4. Let windows handle the rest of it.

<answer from>



chezzrob
Member since: 27 September 2007
Total points: 20303 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



er  as a novice you may get into trouble.  there are programs that need to be installed to run the processor, southbridge and northbridge chipsets.  I suggestr to fix what you got.  You need to learn hoqw to combat spyware as you never know when you going to get it.



print this and keep it.



From my notes
Also while your computer is in good nick you should download and install Superantispyware and Spybot –Search and Destroy, Ccleaner because when malware gets going you will not be able to access the net.



Clean Up Computer
CCleaner  (about 10 minutes to install and run)
=========
google ccleaner and install it.  While it installs just untick the boxes as some you dont want.



run the cleaner in windows/applications but dont tick the bottom 11 boxes in the Windows Tab.
run the registry cleaner as well, when it asks to back up the registry , allow it to do it, then clean the registry.



Also ccleaner will remove the  program entry that you may have difficulty with in add/remove, or the uninstall doesn't work.
Just ensure you tick the one program and not the whole computer to delete, if you use this feature.



Superantispyware (1 hour)
===============
http://www.superantispyware.com
Has a stop homepage from being altered which is good
Can reset windows defaults in various parts



Download and run superantispyware. I was put onto this program because of an annoying popup (XP or Vista plus all OS preceding)



Install it and set the preferences to monitor your home page.
Set up tick boxes that you want in the other tabs as you require.
You don’t need to run it at startup unless you want the antispyware protection 24/7.



Note Superantispyware has powerful reset tools that will set stuff back to windows defaults.
To use these tools click preferences &gt;repairs. This may be handy to reset IE URLS if you have annoying pop ups.
Superantispyware is a good program and remember to update it before scanning. A scan may take 45mins.	Just run a scan for the first attack.



Spybot – Search and Destroy (1 hour)
=====================



Download spybot search and destroy.  Through its immunize page and link to javacools spyblaster, spybot can manage activex problems which is extremely difficult for antispyware programs to find.  Also just run the scan for first attack.
http://www.spybot.info/en/download/index...
.



Windows Live Onecare (2-3 hours)
===================
Onecare safety scan  fixes registry and finds temp files that nothing else seems to find.
Choose the Beta Edition link for vista users.
It does registry, spyware , virus , disk clean up and defrag



XP Users http://onecare.live.com/site/en-ca/defau...
Vista Users
http://onecare.live.com/site/en-ca/cente...



Run the full safety scanner,  it takes a few seconds to install the scanning files but when you start the scan, it takes 2 hours or more. Let it load the scanning tools, then start the Safety Scan.  So once it starts to load the safety scans'  x file of x , you can leave the computer and go to bed etc.



Then at the end of the scan it asks you to set it running full time.



Think twice about setting it to run in the background as it could be another thing to slow you down. However, it may be worth while if you have no other security programs running.



Consider the following options:
I personally run Norton 360 which is full internet security and run superantispyware when I want to.



So if you don’t have a decent internet security program then perhaps run the superantispyware with your antivirus in the background.



If you sick of antivirus programs that don’t work perhaps run onecare full time and run superantispyware whenever.



Now you should be flying and Onecare has even set up a new system restore point for you.
Note onecare does other stuff as well.  Click on the menus on the LHS column., but all of this is done if you click Safety Scan.
add onecare to your favourites



IE7 (2 minutes)
=======
Over time IE7 seems to set its own (or programs do) tick boxes in the advance tab.
In IE7 Tools &gt;Internet Options &gt;Advance Tab
Click Restore advance settings defaults button.
Then scroll the listings down to near the bottom and:
Tick empty temp files when browser closes (this empties the cache, which if not empty, will stop you from going online).
Bullet disable phishing filter (optional. Leave it on if you want that type of protection, usually for financial data like internet banking)
Delete Browser History, cookies, add ons,  the whole lot regularly.
Close the browser to set the settings.



.



NOTE:  2008 will be the year of add on malware and spyware.  I advise NOT to install active x when asked to on unknown websites. If you allow an active x install and it contains adware or such, no antivirus or anti-spyware will find it, because you have given permission to install it.  The cleanup programs think that you want it installed. It will be very difficult to remove.



Phishing Filter
When



</answer>



<answer from>



HaloIsMy...
Member since: 19 May 2008
Total points: 163 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Hi. First you have to copy all your necessary data from your windows driver (C:) into another driver (D:). Then you can insert your windows disk and install. During download there is an option that tell you to format your driver (C:). You can choose the top option (I don't remember what exactly it is, but it is quick NTFS format). And install your windows normally. When done, you shouldn't double click on your driver (D, E) because the viruses still resident on it. You can show all hidden file and open your explorer windows in folder view. and delete file autorun in these drivers, restart and install new antivirus. Goodluck.



</answer>

<question from>



Chris L
Member since: 29 June 2008

</question from>



<question>



In photoshop vvhat are the original settings for the mask tool?



yesterday I reset all the seings and now I can seem to make the quick mask work because it's always too solid or completely transparent
how do I rmake it right?



</question>



<answer from>



plumdump...
Member since: 15 July 2008
Total points: 8643 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Programming & Design



Software



Other - Visual Arts



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



You should be able to just double click on the Quick Mask icon at the bottom of the tool bar. It will launch a dialogue box that lets you pick between color indicating masked or selected area, you can pick your color (it doesn't have to be red) and set the opacity. I believe the standard setting is 50%



</answer>



<asker's comment>



thanks alot. I was expecting a whole list of things I had to do to fix the problem but this took maybe 10 seconds



</asker's comment>

KROFS
Member since: 09 February 2006
Total points: 23700 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Other - Internet



Software



Other - Computers



</answer from>



<answer>



I do not use WMM, but I think that is a codec issue.  Either you add codecs to WMM or you convert the video.
You can check the encoding of the videos with the free GSpot.  Once installed, right-click a video and select open with GSpot.
http://www.headbands.com/gspot/



I do not know how to add codecs to WMM, but if you need to convert the free Format Factory works well:
http://www.formatoz.com/



Most likely the videos are encoded in either DivX or XviD and I do not think that WMM, at default,  supports those.



</answer>

<question from>



Lovearro...
Member since: 15 February 2007
Total points: 93 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How do i play windows games on bootcamp?



I have a really really good imac..core 2 duo and Nvidia 8800GS graphics card. My ram is 4GB so i think i can play pretty much any game out there. When I check my graphics card using dxdiag on windows vista (parallel desktop), I don't see my 8800GS displayed on the info. Instead I see some crappy 12.0mb graphics card installed...When I try to play games, the quality is really bad and the game window is tiny. How do I properly play windows games on bootcamp with this imac?



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



Your laptop won't be able to play most modern games on high. It's not that good of a laptop for heavy gaming but yes it'll do nicely for you.



You must install the Nvidia drivers on the Windows part of bootcamp for it to read your card. You may need to get beta drivers that support that version of the GS.



</answer>

<question>



Formula help with excel?



I want cell w8 to be blank if v8 is blank, if v8 is 0 then i want the value in n8 to appear in w8, if v8 is 1 then o8 to appear in w8 and if v8 is 2 the the value of p8 to appear.



</question>



<answer from>



Mike O
Member since: 10 March 2008
Total points: 605 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



u made it sound far to complicated dude...



</answer>



<answer from>



ALAN T
Member since: 26 December 2007
Total points: 2724 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



All the info you need is in the online help, just read it yourself



</answer>



<answer from>



Abhinav S
Member since: 23 September 2008
Total points: 259 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



OVER THE HEAD BOUNCER!!!!!!



</answer>



<answer from>



Brian Hopkin
Member since: 10 September 2008
Total points: 703 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



i worked on it for like 30 minutes and heres the solution :)



=IF(V8="",V8,IF(V8=0,N8,
IF(V8=1,O8,IF(V8=2,
P8,"error"))))



just write the whole formula in one line. yahoo answer isnt allowing me to write it in one line :S



phew!



</answer>

<answer>



What sort of pop-up message?



It may be a virus - have you got a decent anti-virus?



If not, un-install your current one and install AVG Free (www.avgfree.com) if you can't afford an anti-virus system, or ESET NOD32 (www.eset.com) if you are prepared to spend money.



Run a FULL Computer Scan and hopefully it will find anything.



If not, go on Google and search for Malwarebytes' Anti-Malware. Download & Install it, and run a full scan, removing anything that it detects.



Good luck!



Source(s):



Experience



</answer>

Contributing In:



Software

</answer from>



<answer>



They are in the system32 folder.  Their file extension is .ico



</answer>



<answer from>



GermanTe...
Member since: 25 August 2008
Total points: 395 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Hi!
There are two programs I've used to extract or find icons. The software with the most features is the 1st link I list below IconCool - they make several different programs to manage and edit icons. You can download 30 day trials to see if you like it or not before you buy it. Another program I've used before for this is InfoFind from Omnicognic listed in the 2nd link. It will allow you to view icons in *.ico, *.exe, *.dll files, etc in the free version of the program, but if you want to extract them then you need to pay for the full version. I just checked using the free version of InfoFind and see that most Windows Icons are located in the file C:\WINDOWS\system32\shell32.dll. Since your developing with VB if its 6 and you have full visual studio or if it's any newer version then you can edit *.ico files with Visual Studio but is not as powerful as IconCool for editing.



Source(s):



http://www.iconcool.com/
http://www.omnicognic.com/



</answer>

<original file>4089.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk13435.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



neverrai...
Member since: 29 September 2008
Total points: 90 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Open-source software vs. Closed-source software?



Which one do you prefer using and why?



I myself like and support the existence and pervasiveness of closed-source software for a number of reasons, including market revenues and employing highly-skilled software developers instead of looking for contributions from someone I don't know about.



</question>



<answer from>



Abhinav S
Member since: 23 September 2008
Total points: 259 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I will prefer the Open Source software coz I will able to know about the source code of that particaular software.



</answer>



<answer from>



SUDP
Member since: 20 May 2008
Total points: 255 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Well you are right. But look at the ultimate end product of open source software which always turns out to be much better over its closed source counterparts. I agree that the development cycle takes much larger amount of time in the case of open source software as compared to closed source software. But the result of such a patient time consuming process is quality. Because there is no restriction of any sort for inflow of ideas from any one at any point of time, open source philosophy always wins at the end though it may be the tortoise in a hare versus tortoise race. Moreover most developers of open source software are first its users, user's requirements are better represented in an open source software. Mozilla Firefox, GNU Compilers and mplayer are some of the clear successes of open source philosophy over closed source.



</answer>

<question from>



jaswant s
Member since: 29 July 2007
Total points: 120 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



"I can receive, but not send e-mail messages in microsoft outlook"?



</question>



<additional details>



my pc window xp p3



</additional details>



<answer from>



web_slin...
Member since: 17 July 2007
Total points: 751 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Double check your POP3 settings



</answer>



<answer from>



sajimunn...
Member since: 03 August 2006
Total points: 484 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



That is Because of the Poss office Protocol is not configured correctly.
try to correct it as per your mail box settings



If your outgoing SMTP server requires authentication, verify that you have you configured Outlook to use SMTP authentication.



Your Internet service provider (ISP) (ISP: A business that provides access to the Internet for such things as electronic mail, chat rooms, or use of the World Wide Web. Some ISPs are multinational, offering access in many locations, while others are limited to a specific region.) can tell you if you need to turn on SMTP authentication. If your ISP instructs you to turn on this feature, you can verify by using the Internet E-mail Settings dialog box.



1. On the Tools menu, click E-mail Accounts.



2. Select View or change existing e-mail accounts, and then click Next.



3. Select the name of the e-mail account, and then click Change.



4. Click More Settings.



5. On the Outgoing Server tab, verify that the My outgoing server (SMTP) requires authentication check box is selected.



Source(s):



http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/outloo...



</answer>



<answer from>



dogenzen...
Member since: 08 February 2008
Total points: 3463 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



check your pop3 settings; outgoing server (smtp); you can use gmail's; it's free



</answer>



<answer from>



rishab v
Member since: 10 April 2008
Total points: 4623 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



You can check several things to help resolve being able to receive but not send e-mail messages.



1)Outgoing SMTP server requires authentication



If your outgoing SMTP server requires authentication, verify that you have you configured Outlook to use SMTP authentication.



Your Internet service provider (ISP) (ISP: A business that provides access to the Internet for such things as electronic mail, chat rooms, or use of the World Wide Web. Some ISPs are multinational, offering access in many locations, while others are limited to a specific region.) can tell you if you need to turn on SMTP authentication. If your ISP instructs you to turn on this feature, you can verify by using the Internet E-mail Settings dialog box.



Note



Only POP3 and IMAP e-mail accounts allow SMTP authentication to be turned on.



How?



1. On the Tools menu, click E-mail Accounts.



2. Select View or change existing e-mail accounts, and then click Next.



3. Select the name of the e-mail account, and then click Change.



4. Click More Settings.



5. On the Outgoing Server tab, verify that the My outgoing server (SMTP) requires authentication check box is selected.



2)



Outgoing SMTP server requires Secure Password Authentication (SPA)
If SPA is required by your Internet service provider (ISP) (ISP: A business that provides access to the Internet for such things as electronic mail, chat rooms, or use of the World Wide Web. Some ISPs are multinational, offering access in many locations, while others are limited to a specific region.), verify that you have configured Outlook to use SPA.



Your ISP can tell you if SPA is required with your account. If your ISP instructs you to turn on this feature, you can verify by using the Internet E-mail Settings dialog box.



Note



Only POP3, IMAP, and HTTP e-mail accounts allow SPA to be turned on.



How?



1. On the Tools menu, click E-mail Accounts.



2. Select View or change existing e-mail accounts, and then click Next.



3. Select the name of the e-mail account, and then click Change.



4. Under Logon Information, verify that the Log on using Secure Password Authentication (SPA) check box is selected.



</answer>



<answer from>



Jith
Member since: 07 September 2008
Total points: 186 (Level 1)



</answer from>

<question>



How do I change the default software for viewing images?



I have this super annoying quicktime picture viewer that takes forever to open a picture and displays a message EVERYTIME that i can't get rid of.. And I can't figure out how to delete Quicktime picture viewer component without deleting quicktime altogether (required for many videos)..
How can I at least change the default image viewer to say "Windows picture and fax viewer?"



thank you

<answer from>



Addicted to Diet Coke
Member since: 15 June 2006
Total points: 7088 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Software



Laptops & Notebooks



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Right click an image you want to open, then click open with, then select the program you want to open the image.  At the bottom select always use then click ok.

<question from>



groovych...

Contributing In:



Homework Help



</question from>



<question>



What is a Cyclic redundancy check? and how do i fix its data error?



I was trying to download the game grand theft auto to my computer and half way through the installation it says error: data error (cyclic redundancy check.) what does that mean and how can i get rid of it so i can download the game?
Thnx for the help.



</question>



<answer from>



too_perp...
Member since: 19 October 2007
Total points: 2380 (Level 3)



Contributing In:



Programming & Design



</answer from>



<answer>



A cyclic redundancy check is used to verify that the data you have is the same as the original. Even a slight modification in the file will result in a different output value. It means that you have corruption or modification in your installation, you should probably re-download it, or get it from another source (like a CD)



~P



</answer>



<answer from>



E-Y
Member since: 02 June 2008
Total points: 103 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



it can means your connection speed is to low, and the website where you download is not responding, you can solve this by downloading from other place, for  e.g at your friends pc that have internet connection. By the way it can also means that there is something wrong with your internet browser software, so they are having error while downloading the file you want to



</answer>



<answer from>



16k-zx81
Member since: 16 March 2008
Total points: 23416 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



Add-ons



Other - Hardware



</answer from>



<answer>



it means that the file is corrupt. Using another computer will make no difference. Download it from a different source. unfortunately if it fails the crc check it means its kaput



</answer>

<answer from>



lenabean...
Member since: 07 January 2008
Total points: 965 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



You can use programs such as VMware, Parallels, or Boot Camp (which is only available with Leopard 10.5, but it is free)



However, to use these you need to have a Windows software (either XP or Vista)  which you can get on eBay for ~$100



Boot Camp would be the only realistic one because games take up a lot of memory, but if you don't have Leopard, upgrading a Windows software and getting Leopard would end up costing you $200 for a game.  Is it really worth it then?



Good luck!!



</answer>

<original file>7511.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk17238.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



Alice
Member since: 01 February 2008
Total points: 140 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How can I get Windows Sound Recorder to well... Record?



Ok, no matter what I do whenever I press the little record button a little thing pops up that says " Another Application is Recording Audio, Stop Recording with this application and try to record again."
No matter what, this happens. And nothing else is ever recording.



</question>



<answer from>



donktg
Member since: 12 April 2008
Total points: 661 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Go to Control Panel and click on the icon for Sounds And Audio Devices. Click the Audio tab.  Be sure that the correct device (your sound card) is selected under the default device for Sound Recording.



Also, be sure that the Windows Audio service is running:
Go to Start, run, and type Services.msc.  Scroll down to look at the Windows Audio Service.  It's Status should be "Started", and it's Startup Type should be "Automatic".  If not, right click it and change these settings.
That should fix it. Don't forget that your mic has to be un-muted in the Windows Volume sliders.
Good luck,
Donk



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Thanks! That fixed it in seconds.



</asker's comment>

<question>



Problem with WinAmp and AVG?



im an avid listener of music and im getting really frustrated because of this problem im having with winamp...



one time when I opened my Winamp ver 5.44 AVG will pop up and say that it is a trojan



then another window will popup and say that "winamp has encountered a problem and needs to close."



i tried removing winamp, reinstalling and i even tried downloading a new installer from the website itself...



please help me! thanks to those who will help!!!!!



</question>



<answer from>



esquilax
Member since: 27 June 2008
Total points: 849 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I was about to say "I don't have that problem.." I opened winamp and bam, there it was. It's probably a false positive (at least I hope it is), hopefully AVG will fix this for the next update. For now, you can add winamp to the exception list in AVG. I want to google a bit and see what others say. I'll write more in a minute....



Yeah, the consensus is that it's a false positive and AVG is already aware of the problem.



-Open the AVG window by double-clicking its icon.
-Tools -&gt; Advanced Settings.
-Choose Resident Shield -&gt; Exceptions on the left
-Click Add Path
-Navigate to C:\Program Files\Winamp (that's the default directory)
-Click OK until you're back to main window (you can close it now)
Try Winamp again.



Others talking about this:
http://forums.techguy.org/all-other-soft...
http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?...



</answer>



<answer from>



aurelian...
Member since: 02 December 2007
Total points: 5322 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Printers



</answer from>

</answer>

<answer from>



Alex K
Member since: 27 May 2008
Total points: 594 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



All of them. Turn off UAC (Control panel &gt; User accounts &gt; User Account Control) and when you go to click on the short cut, right click on it and choose "Run as admin" if any don't work for some reason.



</answer>

<answer from>



oni-kun ^^
Member since: 27 July 2008
Total points: 9160 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Programming & Design



Software



Other - Computers



Laptops & Notebooks

<answer>



http://www.windowstalk.org/dual_boot_vis...
You can, and it'll start up and say:



"What system do you want to start up:



Windows Vista
Older version of Windows"



And you can select between Vista/XP. You only need the amount of RAM that each OS requires.

<answer from>



AJ
Member since: 01 May 2007
Total points: 8413 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Looks to me like you have far too many programmes running from startup. You really don't need most of these running all the time so go to start, run, and type msconfig and go to the startup tab. Tek out all this itunes and nero and quicktime stuff. However - most imnportant it looks to me like you have symantec/norton and avg running at the same time. This is not a good plan and could well be causing a conflict. Take one or other of them off. Edit your question if these suggestions don't work or if you don't understand the advice



AJ



</answer>

<answer from>



powerxof...
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 166 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Does it give you the BSOD or just crashes on screen? Does it automatically restart your computer when it crashes?



You might have too much programs running, and depending on the specs of your machine, it can't handle it. Turn off all the startup programs you don't need like adobe, nero, qttask, apple, google and etc. Go to Start&gt;Run&gt;type in msconfig&gt;startup tab and uncheck those.



Uninstall norton and install another kind of antivirus, norton sucks. It's a big memory hog and it doesn't detect viruses well. Get one of those free ones like avast or avg, they're not the best but they're free and they're probably better the norton.



Download a spyware scanner like spybot or whatever. Do a scan and clean out any malware, spyware and adware in your computer.



</answer>

<question>



Are there any Excel like programs that can hold more than 1 million names?



Excel caps out at 1 million cells. I am apart of a company and I just received 21 million names and numbers and I need some way of sorting those names. can anyone help me?



</question>



<answer from>
Member since: 28 February 2008
Total points: 2073 (Level 3)

<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>

<asker's comment>

</asker's comment>



<answer from>



garbo744...
Member since: 28 May 2008
Total points: 6554 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Programming & Design



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



Excel 2007 has over a million ROWS and 16,000 Columns, per worksheet.



Open a new workbook and add enough worksheets to have one for each letter of the alphabet, labeled A-Z, and 21 more scratch sheets for data manipulation.



Load a million datasets into each of the 21 sheets  and sort each A-Z.



Then create a macro to move them from the 21 sheets to the correct A-Z sheets, alphabetically.



Sort the 26 A-Z sheets alphabetically.



</answer>

Member since: 29 March 2008
Total points: 166 (Level 1)

<answer from>



Otemu A
Member since: 16 January 2008
Total points: 1000 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



The most simplest way is to click, start &gt; run &gt; type "msconfig" without the quotes &gt; click the startup tab &gt; now untick all the programs that u dont want to start up on boot up and restart your system.



Another alternative is to check the settings and preferences for each of the applications that you don't want to run on start up, for instance sign in to yahoo (you must be signed in) go to the preferences and remove the start on windows startup option, all the other applications will have this option in there settings as well.



Thank You



hope that helps



</answer>



<answer from>



naturist
Member since: 26 April 2007
Total points: 4806 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



If you are running Windows XP then bigjohn, previous answer, has got it exactly right. If, however, you are running Windows Vista, you just click on the Start icon in the bottom left-hand corner of your screen and in the Start Search box at the bottom of the menu type in msconfig.
It's a good idea to leave Yahoo Messenger to automatically start when you switch on because once it has loaded, all of your other programmes will be okay to use. Once Messenger has loaded correctly you can just shut it down,



</answer>

<answer>

<answer from>



Grumpy Troll
Member since: 20 December 2007
Total points: 138 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Avast! is better.



It scans files you access on the Internet before download.  For example, if you were to navigate to a harmful executable file, it would catch it and warn you before you download and run it.



It also has an easy command line quick scan which you can use for Internet applications that support virus scan, such as Download Status bar for Firefox.



Not only does it get rid of viruses, but also malware, spyware, adware, and root kits.



It also takes up few system resources and can run comfortably in the background all the time.



In my opinion, it's just as adequate for an average home computer user than expensive big name antivirus programs, like Norton.



Don't believe whoever says Avast! is bad.  Chances are they don't know how to do anything but surf the Internet in regard to computers.



Trust me, those who know something about computers and software will tell you Avast! is the best free choice.



Avast! has a great philosophy in that the first step to preventing massive outbreaks of viruses is to project us home users who are more subject to viruses and other nasties.  That's why it's free for us.



</answer>



<answer from>



dori
Member since: 30 August 2008
Total points: 233 (Level 1)



</answer from>

<question from>



jonyoung...
Member since: 05 November 2007
Total points: 68 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Can I install microsoft office 2007 for windows on my mac, after I installed windows using boot camp.?



I wanna know if I'm running windows on my mac using boot camp, if I can install microsoft office 2007 on windows for my mac.



</question>



<answer from>



AJ
Member since: 01 May 2007
Total points: 8413 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Yes you can but why not get Office for Mac?



AJ



</answer>



<answer from>



ELfaGeek
Member since: 18 February 2007
Total points: 49818 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



Once Windows is running under BootCamp, it IS a WIndows PC.



So, yes, running Windows, you can install any program you want.  Windows doesn't know it's running on an Apple, and OS X doesn't care that Windows is also on the hard drive.



But, the real question is:  Why would you need to install MS-Office on either OS?



For Windows, get the free Open Office



For OS X, get the free NeoOffice



Both are free and virtually 100% compatible with MS-Office".



Please take the time to go to the links below and read all about these amazing programs.  Then, tell all your friends about them.



Source(s):



http://www.openoffice.org



http://www.neooffice.org



</answer>

Yes and No. There should always be choice I think.



I use GNU licensed software whenever possible. You seem rather proud to be a thief, I am rather more ashamed to admit that I am not too clean myself. There are usually viable alternatives to a great deal of software that is out there - however, there is no excuse for stealing... but I have previously had difficulties in purchasing and activating software, and one case of this was with NoD antivirus which came installed on my computer - I replaced it with a crack which seems the only way to use it! I since stopped using it, I never waste time with Antivirus in Windows now. (I have a scanner which I can use to check flashdrives).



Almost - in the case of Microsoft things are a little different. I am always angered when people send me '.doc' or '.docx' files. Microsoft have managed to dominate the desktop, mostly through unfair means, and predominance of the .doc file is unpleasant. What is more worrying is that it is actually ILLEGAL for any kind of free software to decode and edit the new .docx format.



In this case, I support theft.However, for my office work, I use Open office, and for podcasts and music I use Rhythmbox and Banshee mostly - I never use iTunes.



I think that your question is rather stupid, and you probably think that iTunes is free, wheras it's really no better than MS Office.



So many websites post 'subscribe to iTunes', but only the more aware sites make it easy to copy and paste the feed.



You should try to grow up and develop a rather more intelligent point of view before you visit public forums. You tend to make yourself, and your fellow answerers, look rather ignorant.



It is the choice of the software developers whether they make their code open and free or not. Free software does not always mean it is not paid for, but then I wouldn't expect you to know about that either.



I am confident that you don't support free software, and use Windows every day - thus reinforcing the Windows domination, and causing problems for people like me - who refuse to accept documents in .doc format (.pdf is fine, or html) - and businesses which tend to go with Microsoft because they don't see any way around it.



Instead of STEALING AND SUPPORTING this software (supporting by using it - do you understand?) you should try SUPPORTING ALTERNATIVES



Otherwise, just shut up and die quietly please. You are doing nobody any favours, nothing to encourage business models to help programmers get paid by working on free software.



If you're interested to learn more about the future - which in the short term will see Google improve the balance of power by sharing a little of the Microsoft domination (albeit with the demonic and utterly capitalist 'cloud software' idea) then you should first start by supporting a free Operating system (that means anyone can have a computer and can OWN the software on their computer, which is impossible with Microsoft - you pay and never own it).



Once you have a free operating system, come back and say something more intelligent. You tend to find this - people who use Mac tend to be equally stupid in their own fashion, in a kind of 'I paid a ton for my system, so why don't you? What's wrong with the whole world being forced to use iTunes? If you don't want to use your credit card you shouldn't be allowed to use a computer should you?

<question>



Where can I find the 'subscript' icon in Microsoft Word 2007?



I'm kind of typing a chemical formula that includes a subscript and I can't seem to remember where it is located, so please help! :)



</question>



<answer from>



gerald
Member since: 23 June 2008
Total points: 102 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



highlight the word/letter you want to sub script and then rightclick on the highlighted word ; click on font; there is a group of checkbox there..and there you can find subscript



</answer>



<answer from>



canadien...
Member since: 10 May 2008
Total points: 849 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I'm not sure where the icon is located, but if you press the Crtl button and the += button at the same time, it will go to subscript. Pressing the buttons again puts it back into 'normal' text size. Also, if you have to type a superscript, you push Crtl, Shift, and += all together.



Source(s):



Did a TON of chemical equations today!



</answer>

<answer from>



ComStar Computers
Member since: 12 July 2007
Total points: 2057 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Well for simplicity sake, I'd suggest a Debian or Ubuntu Linux install. However, on a machine of that vintage, I'd wager that these two Linux version would not runn properly or smoothly on this laptop.

Instead, may I suggest DSL Linux? This small but effective Linux version is so small that it can fit on a credit card CD or Thumb Drive. It runs well and has most of the common Linux features. DSL Linux (http://www.DamnSmallLinux.org) was passed to me by a Pholosophy Professor and former Microsoft Developer. It is very nice indeed. Try the LiveCD  and if you like it, you can install right from the booted live cd linux environment. That's very nice, I can boot into DSL from a cd, try it out, and if I like, a click or 2 and it's installed. No reboot needed. The LiveCD is also the Install CD. And all under 100mb.

OR

One could look into KDE Linux. This is a slightly more beefed up linux install that is comparable to both Debian (in respects to the usability) and DSL Linux (on resource demands).

I would also like to point out that DSL Linux has a streamlined network enhanced version called DSL-N  "DSL's Bigger Brother"...

Good Luck

EDIT: After reading the answers above my response, I have to say, they are all really good answers and it seems like thus far, the general consensus is DSL Linux is your best route. I'd hate to be in your shoes having to figure out a best answer out of all these great responses....



Source(s):



Jason C. Kubin
www.ComStar-Computers.com (Links to Linux Downloads)



</answer>

<answer from>



cheekych...
Member since: 22 September 2006
Total points: 1177 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



One of the best cleaners is rubbing alcohol, but you can also use a warm water and mild soap solution. Avoid any heavy duty solvents when you clean a CD, as they can damage the disc.

Apply the cleaning solution to a clean lint-free cloth, and wipe the disc, again radially. When you clean a CD with a liquid material, make sure to wipe the excess liquid off, and never put the disc back into its packaging when it is still wet. Allow the cleaned disc to dry completely before attempting to play it again. When you clean a CD with alcohol or a specialized cleaning solution, often the cleaner dries so quickly that this is not a major concern, but check for spots and marks which may interfere with clean play.

Even after cleaning, a disc may fail to play properly because of scratches. Some companies manufacture products which are designed to resurface discs, smoothing out scratches so that they will play again. Depending on how severe the damage is, these products can be quite effective, but it is a good idea to back up the data as soon as you have repaired the disc, in case it fails again.



***DO NOT USE WINDOLENE, TOOTHPASTE OR T CUT.***

These all contain small granules and will scratch the plastic surface of your CD even more. What I suggest and have tried is washing up liquid. Pour a little on over any visible scratches, rinse in tepid water, then dry radially with a lint free cloth. e.g: a spectacles/ glasses cleaning cloth.



Source(s):



http://www.moviecodec.com/topics/50207p1...



</answer>



<answer from>



mike b
Member since: 27 January 2008
Total points: 1329 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Wash the disk in Warm Soapy water with a liquid soap, then dry it with a tissue. If that do not work then it,s the rubbish bin for it.



</answer>

<question>



How do I add music from itunes onto my Windows Movie Maker Slideshow?



I click File, Import into Collections, My Documents, My Music, Itunes, Itunes music, then i click on the artist. Then I click Import and nothing happens. Can you tell me how to do it?



</question>



<additional details>



I click on the song I want and then there is no file name.  When i try to put something in for the file name it says its incorrect.



</additional details>



<answer from>



Olie
Member since: 13 August 2008
Total points: 201 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Windows movie maker does not support the I-Tunes music format "AAC". If the song you want to use is in this format you could rip it to a CD and import it from there. Or if you want to have it on your computer to use from there, just import it back into I_Tunes as a MP3; " EDIT, PREFERENCES, ADVANCE, IMPORT, MP3"



</answer>

<question from>



darrenmc...
Member since: 04 April 2007
Total points: 782 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Can any body tell me bitcomet question??? 10 pts, easy money?



when im d/loadin, my floatin tray stays at say 150kbs, but when i open an application or close a window it temporarily spikes up as far as 700 or 800, is there a way to get the maximum continuosly? id love to know



</question>



<answer from>



madmike
Member since: 27 July 2008
Total points: 297 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



this is what happens, when you close application the processor marks it as the active process and torrent goes as the backend/background process...now at this point of time torrent software is receiving and sharing with the same bandwidth but as its no longer an active process their are some checksum error and its calulation process stops for a while, meanwhile torrent is still downloading , now again when the processor shifts is focus to the torrent and makes it the active process...it again starts calulating from thereon...and just calulates the downloaded data in that time frame due to which it thinks that the a lot of data was downloaded at that point time , so it increases the speed but gradually the speeds retraces to normal.
silly microsoft hyperthreading hehe
hope this helps™



</answer>



<asker's comment>



ty 4 ur answer, its nice 2 see some ppl take this serious and arent just wasters do my nut in. thnx peeps



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Abhishek Shrivastava
Member since: 30 November 2007
Total points: 2657 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



Don't give me 10pts just select my answer as a best answer :d



</answer>



<answer from>



Desyphix
Member since: 30 July 2008
Total points: 260 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



The reason for the spike could possibly be because your computer lags and slows down a little when you're opening and closing applications. Your torrent program doesn't know how to interpret this, and thus shows you how much you've downloaded during the period when it couldn't record download speeds accurately.

In short, it's a burst of data.



</answer>

</answer from>



<answer>



The OBJ file format is a simple data-format that represents 3D geometry alone — namely, the position of each vertex, the texture coordinate associated with a vertex, the normal at each vertex, and the faces that make each polygon.  Can be opened with Autodesk and Cheetah3D



</answer>



<answer from>



Nick
Member since: 18 September 2008
Total points: 238 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



.obj extension represents an object file created while compiling a C or C++ program,
Usually when one C program is created, compiled,linked and executed 4 types of files are created
1.example.c
2.example.obj
3.examole.bak
4.example.exe
the file can be opened in Turbo c++ or even notepad



</answer>



<answer from>



KROFS
Member since: 09 February 2006
Total points: 23700 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Other - Internet



Software



Other - Computers



</answer from>



<answer>



Most likley it is a 3D image file.  This page has info on programs to use to open(I do not know your operating system):
http://www.fileinfo.net/extension/obj



</answer>

Vista is so full of security things running all the time that it is very slow.

<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



smotherc...
Member since: 05 July 2006
Total points: 216 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Vista hangs on AGP440.  How can I install?



I’m trying to do a clean install of Vista Ultimate but it hangs on AGP440 when it restarts.

As it is still in the middle installation I cannot enter Safe Mode and Vista lacks the Recovery Console of XP.

How can I disable this driver and complete the install?

Thanks.



</question>



<answer from>



Marc
Member since: 23 June 2006
Total points: 2891 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Voters</evaluation>



If you're hanging on AGP440 that doesn't necessarily mean that AGP440 is the culprit.  It's probably just the last text entry you see, subsequent drivers are hidden from view.
Personally, I think attempting to bypass this problem mid-way through the installation is futile.

Provided your vista DVD is genuine, then your problem is most likely with your hardware.  Sometimes it's as simple as the DVD reader.  You could also try swapping the graphics card (that would also address your concerns about AGP).



</answer>






<original file>index;_ylt=AjfczaFAcblTtRS846j0mEzbMBVa390.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk35508.txt</current file name>



<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



AuntSall...
Member since: 15 April 2008
Total points: 937 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Need help editing picture in Photoshop



I'm trying to do something really simple and can't do it!

I have one image opened in Photoshop. All I want to do is place/insert another image alongside it, and then flatten them so that they become one image.
Any help appreciated!!



</question>



<answer from>



Zosh
Member since: 08 August 2007
Total points: 3099 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



What makes you think that is so simple.

If you don't care about blending or matching, then I suppose it is. But if you're trying to make it look like they are both in the same photo, that can be a lot of work to do it well.

If you're just trying to put two images side by side, take one and increase the canvas size so that it will be large enough for the second one to fit. Then copy and paste the second image into the first one. Reposition them the way you want and you're done.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Thanks. Did it!



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Sagittarius)
Member since: 01 January 2008
Total points: 7746 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



on one image go to file and select place, then select the file you want to add. then select both layers (shift) and right click and select flatten images.



</answer>



<answer from>



Stefan L
Member since: 29 January 2008
Total points: 3638 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



Expand the canvas size so much that you can fit in both pictures, click and drag the second image to position it right. Then you just click File -&gt; Save as... and choose a file type.



</answer>



<answer from>



Steve S
Member since: 06 October 2007
Total points: 290 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



You'll need to extend the canvas size first on one of your images in order to fit them both in. 
The do 'Select All' on the other image, copy it to the clipboard and then paste it in to the first image.
You can then arrange your images, crop the whole lot if required and then flatten it (or just save it as a jpg file)



</answer>



<answer from>



xTiNA
Member since: 11 June 2007
Total points: 558 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



1) resize the canvas of the original pic (or make a new file that is large enough to place both pics into it, then copy and paste both into it)
2) copy and paste into the original pic



</answer>



<answer from>



Natty-Le...
Member since: 07 September 2006
Total points: 25368 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



If you are wishing to put part of a photo into another one you will first need to cut around the part - maybe using the magnetic lasso tool, or the magic wand tool, then erase the background. You can then open your other picture and drag the cut-out part on top of the other photo and place it where you want it to go. If the edges of the cut-out part look a bit rough you may want to go around the corners carefully with the blur tool a little bit to make it blend more into the background. You may also need to play around with the contrast and colours a little bit to make them match more. When you are happy enough with your image just click on 'layer' then 'flatten image.' This will turn the two photos into one.

It can take quite a long time depending on how good you want it to be. There may be an easier way to do it, but just play around with it and practise. Don't forget to make copies of your originals in case you mess up. :-)



</answer>

<question>



How do you burn photos from the computer to a CD?



I have some pictures that I want to put onto a CD, how do I do it?



</question>



<answer from>



Jessica S
Member since: 03 August 2008
Total points: 180 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



ok hun ill do it in steps.

a) get yourself a blank disk and insert it.
b) open the file where your photos are - minimize it.
c) open up 'my computer' and you will see the icon for blank disk - if your not sure which one - then open your disk drive and the icon on 'my computer' will dissapear - then put your disk back in and the icon will come back - open it. 
d) Ok now simply open up your photos - and click the photo you want and left click - click on copy - and then paste into the file you previously opened for your blank disk.



Ok ? hope your following...

e) last of all if you want all pictures from the same file - highlight all the pictures and then left click and copy - then paste it into your blank disk.



i hope this works - because i have vista so i am not sure if it will work if you dont have vista - but its how i do it,

hope i helped :)



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Thanks so much everyone!



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



top40old...
Member since: 25 August 2006
Total points: 767 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>

<answer from>



MUERTE
Member since: 15 October 2006

Dash R

Total points: 930 (Level 2)

<answer>

</answer>



<answer from>



c
Member since: 28 July 2007
Total points: 228 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



First, insert a blank CD.

A few options should show up on the auto run, and if it does, select the one that has the folder icon.

If the auto run does not show up, go to "my computer" and you will see your cd drive icon, open it and you should be able to drag photos on it like its a folder. When you are done, click the button (usually in the top left corner) that says "write these files to the cd. It should take a minute, and your done!

Depending on the photo size you should be able to fit anywhere from 100 to 800 pictures on one CD. Make sure the size of all the photos does not exceed 700 mb, because that is what one cd can hold.

To check how large the photos you are adding are, select all the photos you are putting on (or select the folder they are in) and right click and go to "properties" and it will show the size there.



Source(s):



ME



</answer>



<answer from>



geekatco...
Member since: 12 July 2008
Total points: 107 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



I wish you would have left more information but ill try. Assuming that you are using Windows XP and have a CD burner then put in a blank writable CD into the CD writer tray. Then close the tray and in Windows XP open up the CD in My Computer. Drag and Drop all of the pictures here or select your pictures copy them and then paste them here. after your done click on Write these files to CD on the left hand side when you are looking at the files on the CD. The files should burn to the CD. Now you can give them to your friend or do what ever you want to do with them.



</answer>



<answer from>



Lauren
Member since: 04 August 2008
Total points: 102 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Hey! I Think I Can Help With This Question!

1. Go to "My Pictures" - DONT FORGET TO INSERT A BLANK CD!!!

2. Open the folder with the pictures you want to burn

3. Look all the way over to the left side of the page

4. Under "Picture Tasks" click on "Copy All Items to CD" and there will be directions to take you through the rest of the process!!!

ALL DONE!!!

<question>



Changing cell size in Excel - Spreadsheet warriors please help a noob



I have a spreadsheet.  One column has the name, and then the next has a long description about what the client has discussed.  The size of the 'comments' box is soo long that you have the press the arrow to go across and read the end of the paragraph.



I want to know how to change the cells from being one long massive box to being a box of a smaller size but with a couple of paragrahs going down, i.e. the box can take up 3-4 lines going down, instead of being one long line across.

Thank you



</question>



<additional details>



THANKS GUYS - I WRAPPED THE TEXT AND IT WAS COOL!



</additional details>



<answer from>



Voda
Member since: 08 July 2008
Total points: 365 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



'Wrap' the text, on 07 it's on the main toolbar near merge cells, can't remember where it is for earlier versions

for earlier..... right click the cell, Format Cells...text Control:Wrap



</answer>



<answer from>



Emily Jo
Member since: 15 June 2008
Total points: 553 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Right click on the column (ie, B) and set the column width for whatever you want it to be.  Then highlight the column and format the cells, turn on text wrapping.



</answer>



<answer from>



The Drunken Fool
Member since: 03 April 2006
Total points: 8236 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



right Click on the letter above the column, then choose format cells, and in the alignment tab choose Wrap Text. Now resize your cells to narrower.

If any of the boxes have text runnoing out through the bottom, double click on the line between the 1 and 2 on the left hand side of the screen, to resize the cells to fit.



</answer>



<answer from>



Chris P
Member since: 23 June 2008
Total points: 710 (Level 2)

<answer>



Select the column you want, and then go to "Format" and "Cells" and then click the button that says "Wrap Text."  This will keep the column width whatever you set it at and the text will go downward.



</answer>



<answer from>



i♥u2
Member since: 15 March 2008
Total points: 2063 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Select the cell with the comments
Click the menu bar [Format] =&gt; [Cell]
Click the tab [Alignment] 
Tick the check box [Shrink to fit]
Tick the check box [Wrap text]



</answer>



<answer from>



Steve O
Member since: 19 December 2006
Total points: 606 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Right-click the cell, and select "Format cells." Click the "Alignment" tab, and select the box that says "Wrap text," and click "OK."

If you move your mouse over the lines separating the column letters, you'll see a double-headed arrow; click and drag the line on the right side of the column until you like the column width.

You might need to go back the "Alignment" tab again and change the vertical alignment so that the cells on that row look right.



</answer>



<answer from>



L S
Member since: 28 August 2006
Total points: 201 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



If you don't have the toolbar turned on or can't find the button to turn wrapping on you can select the column and goto:



(Office 2003 earlier and maybe later versions)
Format Menu --&gt; Cells... --&gt; Alignment Tab --&gt; Click 'Wrap Text' Checkbox

Excel seems to default to bottom alignment for adjacent cells so you may want to select the other columns and in the same area choose a vertical alignment of top.

Finally the most frustrating thing to figure out was how to input a carriage return within a cell... use ALT+SPACE to create paragraphs in your description cells.

Hope that helps.

(edit: answer lag strikes again...)



Source(s):



Years of toil and frustration



</answer>

<answer from>



hbeatit
Member since: 18 June 2008
Total points: 62 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Ok this is called "Cell Wrapping"

Select the cell you have all the writing in

Next select "Format"  (this is located at the top of the screen in the same menu as File, Edit, View, Toolbars etc. etc)

Once you have selected format then select "Cells" 
(a new window should apear with a series of tabs running along the top of it called: Number, alignment, font, border, patterns and protection)

Select the Alignment tab

You should now see on the left hand side of the new window three tick boxes labelled "wrap text", "Shrink to fit" and "Merge Cells"

Check the box labelled "Wrap text"

Select OK from the bottom right hand corner of the window

You should now find that the text fits into one cell and that the cell will change its size to fit the text.

If you find that the cell is too thin and tall or too wide and short then you can manually adjust the size of the cell to your desired size.

You should notice that the cell references (i.e. the row number and colum letter) are orange on the activated cell. in order to manually adjust the size of the cell you have selected (a.k.a. the activated cell)
Move your mouse so that the cursor (white cross) is hovering over the orange column letter.

If you now move your mouse so that the cursor is hovering over the line inbetween two columns you should see the cursor change from a white cross to a balck arrow pointing downwards. once it is pointing downwards hold your left mouse button down and drag it to the right. you see the collumn expanding in size!

This same principle follows for when you want to adjust the height of the column

If you find that a cell is too big for your text, a quick way to get the cell to fit the size of your text is to hover you cursor inbetween the two collumns so that the cursor turns to a black arrow again and double click. This will automatically resize the cell to fit the text within it. ( note the cursor must be a balck arrow in order to do this.

Hope this helps



</answer>



<answer from>



aresee
Member since: 02 June 2007
Total points: 14981 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



As someone has said, you can wrap text, or even merge a couple of cells together. To wrap the text, either right button of mouse, format cells, alignment, wrap text or, if you have already typed it, click in the cell, then click in the formula bar where you can see it and where you want the break in lines use Alt Enter to force the words onto next line within same cell.  Excel is not really designed for long descriptions and as you yourself say it is 'comments' perhaps you should consider using a comment instead of normal cell (right button of mouse insert comment). The comment is then in a separate box which you can move away from the cell in case it covers other data in other columns, and right button of mouse to show or edit comment.  However, as you appear to be using your spreadsheet purely for text, I would advise using a table in Word instead which is more used to text. In that case assuming 2.5 cm margins all the way round and you are working in A4 landscape your first column could be 2 cm wide to accommodate name and the second column 22cm wide to accommodate the comments.  You can always cut and paste rather than retying if you want to try this. It would then automatically go into Word as a table and you just need to change the widths. Another advantage of using Word is, as you type in one cell, when it gets to the end margin of that particular cell the text would automatically wrap to the next line.



</answer>

<question from>



Hazza

</question from>



<question>



Music Ipod /itunes?



Does anyone know how I can regulate the music on my itunes + ipod so there all the same.

Songs are different volumes so im getting quiet songs and when they finished im nearly deafened by the next one which is loud



Know any software that can fix this



</question>



<answer from>



Adi
Member since: 08 August 2007
Total points: 2525 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Voters</evaluation>



There is a setting on your iPod called Sound Check - go to Settings --&gt; Sound Check and turn it on, and this is designed to try and make the volume of all songs the same. There is a similar setting in iTunes, go to Edit --&gt; Preferences, and look under the Playback tab.



</answer>

<question from>

<question>



My sister has just brought a comp with Windows Home Vista Basic preloaded!



Can anyone please give her some hints and tips to use Vista to its full potential? (PS she's not on the web yet, but soon will be)

<answer>



It operates in pretty much the same way as all windows programmes to be honest.
If she wants to change font size, or the background etc then you now have to go through control panel.
Once on the net if you're using wireless then look bottom right for information on your internet connection. You'll be able to see your network and sharing centre manager. Click that and click 'connect or disconnect to a network' to see available wireless networks. Vista will offer solutions to any possible problems.
When you tell it to shut down, unlike XP it will not come up with options of sending it to sleep etc again, it will just shut straight down. So if you want to just log off you HAVE to select that, not shut down, then log off.
She'll get used to it after a week.



Source(s):



I have vista =D



</answer>

<question from>



The Italian Stallion
Member since: 07 July 2008
Total points: 749 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Should i get into torrents



if i do what are good client for macs (utorrent only works on windows and i dont have an intel based mac)



</question>



<answer from>



Ayumi
Member since: 31 July 2008
Total points: 251 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Torrents tend to be hellishly slow and are bandwidth- and CPU-hungry, but if you think it's worth it, I say go for Azureus.

It's a much bigger app than most other clients, but I've downloaded torrents with it, BitTorrent, and Transmission, and Azureus was at least kilobytes ahead with every torrent I tested, if not more.

As long as you don't use other bandwidth- or CPU-hungry apps at the same time, you shouldn't have a problem.

It also has a massive built-in torrent search system and more advanced features than any other client, including those for Windows. As Vin C said, Azureus is the best client for Mac.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



perfect thanks



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Vin C
Member since: 15 February 2008
Total points: 277 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>

<question>



What does  "Either Java script is turned off or you have an old version of macro media's Flash player"  mean?



I received this message and don't know how to respond. Can anyone help?



</question>



<answer from>



Vinícius
Member since: 28 June 2006
Total points: 3591 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



If you are trying to watch some Youtube video you need a plug in called Flash Player. Flash Player allows you to run dynamic content from Internet. The latest version is 9.0. You can easily download and install it from Adobe's website.
You also need java script. Java script is a pack of scripts that "reads" and "runs" the flash player on Youtube.
So, if you have java script turned off or an older version of flash player you will not be able to watch any Youtube video.
.
In order to install flash player, access: http://www.adobe.com/shockwave/download/...

To know how to turn on javascript, access: http://www.btny.purdue.edu/enablejavascr...

You don't have to respond anything. Either you turn javascript on or you install the latest version of Flash Player.

Please leave a comment about my English.
hope it helps.



</answer>



<answer from>



LaLa M
Member since: 04 August 2008
Total points: 137 (Level 1)

Curry C

</answer from>



<answer>



These drivers are in the Manufacturer's CD that is shipped with your computer. If you don't have this CD (either they didn't supply it when you purchased your computer or you have lost it), you have to go to Fujisu Siemens' web site and download them from there.

Windows update will NOT have them as they are all proprietary drivers specific to the motherboard you are using.



</answer>

<question from>



gvih2g2
Member since: 14 August 2006
Total points: 8247 (Level 5)



</question from>



<question>



What's the SIMPLEST free photo editing software?



My father (65) has recently got into digital photography, and would like to edit some of his photos on his computer.

He doesn't want to pay for photo editing software, and he'd be scared by anything complicated. If it can crop and fix red-eye, that would be great. If it lets him fiddle with brightness/contrast in quite a basic way, or make his photos black and white, that would be even better, but that's as far as he'll go.

If it has massive menus with bewildering options, he just won't use it. He doesn't want to work with layers, or apply complex filters, or convert from RAW (his point-n-shoot just takes jpegs), or any of that. Just make his snapshots look a bit better, not create works of art.

What do you recommend?



</question>



<answer from>



Nick T
Member since: 03 August 2008
Total points: 269 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Hi, my recommendations are below:

1. Photoscape
Website: http://www.photoscape.org
Direct Download: http://download.photoscape.org/PhotoScap...
Some Features:
Viewer: View your folders photos, slideshow 
Editor: resizing, brightness and color adjustment, white balance, backlight correction, frames, balloons, mosaic mode, adding text, drawing pictures, cropping, filters, red eye removal, blooming 
Batch editor: Batch editing multiple photos



2. Paint.Net
Website: http://www.getpaint.net/
Direct Download: http://www.dotpdn.com/downloads/pdnsrc.h...
Short Description:
Paint.NET includes simple tools for drawing shapes, including an easy-to-use curve tool for drawing splines or Bezier curves. The Gradient tool, new for 3.0, has been cited as an innovative improvement over similar tools provided by other software. The facilities for creating and working with selections is powerful, yet still simple enough to be picked up quickly. Other powerful tools include the Magic Wand for selecting regions of similar color, and the Clone Stamp for copying or erasing portions of an image. There is also a simple text editor, a tool for zooming, and a Recolor tool.



Good Luck! Happy Editing!
Nick~



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Thanks, I think those are the two most worth trying. I hear that gimp is fiddly, MS Paint is TOO simple, and Photobucket is owned by Murdoch (I don't do Murdoch).



</asker's comment>

it is easy to use, fast and it works perfect for me.. give it a try, you'll love it

http://www.vso-software.fr/products/conv...



It can convert any video file.. like



avi, divx, xvid, mov, mkv, flv ,youtube,  mpeg1, mpeg2, mpeg-, nsv, dvr-ms, tivo, ts, ifo, vob, asf, wmv, realmedia, rm, rmvb, ogm,



2. Add or drag-n-drop as many video files as the DVD can handle



3. Insert blank DVD



4. Click "Convert"



5. Enjoy watching those video files on your home DVD player! =)

<answer>



as A L said, your hard drive is full. You need to look for things to delete because if you have less than 350mb left on your drive, you are in sad shape.

<question from>



EmmaRAHH...
