</question from>



<question>



How do you wipe itunes?



I am trying to wipe my itunes and re add everything how could i do this?



</question>



<answer from>



Stephen H
Member since: 05 August 2008
Total points: 106 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



If you are on a PC, you can uninstall iTunes in Add/Remove Programs.



If you are on a Mac, delete the database files in Users/[YourUserID]/Music/iTunes Music and the Itunes Settings Files from Users/[YourUserID/Library/Preferences]



You can also delete the iTunes application from your Applications folder and then Reinstall it from your Mac OS X DVD, or from Apple's Web Site.



</answer>



<answer from>



Smita
Member since: 25 July 2008
Total points: 228 (Level 1)

</question from>



<question>



I have Audacity, but how do I change something from an .aup to an .mp3? Details please...!!!?



It says something about locating lame_end.dll when I click on to Export as Mp3, but the Export selection as mp3 isnt highlighted...



</question>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



Youtube, enter Andacity into the search and watch on



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



Under file drop down menu click on export As mp3



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



You need a codec.  That's a bit of software that puts the music into an mp3 file or back.  lame_end.dll can be downloaded easily,  try http://www.dll-files.com/dllindex/dll-fi...

Put the file in C:\windows\system32, restart Audacity and all should be well.



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



firstly 
you need to tell Audaicty where to find Lame_enc.dll



you may well have this in the media player folder, or another audio package so first search your system for it, 
failing that you can download it fairly easily from DLL-FILES.COM

once you have it, back to audacity and go to file &gt; export as MP3

the first time you run it it will ask you to show it where lame_enc is, and after that it will run everytime.

once you push export as MP3 than you can add tags to it, and then it takes a wee while to do the compression etc.



Source(s):



tried the same thing myself when i was ripping old C90 cassettes



</answer>

<question>



I am getting a unusual process started in my task manager namely u3225|9373x998067193u7658634g1...



how to end this process....
i find this type of process(2 in no.)already running(actually not responding) in my task manager when i switch on my pc and as i end these processes ,speed goes up !!and every thing starts working as usual ,(i think this process is related with runmgr.exe)



</question>



<answer from>



Peter Shwarmberger
Member since: 26 July 2008
Total points: 341 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



This is a well known virus caused by downloading hard core pornography on your computer.



I suggest you just download a trial version of some anti-virus software and that should clean it up.



Source(s):



personal experience



</answer>



<answer from>



C-bug
Member since: 29 September 2007
Total points: 5065 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Software



Security



</answer from>



<answer>



If you suspect you have an infection, there are several things you must do - and this sure sounds like some form of malware.  Unfortunately, if you find one infection, it is highly likely you have another one. A virus, trojan or worm are all different types of infections/malware and there are some great FREE programs that can help you.

First, clean up (delete) your cookies, temp files and temporary internet files. I prefer to use Ccleaner to do this, rather than the built-in DISK CLEANUP, as I feel it does a much more thorough job - for example, it will clean out the index files on your next reboot.



If you want to use Disk Cleanup, you can find it if you:
- Double-Click on My Computer to open it up
- RIGHT-click on your C: drive 
- Choose PROPERTIES and then click on the DISK CLEANUP button
- When done, reboot your computer.
Delete these files daily or run Ccleaner every day right before you shut your computer down.



2 - You should also have a good anti-virus program to help protect your computer. AVG Free, Avast or Avira are excellent anti-virus programs. You can't go wrong in choosing any one of these 3.

3 -Since NONE of the anti- spyware or anti- adware programs are 100% accurate in finding and removing spyware, you need at least two programs which you will run one after the other, not at the same time.

There are three excellent free ones:
- Spybot, Search and Destroy
- Ad-Aware
- Spyware Blaster



You will need to download, install, update (and IMMUNIZE in Spybot) and run them, one at a time. Be careful with the NAME of these programs - there are "look-alikes" with very similar names, that are in fact spyware themselves! Reboot after you install each one!

After this current infection is cleared up, be sure to run both of the above programs at least once a week if you are on the internet frequently and/or like to download music or files.



NOTE: Some infections prevent your from downloading the above programs. You may have to use a clean computer to download the programs and copy them to a thumb drive or CD. Then transfer the install files to the infected computer and run.

--Occasionally you will not be able to run these programs without being in SAFE MODE.  To get there, reboot your computer and tap the F8 key, repeatedly until a menu comes up.  You want to choose SAFE MODE WITH NETWORKING.

4 -You should also have a good firewall to help protect your computer. Zone Alarm makes a totally free version (watch you don't download the 30-day free trial of the paid version). You can download this from the manufacturer at zonelabs dot com



HTH : )
Good luck!

PS - Most of the above programs can be found at www.download.com



</answer>

<question>

I have my electric guitar plugged into an effects pedal and then into the soundcard on my pc. I can record and playback with effects but the problem is, I can't hear what I'm playing as I record. What software will have a monitor function where my PC will allow me to hear what I'm playing while it records? Should I just do it the old fashioned wat and use a mic in front of my guitar amp?



</question>



<answer from>



Henry Hedgehog
Member since: 17 April 2008
Total points: 2151 (Level 3)

<answer>



The "old fashioned way" is how they do it in recording studios nine times out of ten.

The reason for this is that the amp forms an important part of an electric guitarist's sound.



</answer>

Shock's in the Mud
Member since: 05 October 2006

<answer from>



Callum W
Member since: 10 June 2008
Total points: 1055 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



I use this cheap little thing
http://www.google.co.uk/products?sourcei...

It has amp modeling and you can monitor through the computer

What you can try and do is right click on the speaker icon in the bottom right of the screan and select playback device. Then put the volumes up on everything and play around untill you hear the input through your speakers

Another way is to use a double ended headphone jack
http://www.niharsworld.com/wp-content/up...
And plug one end in the headphone input of your effects pedal and then the other end into your speakers or computer speakers

What I do is plug my sterieo into the headphone jack so I can hear what I am playing aswell as the computer recording : )
hope that helps



</answer>

<answer>



Put it this way.  I just went about twenty miles and gave the lady my money for a new library card, and told her I could live without the Internet connection but not without the books.

I definitely think books are underrated.  While the Internet is a new paradigm and it has its strengths, there are systemizations in the discourse you find in books which, when applied to documents on the web impair your ability to use the web effectively.



In essence I don't have a preference but I see the library as valuable as something to learn first, and the place to go (especially given reference librarians) to get information on something I know nothing about, before I go to the web.

Maybe we can live without professional reporters but we can't live without professional librarians and Kindle doesn't do it for me.

<original file>index;_ylt=AhQpDlh7sLNZgfoKNHKNxrkgBgxab72.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk42999.txt</current file name>



<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



Alexa B
Member since: 09 March 2008
Total points: 1215 (Level 3)



</question from>



<question>



Can yuo help me make a pie chart in Microsoft Excel 2007??



ok. so this is the data i need to put in

If Shopping What Are You Here to Do (this is the question)
(these are the answers)
food
clothes
shoes
household goods
furniture
other



how can i put these in and make a pie chart? complete run through would be great thanks!!!



</question>



<answer from>



aresee
Member since: 02 June 2007
Total points: 16131 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Pie charts are the easiest of all to create because they are not comparative and therefore you don't have a Y or X axis to worry about. Presumably you will have two columns of data, Col A the row labels, i.e. food, clothes etc (starting row 2) and the figures alongside in col b. Row 1 should contain the column description, i.e. Item, Amount or something like that.

Highlight both columns EXCLUDING column headings, then up to insert on the Menu and click on the Pie chart icon. This will immediately create a small pie chart near to your data. Either right button of mouse down to move chart so it is placed on a separate sheet full size, or up to the toolbar area, last icon, move chart location. Once it is full size, you can play around with it through the design, layout or format icons which are underneath the Menu chart tools.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



thanksyou!!!!!! great help!!



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Matt W
Member since: 20 May 2008
Total points: 487 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Couldn't be easier in 2007:
Put all the categories in a row of cells, then put all the numbers next to the relevant categories.
Highlight all the data you've just put in (both rows) and then go to the insert tab.
Click on the pie chart symbol and select one of the charts (doesnt matter which, id use the first one) from the dropdown.
Job done!



</answer>



<answer from>



selvakum...
Member since: 23 August 2008
Total points: 314 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>

200

household goods  3000

500

60

select both the rows and the columns after the data in entered
then click the graph button or go to data and then graph - click the button which is self guided and will help you to draw the pie chart.



</answer>

<category>

<question from>



james a
Member since: 03 July 2008
Total points: 631 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Windows host process (Rundll32) has stopped working?



this message appears whenever I click on a file in drive D. what is it and how can I fix it? please help, Thanks.



</question>



<additional details>



drive D is a partition on my hard drive. it's 80 Gb.



Im running vista and I have access to all files and programmes. It's just the message that keeps appearing.



</additional details>



<answer from>



fleetcom...
Member since: 22 July 2008
Total points: 3166 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



NTFS 
A computer running Windows XP or Windows 2000 can access files on an NTFS partition. A computer running Windows NT 4.0 with Service Pack 4 or later might be able to access some files. Other operating systems allow no access.



FAT
Access is available through MS-DOS, all versions of Windows, Windows NT, Windows 2000, Windows XP, and OS/2.

FAT 32
Access is available only through Windows 95 OSR2, Windows 98, Windows Millennium Edition, Windows 2000, and Windows XP.

have you installed some software you need to get to.
if so what is it.because sometimes a change to the file name works.



</answer>



<answer from>



kiran P
Member since: 17 September 2008
Total points: 84 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



open d: drive from MS dos..
copy to sum where..
format OS (C:drive)



</answer>

<question from>



craig___
Member since: 16 October 2007
Total points: 87 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



AOL 9.0VR problem, help anyone?



Does anyone know how to stop AOL 9.0 VR starting up when windows is started? I'd rather just double click the icon on the desktop when I want to go online, instead of waiting ages on AOL loading up when I may not even want to use the net.



Thanks



</question>



<answer from>



sheik_se...
Member since: 18 May 2007
Total points: 3562 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Voters</evaluation>



AOL  9 doesn't like it if it's not in the Start Up folder, and will display a nag window every time you use a browser, whether you go on-line or not. If it's not taken out of theSU folder, it will also run several resource hogs in the background without telling - you even it you don't use the browser!.



You have to remove it from the 'Start Up' folder, but Windows can start up  programs automatically from other places as well, so you might have to look at the 'config' files also.  There's alot of sites that tell you how to do this. Master Your Windows , Win Patrol and other programs can do it for you - search for and download them. I think download.com has them, or similar programs.



</answer>

<answer>



You can get traffic by trying a free traffic exchange service like TrafficSwarm at http://www.trafficswarm.com/go.cgi?56268...
or WebCentreSurf at http://webcentresurf.com/?27972
Try StumbleUpon at http://www.stumbleupon.com and add your site to your favorites.
You can try article marketing at an article submission service like http://www.ezinearticles.com and link back to your website in the resource box for your articles.
You can also comment on popular blogs like John Chow's or Joel Comm's that allow linkbacks to your URL. Do a Yahoo Search.
Create a video and upload it to YouTube with your URL flashed on the screen. All of these are free.

http://www.eco-snob.com

<answer from>



KROFS
Member since: 09 February 2006
Total points: 23678 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Other - Internet



Software



Other - Computers



</answer from>



<answer>



ABC is a bit outdated.  It has not been updated since 2005 and there has been alot of change in bittorrent.
This article discusses the best free bittorrent clients and has links to downloads and setup guides for the best:
http://www.techsupportalert.com/best-fre...



You go to torrent search sites to find content that you want.  This article discusses the most popular torrent search sites:
http://www.techsupportalert.com/content/...



When you find content you want, then you download a small file (the torrent) associated with the content.  When the torrent is opened in your bittorrent client, transfer of the associated content begins.



The url that ABC is asking for is the url of the torrent.  Much easier just to download and open the torrent file.



</answer>

<question>



Can anyone tell me a program that lets me type in codes for SQL like oracle plus * sql?

<answer>



Can you re-phrase the question?



</answer>



<answer from>



senorita
Member since: 10 May 2006
Total points: 133 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



if u mean like a notepad then there's notepad++ which is a freeware i believe. But u wont be able to test ur queries/codes here. It just serves as a notepad but is able to differentiate ur codes andhighlights commands making it easier to write. example SELECT will be bolded and in blue color whereas table names and whatnot is left as normal text. and u can choose a range of different coding languages to use. However if ur requiring something to test ur codes then u have toad, SQL Tools, SQL Plus etc.



</answer>



<answer from>



rk
Member since: 10 December 2007
Total points: 581 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Oracle provides SQL Developer for free (http://www.oracle.com/technology/product... which will certainly be much better than SQL*Plus and has some of the features you're looking for.  If you're willing to pay, I'd suggest PL/SQL Developer (www.allroundautomations.com).  Finally TOAD is very popular (www.quest.com) but is significantly more expensive than PL/SQL Developer and (IMHO) not generally worth the additional money.



Source(s):



http://www.orafaq.com/tools/comparison



</answer>

ye its a gift card :)



</additional details>



<answer from>



APW
Member since: 31 May 2006
Total points: 989 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Voters</evaluation>



1.Go to iTunes Store
2.Click on Redeem under Quick Links.
3.Scratch off the silver stuff on the back of the card to see your code.
4.Type that code in exactly as you see it on the card.



Hope that helps!

<question>

</question>

how the hell is zipping it gonna work? zip it up into wut? and wut do i convert it with? seriously.

<answer from>



Firefox
Member since: 17 October 2007
Total points: 751 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Use PowerISO 
http://www.poweriso.com/
then mark the 3 .dmg files and right click them &gt; choose power iso &gt; add to image file &gt; then choose the kind of image file .daa .bin .iso



</answer>

<answer>



http://www.versiontracker.com/dyn/morein...

Microsoft GIF Animator is a historical computer software program for Microsoft Windows to create simple animated GIF files based on the GIF89a file format. Animations could be looped, spun, faded in and out; users could set the size and transparency of images. Automatic or custom palette creation was supported.



Source(s):



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microsoft_G...

<original file>index;_ylt=AssYkzFCykBXanwVs3YEyASxBwx1886.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk47806.txt</current file name>



<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



Christin...
Member since: 22 March 2006
Total points: 11041 (Level 6)



</question from>



<question>



Help with excel, I'm getting the following message when I'm trying to add details to a spreadsheet?



'To prevent loss of data Microsoft excel cannot shift non blank cells off the worksheet'

The worksheet has macros and added formula's, any ideas on how I can get the rest of the details added into the same work sheet. thanks for your help



</question>



<answer from>



jmorge
Member since: 30 January 2006
Total points: 5991 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Programming & Design



Software



Other - Computers



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



sounds like you've apparently got some data in either the very last row of the very last column.  Then you're trying to insert a column or row that by doing so it would "push" the data off the sheet (perhaps your macro is doing an insert?)

for example create a blank sheet.  enter "test" in A1.  Then enter "test" in IV1.  Now try and insert a column anywhere inbetween. You'll get the same error message.

try pressing &lt;END&gt; then &lt;HOME&gt;. This will jump you to the very last cell that excel shows to be and the end of your spreadsheet.  I suspect you're going to jump to column IV or to the very last row somewhere.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



thanks ,thats sorted now.



</asker's comment>

yellow_t...

<question>



What is a "windows command line"?



Someone told me,in order to help me do something,to run 2 commands in a windows command line.Personally,I don't have any idea of what that is...can someone help me please,and tell me what it is and how to do it?



</question>



<answer from>



gamartin...
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 107 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



You can get to command line by clicking start and then run. Also a shortcut to command line is Windows key and hit R at the same time.



</answer>



<answer from>



woodyard...
Member since: 30 September 2008
Total points: 152 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



To get to the windows command line interface:
Click Start
Click Run
Type "cmd" into the dialogue box
Then hit enter.



You can also get there by hitting



Windows Key + R
Type "cmd"
Enter



</answer>



<answer from>



prolinux...
Member since: 20 September 2008
Total points: 376 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



The command line is a type of user interface which allows a user to interact with the computer by typing in commands.



To get to the command line, either



Start -&gt; Run -&gt; type cmd (win2000 and newer)
Start -&gt; Run -&gt; type command (winME and lower)



You can also press Start (on keyboard) and R to bring up the run box.



</answer>



<answer from>



james
Member since: 02 March 2008
Total points: 395 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



start &gt; run &gt;type cmd



you can type /? after the initial command if you keep getting the syntax wrong.



example = cd /?



</answer>

<answer>



Look at DeVeDe (Linux). As far as artifacts, you have to run a filter on the captured movie before the DVD. The cause is video is an "upper" and "lower" field. Anti-aliasing will blend the two fields into one dot.



a command-line video convertor called ffmpeg, excellent and has several gui front ends that basically have all the presets in lists. One example is kdenlive. And mencoder, similar transcoder software. Google mencoder on youtube.



And, I'm only telling about the Linux stuff because you can try it free.

<question from>



caretosh...
Member since: 16 July 2007
Total points: 2773 (Level 4)



</question from>



<question>



Which is most popular in the design industry - Adobe Indesign or QuarkXpress?



</question>



<answer from>



merlina
Member since: 29 June 2007
Total points: 2073 (Level 3)



Contributing In:



Higher Education (University +)



</answer from>



<answer>



The simple answer, until quite recently was Quark. Professional design studios and up-market/large publishing houses (newspapers and magazines), invariably used Quark.

Quark, however, is very expensive and not really intuitive to use - although it does have the advantage of being quite easy to customise. If your body text is, for eg, 10pt Times, then it's easy to program one button to do that and set it out over the correct width and leading.
I haven't used the latest InDesign, but I don't believe that's the case with that.

More recently, however some companies have been moving over to the Adobe product, particularly smaller ones.

Adobe do a much better deal for universities and colleges, so people generally have more opportunity to learn this while they're in education. And then people like to stick with a product they know

I predict that Adobe will continue to grow in popularity unless Quark does something with its pricing



</answer>



<answer from>



jenga
Member since: 01 August 2008
Total points: 289 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I've been a graphic designer for almost three years and I would say that Quark is still top when it comes to a layout package. Though I must admit, I am finding myself using Indesign more frequently. Also you can find software usage can differ between areas of a country. Freehand for example is software I very rarely use as Illustrator does the job so much better, but some places still stand by Freehand in the way I prefer Quark. Personally I think Quark is the best software as its easy to use and has everything you need. Indesign however seems to have long ways round a simple action. Use both of them I would say to keep you on top.



Source(s):



I'm a graphic Designer with experience and qualifications!



</answer>

<question>



Where does MS internet explorer store files as it downloads them?



i was downloading a large file but my connection was lost, i've checked the temp internet folder and its not there. i know that the program doesn't store the file in the temp internet folder as it downloads but it must put it somewhere before transferring it to the destination folder, any ideas?



</question>



<answer from>



manu_m
Member since: 19 August 2008
Total points: 305 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



it is in memory. when it is fully copied to mem, it gets into temp folder.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



thx



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Holy Heck Hosting
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 188 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Open Internet Explorer, and open  &gt;&gt; Tools &gt;&gt; Internet Options &gt;&gt; Settings &gt;&gt; View Files .. a new window will pop-up and all your temporary internet files will be displayed. If it's not there then it will not have saved to your computer.



There is another possibility that it saved to another location. If "Search" doesn't locate the file, go to the same site and download the file again, but when you click "Save", check the path the file is saving to - it will be the same place as it downloaded to before when you were disconnected.



I hope this helps - good luck.



http://holyheck.com
Holy Heck Hosting - shockingly good deals on hosting and domains.



</answer>



<answer from>



kev.hall...
Member since: 24 April 2008
Total points: 1553 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



if the file transfer was terminated the file will not have been created and therfore will not exist on your disk. The parts of the file that you have received so far will have been written to the disk but with no file headers you will not be able to access it. Depending upon your operating system or download software, the file transfer may be resumed.



</answer>

<question from>



Agent S
Member since: 25 February 2008
Total points: 330 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



What are some pros and cons when switching to linux?



</question>



<answer from>



Brian F
Member since: 29 March 2008
Total points: 14178 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Laptops & Notebooks



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



I'll touch on the cons first, because the list is a LOT shorter, (I'm not saying less important to you, just shorter.)



1.  Although wine can run *some* windows programs (office - some versions, games, etc.) don't expect to be able to run any programs written for windows.



Now for the Pros: (Yea, the only con is it won't run windows program.)



1. Security
2. Speed
3. Cost (free)
4. Community support
5. Literally tens of thousands of open-source (free) programs available.  You can find an open-source program to do just about anything you can buy a windows program to do.  OK, the high-end games aren't available, but there are a lot of games available also, even some 3D  First-person games.
6. Because windows programs won't run on Linux, neither will most viruses, spyware, trojans.
7.  Ease of installing, upgrading, and un-installing programs.  For the most part, any program you want to install, you can use your package manager to install.  Just start the package manager, select the program you want to install, clck the box and tell it to install.  Linux will go out, download the program and install it for you.
8.  No registry to get corrupted.  Linux configurations, options etc. are all stored in plain text files.  There is no windows "registry" to grow, get huge, corrupted, bloated and crash or slow your system.
9.  Actually, despite what you might have heard in the past, it has better over-all hardware support than windows, and you usually never even have to go download a driver.  (WAY better than Vista's hardware support)  There are exception, don't buy Kodak printers if you want to use Linux...  Apparently  Kodak is sucking on Micro$oft's tit or something.  The Open Source community has offered to write drivers FOR them, if they would just release some specs, but they refuse to do so.
There are many many more advantages, such as not being tied to proprietary standards, being hugely customizable, not being locked to one vendor etc...  But we don't have to explain everything to you, go try it for yourself.



You don't have to make a "jump" to linux.  I'd suggest Ubuntu or Kubuntu http://ubuntu.com http://kubuntu.com  The difference between the two is primarily the user interface.  Kubuntu uses KDE, ubuntu uses GNOME, KDE is a little more like Windows than GNOME... but even then you aren't limited... even if you install ubuntu, you can still install and run KDE, and vice-versa.



Ubuntu/Kubuntu (and many other distros) uses a "Live CD" to install from.  This means you can download, burn a CD and boot from the CD.



You have the option of either installing or running it from the CD.  You can boot directly from the CD and "play around" with the system to see what it's like and never install anything to your hard drive.  (Of course, when you reboot, anything you 'saved" or modified, will be gone when using the "Live CD" mode.)



Also, keep in mind that it will not run as fast from the CD as it will if you install it to the hard drive, but you can still get a taste for it.



If you decide to install it, either version will re-size your windows partition on your hard drive, and install itself into the space created.  It will install a GRUB Boot Loader, that allows you to boot into either Ubuntu or Windows, so you will still have the choice.  Later, if you wish, you can delete the windows partition and increase the size of the Ubuntu partition to fill up your entire hard drive.  You can even access your windows data from Ubuntu to copy over pictures, music etc.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



That was a very helpful answer. Thank you.



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



f100_sup...
Member since: 17 October 2006
Total points: 11800 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



Pro:
1. Easier to write and/or modify programing if you know HOW.
2. Not QUITE as prone to most malware AT THIS TIME, (most is written for windows.)
3. Easily adapted to MANY concurrent users, (which is one of the reasons it is popular for servers,) and remote access from "dumb" terminals.



Cons:
1. Similar to Vista in that for a LOT of accessories, (video cards, sound cards, printers, etc.,) there are NO drivers available that take advantage of ALL the options available.
2. Usually LESS tech help available for problems.
3. For gamers there are MANY fewer games available and for other users there is much less "specialty" programing available.



Overall, it depends on what you need, and whether or not you are capable of writing your own programs for most "limited interest" uses for which commercial programs are either not available or outrageously expensive.



Source(s):



retired programmer.
I use Linux, Unix, 3 Versions of Windows, and DOS among others, depending on what I need to do!



</answer>



<answer from>



Jesse
Member since: 20 August 2008
Total points: 3323 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



Pros - Faster, more efficient. Improved device support. You don't have to break laws to do certain things. Low cost. Very friendly community.



Cons - If something goes wrong, it can be difficult to fix if you don't know whats going on. Some devices, like NVidia videocards, can be extremely difficult to install, and require extensive use of the terminal. Not always as user friendly as paid OSs



</answer>



<answer from>



thesnake...
Member since: 13 December 2007
Total points: 217 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Main topic details:
http://www.computerhope.com/issues/ch000...



My opinion, I like windows because I'm a gamer and I play on pc. Almost all big titles (Call of Duty 4, Team Fortress 2, Counter Strike, ect) run only on windows. On linux, there isn't as much support and compatibility, that goes for applications and programs too.



</answer>



<answer from>



Mercuri
Member since: 06 May 2008
Total points: 5001 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Software



Laptops & Notebooks



</answer from>



<answer>



Pros: It's open source.  Command line input.  Fully customizable.  Fast.



Cons: Steep learning curve.  Relatively little software available.



</answer>



<answer from>



caay10
Member since: 03 October 2008
Total points: 111 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



are you on rdms



ms duarte ?



</answer>

<answer>



Windows Media Player

<answer from>



Morph
Member since: 14 June 2008
Total points: 190 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



There are a number of programs available, the one I use most often is DVD Decrypter.  You can use it to grab the ISO image of the DVD, and then use Nero or DVD Shrink to burn it onto another disc.



NOTE: This is STRICTLY for making a backup copy of Stuff that you already own.  Do not try to be a pirate, as that usually ends badly.



</answer>

<answer>



Start&gt;run&gt;type"msconfig"&gt;



now select startup tab select disable all



now go to boot.ini
change time out from 30 sec to 3 sec!
now click "advanced options"
select num proc and click max no.(generally 2)
click apply
restart
see changes!!!!!

<question from>



anshu s
Member since: 17 September 2008
Total points: 84 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Wat is the difference bw upload and download?



</question>



<answer from>



yap_jp
Member since: 02 July 2007
Total points: 36396 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Software



Other - Computers



Security



</answer from>



<answer>



Upload means you give to other and download means you take from other



</answer>



<answer from>



zimmi200...
Member since: 24 March 2007
Total points: 1881 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Uploading is when you take a file or data from your computer and send it to another computer or server. Downloading is when you receive a file or data from another computer or server.



I hope this helps!



</answer>



<answer from>



amit
Member since: 21 August 2008
Total points: 347 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



If u r uplaoding anything to website (i.e.movie, pics. etc.) its uploading.



If u r downloding anything from the net thats download



</answer>



<answer from>



wazimu
Member since: 16 July 2008
Total points: 280 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Say you had a picture and you want it to go to another computer eg a web server host, you upload the picture to the web server.



If you wanted some picture at another computer or server, you download it to your computer.



It is all about transfering the data to or from



</answer>



<answer from>



Coboy186...
Member since: 02 October 2008
Total points: 176 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



upload you are going to change something



download you take somthing



Source(s):



http://gessi-software.blogspot.com/2008_...



</answer>



<answer from>



Shona sharma
Member since: 04 August 2008
Total points: 280 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



when u load any thing from net to ur computer it means download and when u load anythning from ur computer to net it means upload



</answer>



<answer from>



hellride...
Member since: 02 October 2008
Total points: 143 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Upload means you give to other and download means you take from other



</answer>



<answer from>



Ian
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 115 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Upload is when you put a file on a server or website for others to see/use, download is when you take a file from a server/website, for example downloading music.



</answer>

<original file>3038.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk51590.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



Krishna
Member since: 18 October 2006
Total points: 457 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



How to attache a scanned pdf file to an excel sheet?



I use Vista Home Premium.



I want to attach a few scanned pdf files to my excel sheet to refer them.How do i do this?



</question>



<answer from>



brayden
Member since: 17 August 2008
Total points: 1498 (Level 3)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



When you say "attach" do you mean Insert? I'm going to assume yes.



Which version of Excel do you have? Is it Excel 2007 or Excel 2003?



For excel 2007:



On the ribbon click insert, then look to the right to the TEXT group, click "OBJECT" and then Click Adobe Acrobat Document, and then find your document and insert.



For Excel 2003:



On the toolbar click INSERT, OBJECT, select Adobe Acrobat Document, then find your document and insert.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Thanks that really helped.Yes i meant insert and i use excel 2007



</asker's comment>

<question>



What is the difference between the dos, windows and unix?



</question>



<answer from>



oni-kun ^^
Member since: 27 July 2008
Total points: 9430 (Level 5)



Contributing In:

<answer>



DOS was the first OS out there. It was made by Microsoft.



Linux Travolds created Unix which was basically the same but more powerful.



Microsoft now created Windows which is more advanced.



And others created Linux off of Unix which is more secure then Windows but less used.



</answer>



<answer from>



Jon P
Member since: 03 October 2008
Total points: 98 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



They are all trademarked operating systems for personal computers. Windows is the odd one out as Dos and unix are both mainframe systems.



</answer>



<answer from>



Sagar Mahajan
Member since: 27 July 2008
Total points: 4259 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



DOS, short for "Disk Operating System",[1] is a shorthand term for several closely related operating systems that dominated the IBM PC compatible market between 1981 and 1995, or until about 2000 if one includes the partially DOS-based Microsoft Windows versions Windows 95, 98, and Me.



Microsoft Windows is a series of software operating systems and graphical user interfaces produced by Microsoft. Microsoft first introduced an operating environment named Windows in November 1985 as an add-on to MS-DOS in response to the growing interest in graphical user interfaces



Unix (officially trademarked as UNIX, sometimes also written as Unix with small caps) is a computer operating system originally developed in 1969 by a group of AT&T employees at Bell Labs, including Ken Thompson, Dennis Ritchie, Douglas McIlroy, and Joe Ossanna. Today's Unix systems are split into various branches, developed over time by AT&T as well as various commercial vendors and non-profit organizations.



Source(s):



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DOS
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microsoft_W...
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix



</answer>



<answer from>



aaaaa a
Member since: 25 September 2008
Total points: 115 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



dos is an character oriented; single user;system



you can not share files between 2 dos pc in older dos system.



windows is an multiuser GUI support system where you can access each & every thing easily inspite of issuning command each time as compare to dos. Each task u perform os will invoke commands for you internally



unix is similar to dos as character oriented system support diskless client provide high security by making shadow oassword file . unix is basically for network while dos & windos are not.



unix is also an multiuser system.



</answer>

you cant change it. you must open it with a program that can open it. try googling winrar. it has a 40 day trial and this will open it. for zip, just right click desktop and say new&gt;winrar zip archive. then name it and drag ur stuff to it. but yeah to open it use winrar. you can also use 7 zip but winrar is way better in my opinon

<answer>



The same purpose as any other operating system. A computer is simply a calculating device which does nothing on it's own but is capable of responding to instructions that it understands. Now if you wanted to create a diary for example, you could spend hours and hours writing such a programme or you could simply install an operating system which has a method of communication already set up along with a host of programmes and basics.



So for example when you turn your pc on, you see a screen with all your icons, well they come from your operating system. Windows vista is just another type of operating system with different layout etc.



</answer>

3) To encourage users to upgrade their hardware thus promoting the interests of their hardware partners (such as  Intel).
.....

<answer from>



jtodd_00...
Member since: 19 May 2008
Total points: 1450 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Windows Vista (pronounced /ˈvɪstə/) is a line of operating systems developed by Microsoft for use on personal computers, including home and business desktops, laptops, Tablet PCs, and media center PCs. Prior to its announcement on July 22, 2005, Windows Vista was known by its codename Longhorn.[3] Development was completed on November 8, 2006; over the following three months it was released in stages to computer hardware and software manufacturers, business customers, and retail channels. On January 30, 2007, it was released worldwide,[4] and was made available for purchase and download from Microsoft's website.[5] The release of Windows Vista came more than five years after the introduction of its predecessor, Windows XP, the longest time span between successive releases of Microsoft Windows.
Windows Vista contains many changes and new features, including an updated graphical user interface and visual style dubbed Windows Aero, improved searching features, new multimedia creation tools such as Windows DVD Maker, and redesigned networking, audio, print, and display sub-systems. Vista also aims to increase the level of communication between machines on a home network, using peer-to-peer technology to simplify sharing files and digital media between computers and devices. Windows Vista includes version 3.0 of the .NET Framework, which aims to make it significantly easier for software developers to write applications than with the traditional Windows API.
Microsoft's primary stated objective with Windows Vista, however, has been to improve the state of security in the Windows operating system.[6] One common criticism of Windows XP and its predecessors has been their commonly exploited security vulnerabilities and overall susceptibility to malware, viruses and buffer overflows. In light of this, Microsoft chairman Bill Gates announced in early 2002 a company-wide "Trustworthy Computing initiative" which aims to incorporate security work into every aspect of software development at the company. Microsoft stated that it prioritized improving the security of Windows XP and Windows Server 2003 above finishing Windows Vista, thus delaying its completion.[7]
While these new features and security improvements have garnered positive reviews, Vista has also been the target of much criticism and negative press. Criticism of Windows Vista has targeted high system requirements, its more restrictive licensing terms, the inclusion of a number of new digital rights management technologies aimed at restricting the copying of protected digital media, lack of compatibility with certain pre-Vista hardware and software, and the number of authorization prompts for User Account Control. As a result of these and other issues, Windows Vista has seen adoption and satisfaction rates lower than Windows XP.[8]



Windows Vista is intended to be a technology-based release, to provide a base to include advanced technologies, many of which are related to how the system functions and thus not readily visible to the user. An example is the complete restructuring of the architecture of the audio, print, display, and networking subsystems; although the results of this work are visible to software developers, end-users will only see what appear to be evolutionary changes in the user interface.
Vista includes technologies such as ReadyBoost and ReadyDrive which employ fast flash memory (located on USB drives and hybrid hard disk drives) to improve system performance by caching commonly used programs and data. This manifests itself in improved battery life on notebook computers as well, since a hybrid drive can be spun down when not in use. Another new technology called SuperFetch utilizes machine learning techniques to analyze usage patterns to allow Windows Vista to make intelligent decisions about what content should be present in system memory at any given time. It uses almost all the extra RAM as disk cache. In conjunction with SuperFetch, an automatic built-in Windows Disk Defragmenter makes sure that those applications are strategically positioned on the hard disk where they can be loaded into memory very quickly with the least amount of physical movement of the hard disk’s read-write heads. [26]
As part of the redesign of the networking architecture, IPv6 has been fully incorporated into the operating system and a number of performance improvements have been introduced, such as TCP window scaling. Earlier versions of Windows typically needed third-party wireless networking software to work properly, but this is not the case with Vista, which includes more comprehensive wireless networking support.
For graphics, Vista introduces a new Windows Display Driver Model and a major revision to Direct3D. The new driver model facilitates the new Desktop Window Manager, which provides the tearing-free desktop and special effects that are the cornerstones of Windows Aero. Direct3D 10, developed in conjunction with major display driver manufacture



Source(s):



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_Vis...



</answer>

<question>



How can I keep my computer date and time accurate?



OK So my computer date and time keeps going back to 2005 (that's when my computer was bought) because there is something wrong with the CMOS battery or something and hence it is unable to keep date and time. Every time I shut down my computer the time goes back to some day in 2005 due to which I face problems. Yahoo and other login pages (encrypted) give Certificate errors saying they are outdated because my system date and time is not accurate. I tried to synchronize the time with Internet servers using the Windows Time Synchronization but it only works if the date is accurate which I have to fix manually. Is there a way I can get my date and time updated automatically using Web severs say every time I restart my computer or something like that. I have DSL hence my computer is always connected to the Internet, you know something that regularly updates my date and time automatically.



I have a laptop which I use much more frequently than this hence I don't want to spend money buying/replacing hardware on this computer.



</question>



<additional details>



Jesse: Are the batteries that cheap?



</additional details>



<answer from>



Jesse
Member since: 20 August 2008
Total points: 3335 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



All you need to do is buy a new CMOS battery. They're less than 5 dollars, and all you do is plug them in. If its a standard desktop, it takes a standard 3V cell. Its very simple, and will last many years.

<question>



What is windows detecting (hear connect / disconnect chimes randomly)?



I occasionally hear the both the windows xp connect/disconnect sounds (such as when you connect a new hardware device and take it out again) but it happens when nothing is attached?  I can't see anything obvious in the device manager (but then it happens so quickly it would probably have disappered).



Anyone any ideas what it is?



</question>



<answer from>



Nintendo...
Member since: 04 July 2008
Total points: 225 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Have you added any new devies at the back like External Hard Drives or USB sticks? This sometimes causes it.



Maybe your modem or wireless thing is repeatedly restarting.



Could be any device is repeatedly restarting.



Maybe a driver conflict, one driver starting to access the device but then the other driver starts accessing it as well.



I would recommend re-installing Windows unless you already had this problem since you installed this. But first, try your hardest to find the cause of the problem.



How long have you had Windows installed? I had it installed for years but then I re-intsalled and my system seems to be slightly faster. Re-installing gets rid of junk thats on your comp. Remember, back up your stuff.



</answer>



<answer from>



Zul L
Member since: 25 September 2008
Total points: 127 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



may be this problem can cause this:



1. your devices that attached using usb port, like mouse, keyboard, usb camera and others. try to pull out all the usb devices and try to hear the chimes again in few minutes. if yes, try check one by one which is cause that problem, and replace it with new, it may cause the problem in your device. if not, try second.
2. update your chipset or motherboard driver. refer your hardware documentation on how to update that.



hopefully this problem can solve it...



</answer>

I followed this procedure but it doesn't work
• Click Start, Run and type Services.msc

<answer from>



pboltonc...
Member since: 11 July 2006
Total points: 6054 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Being able to display the characters won't convert it for you. To display the characters go to Control Panel, Regional and Language, Languages and in the Supplemental Language Support section check the 2 tick boxes and OK. It will then instal everything you need to display them. You may be asked for your windows disc to be inserted during this process



</answer>



<answer from>



Sinia J
Member since: 20 June 2008
Total points: 197 (Level 1)



</answer from>

You can also start learning Chinese :P



</answer>

karan raj
Member since: 17 April 2007

<answer>

<answer from>



sewrobb
Member since: 15 February 2008
Total points: 29146 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Other - Internet



</answer from>



<answer>



Control Panel &gt; Regional & Languages &gt; Languages &gt; Supplemental Language support &gt; Tick both boxes &gt; Apply &gt; at which point you will be asked for your OS installation disc to install the files &gt; Advanced &gt; Tick the code page conversions you need. You may well have to go to Microsoft's site to download the appropriate Far Eastern fonts.



</answer>

<question>



MY COMPUTER CRASHED! IS THERE ANY WAY TO GET ALL MY THINGS BACK?



My computer had been running real slow for a day or two, i thought that maybe it had a virus but i ran a few norton scans & everything came back fine so i shut my notebook off, gave it a rest & attempted to turn it back on. well it would not start i tried a system restore but nothing happened, some how i ended up restoring the computer back to its original settings, had to re-register my computer as if it was new. But my big question is if there is any way to get back all my old pictures & documents? i checked the restore points & it only goes back to when i re-registered my computer [yesterday] please help me. im really hoping i can get my stuff back =[



</question>



<answer from>



Richard J
Member since: 31 December 2007
Total points: 9911 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Printers



</answer from>



<answer>



If it went back to the original settings, that sounds like you did a system reformat and not a system restore.So, in that case you can't recover any documents as you wiped your computer clean, sorry



</answer>



<answer from>



ELfaGeek
Member since: 18 February 2007
Total points: 49828 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



You didn't do a System Restore in Windows, you did a full System Recovery.



All is lost.  Next time, RTFM.



It's all explained in your PC User Manual.



</answer>



<answer from>



feesluck...
Member since: 14 September 2008
Total points: 286 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



The same thing happened to us awhile ago.
We had to pay someone to come in and fix it, but it was worth it
because otherwise we would have lost all our photos etc.
One point the guy made was get rid of Norton (which we had at the
time) He said it is like a virus itself.
Since then we've used Kaspersky and haven't had a problem.
By the way, I should be, but I'm not earning commission from Kaspersky.
I also got the guy to teach me how to do a system backup and restore, very helpful.
Save yourself Hundreds if you just ask!



</answer>

<answer from>



Dragonlord Warlock
Member since: 27 October 2006
Total points: 2096 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



There many different kinds of modeling software with various degrees of getting towards a final project. Perhaps the most complete is Blender, but others include Wings3D, Google Sketch-Up, CB Model Pro (beta) and a host of others.
It all depends on what you desire as your final product. If you want models for just rendering many can do that, if you want to export models for a particular platform, you will have to look at feature sets and available export filters.



</answer>

<answer from>



yang_675
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 239 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



An RAR file is a file extension that isn't recognized by windows. You need to download and install WinRAR a program which many people already have. You can probrably download it off download.com but here is the link.



http://rarlab.com/download.htm



Source(s):



WinRar, Windows.



</answer>



<answer from>



LrT
Member since: 24 November 2007
Total points: 483 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



You've got a compressed file similar to what's known as a ZIP file.
Both RAR and ZIP are compression formats, of which there are many.
You can use a program called WinRAR to open it, but it is only shareware and you will have to buy it if you want to keep it.  I believe a free software from 7-zip will also work.  WinZip is another popular software.
Check my source in wikipedia, they list a few others.



Source(s):



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rar



</answer>



<answer from>



Kid L
Member since: 28 September 2008
Total points: 268 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Download 7zip and after you installed it right-click the RAR file and click on 7-zip and extract the file....this way is more easier for someone dumb as me...LoL!(i'm not saying you a dumb person) but its more easier!! Heres the link to download.....
http://www.7zip.com/



</answer>

</answer from>



<answer>



UIF is an image file. You can use MagicDisk http://magiciso.com to mount the image into virtual disk



</answer>



<answer from>



Expert Helps!
Member since: 03 October 2008
Total points: 139 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Software Tutorial-http://statsofts.com/



</answer>



<answer from>



Shiladit...
Member since: 26 August 2008
Total points: 257 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



.uif is a virtual image file.
the best free software for mounting images on virtual disks is
DAEMON TOOLS
it creates SCSI devices to install virtual drives
it comes in the taskbar with a red icon. left click on it and select 'mount image'. you will find the contents of the image in 'my computer' under a separate drive



</answer>

<answer from>



Sky Walker
Member since: 17 March 2008
Total points: 10232 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



"How" is Google earth not working properly?



If you haven't installed the graphics driver, install it.



If you have 3D effects compiz fusion turned on, then turn them off while you use Google Earth. Some graphics cards can't handle both simultaneously.



</answer>

Expert Helps!
Member since: 03 October 2008
Total points: 139 (Level 1)

<question from>



Ted
Member since: 23 September 2008

</question from>



<question>



Whenever I try to open up my documents/my pictures, or anything like that, windows message comes up saying ...?



Whenever I try to open up my documents/my pictures, or anything like that, a windows message comes up saying "Windows explorer has encountered a problem and needs to close. We are sorry for the inconvenience" and then my tool bar at the bottom dissapears and then comes back. and all my system tray icons dissappear



It always does this, even for things like control panel. I dont think its a virus, I have a pretty good protector and scan it often.



Why is it doing this?



</question>



<answer from>



bogey
Member since: 11 July 2006
Total points: 3019 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



i hope you dont have norton because thats bad news



if you do deactivate it and then see if it works



go to  start/run/type "msconfig" in the box /start up tab/disable all/



services tab very important check "hide all microsoft services" then click disable all



it will ask to restart yes then it may ask to restart again



this just disables all the background junk that sometimes runs behind the scenes  you dont have to leave your anti virus running all the time



scanning once a week should be sufficient



most of the time you dont have to worry about viruses unless you download a whole lot



good luck friend i hope i have helped



</answer>



<asker's comment>



That fixed the problem and made the internet faster too, thanks!



</asker's comment>

<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



ianhad
Member since: 06 October 2006
Total points: 10757 (Level 6)



</question from>



<question>



Can I run Vista on a virtual pc without having to validate it?



</question>



<answer from>



AJ
Member since: 01 May 2007
Total points: 8470 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Not if you want to keep it up to date as you will fail the check



AJ



</answer>



<answer from>



Ivan R
Member since: 09 November 2006
Total points: 19947 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



Hello,



(ANS) In my opinion the answer is NOP!!. Just because you have virtualized windows vista makes no difference, as far as Vista is concerned it doesn't know its running within a virtual environment.



To windows vista it still thinks its running as normal and so therfore it will behave as a normally installed version of windows vista, thus it will still want & ask for activation.



**If you want to activate Vista (assuming its a normal copy of the product) then you should still be able to even if its running virtually. If you do activate it then provided you have a valid EULA & Product key you should be able to apply the normal service packs, hot fixes, patches & windows updates.



Kind Regards Ivan



</answer>

<category>

<question from>



alex
Member since: 21 May 2008
Total points: 105 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



What codec do you need to instal to play .RMVB files?



I wanteds to watch some anime episodes in .RMVB but i couldn't so i instaled the real media player lite. That gave the file an actual icon and wmp tried to open it but it said it did not find a codec. I tried mpc and it said some codec was not found. What codec do i need and where do i get it? Please help. I really want to watch Inuyasha and Bleach! Any links would be really helpful.



</question>



<additional details>



I have WIndows ME by the way, so finding something that it can actually work with is kinda hard...



</additional details>



<answer from>



Joshua T
Member since: 11 May 2008
Total points: 230 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



RMVB files are actually meant to be played by RealPlayer, but some ppl just can't stand that player. So here's your alternative:



Some ppl developed a codec that plays RMVB and all the formats that only RealPlayer can play (except for streaming media). The codec is called "RealAlternative" (lol).
http://www.free-codecs.com/download/real...
Download the codec, install it (run the setup file you just downloaded), and you should be able to run your RMVB files with MPC now. I used that method when I got some movies in RMVB format.



</answer>



<answer from>



Sheldon E
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 126 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



VLC media player http://www.downloadatoz.com/dvd-video_di...



BSPlayer  http://download2.bsplayer.com/download_f...



</answer>



<answer from>



KROFS
Member since: 09 February 2006
Total points: 23726 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Other - Internet



Software



Other - Computers



</answer from>



<answer>



I use Media Player Classic with the KLite codec pack for RealPlayer files:
http://www.free-codecs.com/download/K_Li...



</answer>

<answer from>



EJ
Member since: 19 March 2008
Total points: 578 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



CCleaner is good, but the most feature-rich in my opinion is Perfect Optimizer. It's an award-winning PC repair software that does all of the following:
- registry cleanup and repairing
- junk file cleanup
- IE repairing
- evidence cleaner
- system optimizer
- memory optimizer
- windows startup repair
- install / uninstall manager



It's a nifty tool for Vista registry repair that runs flawlessly and securely with minimum user intervention. The customization features are really very good for system-heavy users.



Source(s):



http://PerfectOptimizer.pinurl.com



</answer>

<answer from>



jhally12...
Member since: 09 December 2006
Total points: 361 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



you may roll back your drive



to roll back use the following



right click on My Computer--------&gt; Properties---------&gt; Hardware---------&gt; Device Manager



then click on the sound, video nd game controller and find the driver that contains yellow marks



right click on that and go to properties  click on driver and then click on roll back driver



if this doesn't work you may use system restore to get back your audio drivers



HAVE A NICE DAY



</answer>

<question>



Windows XP help. What do I do and what caused this problem?



The other day my laptop just shut down for what so reason while I was working and now I can't start up windows! This is the error message I get after I press the power button:



"Windows could not start because the following file is missing or corrupt:
\WINDOWS\SYSTEM32\CONFIG\SYSTEM



You can attempt to repair this file by starting Windows Setup using the original Setup CD-ROM.
Select 'r' at the first screen to start repair"



I haven't been pestering with system files due to the fact that they make windows work. My AVG was up-to-date and laptop was virus-free before the crash and I haven't downloaded nor installed any windows update for a long time now.



Also, I have the original setup CD but nothing else happens. I press "r" at the error message screen but it just restarts the laptop and it shows the same error message. Safe mode and other modes after holding down F8, same story.



I've had this for two years now and just about a month ago, i had it reformatted. Also, after reformat, I started hearing "motor"-like sounds on the lower right-hand area (near the directional pads; refer to the link below) after I would rest my hand near that spot. It stopped after I took my hand away. But I would get a blue screen if it didn't stop making the sound.



Someone please help. What could have caused this and what can I do to fix it?



If laptop and other details would help:
Model: Toshiba Satellite M30
OS: Windows XP
Hard Drive: 46GB free / 60gb total



Sample image of the laptop: http://notebook.cz/clanky/recenze-notebo...



</question>



<additional details>



Fix it, meaning, XP, not the buzzing motor sound.



The CD is inserted but nothing is happening. There is no "next screen." After the Toshiba welcome logo, the error message appears



</additional details>

et

<answer>



Due to some reason, system files of your OS are corrupt.
If repair does not work, just reinstall windows, do not format the drive, the corrupt files will be replaced by orignal ones,



you then have to reinstall all the software again as it will also replace the registry file.
your documents will be save.



</answer>

<answer>



Blue screen treatment, you can refer to
1 restart
2 new hardware detection of new services
3 Trojan virus detected
4 checks BIOS and hardware compatibility
5 run "sfc / scannow" system to check whether documents have been replaced, and then use the installation disk to restore the system
6 upgrade SP2 or SP3
7 motherboard refresh virus infection
8 BSOD were damaged, need to be replaced
Try to visit
http://www.Best-Registry-Cleaner.info  Download  Perfect Optimizer！
We hope it can help you

<original file>10486.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk59865.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



Corrine Cupcake ♥
Member since: 25 October 2006
Total points: 2095 (Level 3)



</question from>



<question>



I accendently clicked save on a word document but i want to take it back!?



I was using a word document and i changed it for a different document and clicked save instead of save as. :s



Can i take it back to what it was before?!



Please help!!
Thanks in advance xx



</question>



<additional details>



i saved it to my memory stick.



</additional details>



<answer from>



domquin
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 255 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



You can try to look for the recovery file if it's there. Go to folder: Documents and Settings-&gt; &lt;your username&gt; -&gt; Application Data -&gt; Microsoft -&gt; Word. If your document is there it will have the name: autoRecovery save of &lt;name of your file&gt;. You right-click on that document and select open with -&gt; choose program -&gt; word. when the document opens you can save it as &lt;old name&gt;



</answer>



<answer from>



nevervoi...
Member since: 25 September 2008
Total points: 103 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Try the Undo option - Hold the Ctrl Key on your keyboard with the key Z down. If you have closed the document.. I am not quite sure if you can get the old content back.. unless if you are using a version control system.



Cheers!



</answer>

Mihir D

<answer>



You may try the software for free for a preset period by downloading it from the website - www.adobe.com. Upon expiration of this trial period, you will need to put in a key or serial. This serial needs to be bought from Adobe. You will be prompted to buy it from www.adobe.com once your trial period expires. However, as you would know, there are "other ways" to use the software illegally. But by doing so, you may be deprived of any support from Adobe in such a case. If you want to ensure regular support and smooth operation of the software, it's advisable to purchase the key from Adobe. Else, crack it at your risk.



Source(s):



Own experience.



</answer>

<answer from>



Michael from UK
Member since: 22 July 2006
Total points: 5370 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



So, are you on your own PC or one in a school/college/work? A Group Policy is one usually set up centrally to determine what users can/cannot do. So if that's whats happening you shouldn't try to get around it.  If you feel you want to run the program, then do as it says.



If it's just on your PC, then you can amend your own policies (if you have admin rights - see what group your user belongs to) - go to 'computer management' in control panel, and you can see and adjust the policies that are running. It might simply be that you cant run it from where it is - so moving it to another location might work.



Edit
*****
Logon as administrator, and make your normal user a member of the administrators group (in user accounts, or computer management - depends on version of Windows). Then go back to 'you' and you should be able to run it.



</answer>



<answer from>



jagannat...
Member since: 01 June 2006
Total points: 10247 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



Whenever downloading softwares, you have to see whether they are available for free or whether there are some restriction of usage like 30 days trail period. If the software comes with a price tag, they will not work.



Apart from this you should install a good Anti-Virus programme. Some are available for free like AVG antivirus. There are good Anti-virus programmes which are not available for free like Kaspersky. They will offer free softwares for certain period like 30 days. later you have to buy it.
These require frequent upgradation like once in a week, fortnight, etc.
Please consult a computer technician too for the problems.



</answer>

ADEWALE A

<answer>



If you are using Windows Vista then it is possible you have a problem like this because, the software is not possibly licensed with Microsoft or that the software is being found to cause some problems like spyware or virus related or things like that.



Some times also in recent times I have found that some worms actually blocks and creates messages like the one you have described. Make sure you click and make the software compatible with the version of the windows you are using (to do this, just right-click your mouse on the icon that represents the program and select properties. In one of the Tabs you should be able to see Compatibility, select that option and make the program/software to be compatible or run on OS lower than the one you are having... That should solve the problem.



Again, if you are using Vista, you may be requested to Allow the software to run, click the allow option and you should be alright. But if all this are not working, the I will leave the problem to virus or worms possibly.



Good luck to you.



</answer>

bebe al agua

<question>



What is good about Word Processing?



</question>



<answer from>



TheTechn...
Member since: 04 September 2008
Total points: 602 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



You can print many copies easily, you can make basic or drastic changes easily without the need to manually rewrite a whole section of the document. You can e-mail it to people, you can also take numerous backups instead of a single master copy.



Of course there is also the benefit of spell checking at your fingertips and the ability to manipulate the style, size and colour of the font.



</answer>



<answer from>



fattman2...
Member since: 19 July 2008
Total points: 124 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



it helps you with your work that you don't wont to do all the time.



</answer>



<answer from>



Darwin
Member since: 17 April 2008
Total points: 3815 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



Writing is rewriting.



A word processor makes it easier to rewrite. You can rearrange words, sentences, and/or paragraphs. A word processor also has a spell checker, and most have a grammar checker too. Plus formatting is much easier. Most offer various templates that already have the style you need for the paper you are writing.



You can save your work on the computer and that saves paper.



</answer>

Member since: 19 October 2007
Total points: 45 (Level 1)

<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



DEMOCRAT
Member since: 10 August 2006
Total points: 303 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



What's the difference between Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and Fireworks?



They all seem to have something to do with making or editing pictures. Isn't it easier to just mash them all together?



</question>



<answer from>



isl247
Member since: 23 February 2007
Total points: 8106 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Photoshop is for raster graphics. Things like photos, made up of dots/pixels.
Illustrator is for vector graphics. Things like logos, charts/graphs, etc made up of lines and shapes defined by mathematical expressions. Vector images are resolution independent and can be scaled infinitely without any loss in quality.
Fireworks is a graphics editor that can create, but is more geared towards optimizing, graphics and interface elements for web use.



These are 3 distinct and very different market areas. Trying to "mash them all together" would make for one hell of a mess.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Great, now tell me how to use them. :)
Thanks.



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



youmakem...
Member since: 19 July 2008
Total points: 2774 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



Photoshop is for editing raster images.



Illustrator is for creating vector images



Fireworks is for flash.



Rasther than adobe's get these, Gimp is 95% as good as photoshop, and Inkscape destroys illustrator.



www.gimp.org
www.inkscape.org



And they will open/edit/export as adobe files.



</answer>



<answer from>



Wisefool...
Member since: 01 September 2008
Total points: 1790 (Level 3)



Contributing In:



Programming & Design



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



They have tried mashing them together in Corel Draw. Needless to say it's not very popular.



</answer>

<question>



How do I make 3 cells in microsoft word?

<answer from>



Cristi
Member since: 05 October 2008
Total points: 128 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



In Word 2007 go to "Insert"
Then "Table" and select 1X3
You can modify it from there.



Hope this helped!



</answer>

nini
Member since: 29 August 2008
Total points: 2949 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Psychology

<answer>



Go to menu
Click on Table
Press insert then specify how many rows and columns you want.
