</question from>



<question>



Question about vista: did you know this?



this is a question, but I am also trying to get the word out.



there is a way you can speed up windows Vista. A way Noone I know has ever figured out. its about visual styles. there are a number of things they put in vista to make it graphically more appealing, though they really do slow down the computer, mine sped up, and it wasn't even that slow before. here is how you do it:



1. go to the control panel.
2. in the "search" bar, type "performance"
3. go under "system" as it appears, and click on the link "adjust the appearance and performance of windows"



having a box unchecked will aid in speeding up your computer. when I initially unchecked all of the boxes, I noticed no difference in my ability to effectively communicate with the computer. If you have vista, and it is really slow, then, by all means, uncheck all boxes.



seriously,...



1. did you know that you can speed up your computer by doing this, 2. have you done this?



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



I just did it. It looks like windows 2000 lol. It is alot faster though



</answer>

<question>



Computer System Restore?

Also, I was wondering how long a system restore takes?  I don't want to screw anything up but my computer has so much junk on it that it needs to be reformatted.

</answer from>



<answer>



If you have defragged lately it runs faster.



I'd think real serious about this. You'll lose everything youve installed.  Including virus scanner.  You wont lose stuff in your email inbox, or things youve posted on someone else's website.



</answer>

<answer from>



AJ
Member since: 01 May 2007
Total points: 8661 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



I think that you have another piece of software running that is trying to get your attention. AJ

<original file>13677.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk63410.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



zafar I
Member since: 06 October 2008
Total points: 90 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Help For Protected Files??



Hi
How Can i make the protected File????



</question>



<answer from>



computer...
Member since: 29 September 2008
Total points: 73 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Use Folder Lock Software or Right Click on Desktop then new then last option folder in options set password



</answer>



<answer from>



SelenaK
Member since: 05 September 2007
Total points: 543 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Right-click on the file and select Properties. Click on the Advanced button. Click on "Encrypt contents to secure data". Click on OK, and then OK again.



Next, right-click on the folder in which the file is stored. Select "Sharing and Security". Check the options to secure the folder. NOTE: This will affect all files in the folder, so you may want to move the file to its own folder if you still want to share other files.



</answer>

<answer from>



ELfaGeek

Contributing In:



Software

<answer>



Two caveats:  The BIOS firmware version must be newer than 1999, and, 256MB RAM is a bare minimum for most modern Linux Distros.



Then, Xubuntu is a good starting point.  Run in Live CD mode ONLY to test your hardware.



Do not install any Linux that isn't compatible with all your hardware.



Source(s):



Painfull Experience.



http://www.xubuntu.com



</answer>

<question from>



Ben R

</question from>



<question>



How can I change file names to all CAPS?



I have a lengthy list of files and they all need to be in CAPS, what is the easiest way to do this? The files are word and .jpg files



</question>



<answer from>



AsiaAdvi...
Member since: 19 May 2008
Total points: 15345 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Words & Wordplay



</answer from>



<answer>



This doesn't answer your question, but why do they need to be in CAPS?



</answer>



<answer from>



ShaKri
Member since: 27 September 2008
Total points: 923 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Case Converter 1.0



Download from
http://www.filetransit.com/view.php?id=1...



Cheers,
SK



Source(s):



http://www.filetransit.com/view.php?id=1...



</answer>



<answer from>



murshida...
Member since: 06 August 2008
Total points: 133 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Find the file you want to rename and right click. Than click rename have and make sure you have caps lock on and then type away the new title.



</answer>



<answer from>



brigman
Member since: 21 July 2008
Total points: 189 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



(Assuming you are using windows)



Windows ignores a filename change unless you actually change one or more of the characters completely. Add a random character to the filename with one rename operation, and then remove it while changing the original characters to capitals with a second rename operation; this is time consuming, but works.



There are hundreds of bulk renaming utilities that will transform whole directories (and all their sub-directories) at a time. The built in move command may also do the trick.



</answer>



<answer from>



lappipum...
Member since: 12 March 2007
Total points: 301 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I use MultiRenamer for that. It  has preview so I can see what the output will be. And the undo option if I did smth wrong:)



Source(s):



http://www.coolutils.com/MultiRenamer



</answer>

<question from>



♥LDN_Del...

<question>



On the program wordpad is there anyway to find a word count?



is there any way i can find out how many words ive typed?



Im not talking about microsoft word....im talking about wordpad.



incase u get confused.



</question>



<answer from>



Sebastian T
Member since: 07 April 2008
Total points: 152 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Wordpad is just too simple a program to be able to to do word counts



your best bet if you really want to find the word count then copy the text into a more sophisticated word editor like Microsoft or Wordperfect ect..



</answer>



<answer from>



agius152...
Member since: 23 August 2006
Total points: 9612 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



wordpad doesn't have word count, it's a very simple program just designed to type with, if you want a word count, try and find a program online or use microsoft word.



</answer>



<answer from>



domquin
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 263 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



No you can't do that in WordPad. But you can copy and paste your text in Word to get the word count



</answer>

<answer>



I'm assuming your using a windows operating system.



insert a blank cd.  Open it from my computer.  Drag the files you want to save to the CD onto the cd.  they should appear on the cd with the same icon as normal except they'll also have a down arrow on the icon. Follow the steps and it will write them to the CD.

<answer>



no



When you install vista it either automatically gets an activation code from the internet or you can get one online.  If you don't get an activation code within 30 days it stops worker.



The CD key and activation code are bound together, but neither cares about what computer its on.



If your hard drive fails an you have to reinstall windows you'll probably need to call Microsoft and tell them that is no longer on the old PC, and they will give you a new activation code.

<question from>

<question>



In iTunes what does Create AAC Version mean?



</question>



<answer from>



kogcuegw...
Member since: 17 January 2008
Total points: 731 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



its apples format...its like mp3...aac only works on apples devices, but it is essential if u want to put a wm file on an ipod or iphone



</answer>



<answer from>



teala
Member since: 13 November 2006
Total points: 3169 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



It's a type of media file. Here are the details - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advanced_Au...



</answer>



<answer from>



CaptainT...
Member since: 07 August 2007
Total points: 1568 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



AAC is Apple's proprietary system for encoding music files. It produces files that are more compact than mp3 files with sound quality about the same. It offers configuration so that when importing a file (say from a CD) you can choose to do the importing at lower or higher "bitrates" which will give you bigger files but higher quality.



The option you mention will convert your mp3 to an AAC file.



</answer>






<original file>15487.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk65421.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



I Have Answers
Member since: 16 May 2006
Total points: 4038 (Level 4)



</question from>



<question>



In Excel, how to print selected rows on one page?



I want to select different rows in Excel and have them print on the same page.  Currently every row I select prints on a separate page.



EX: highlight/select row 2, 3, 10, 300, 350.  Have them print on the same page.



Thanks so much!



</question>



<answer from>



Irene D
Member since: 11 June 2007
Total points: 1000 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Select the rows you want to print them by pressing control key. Then go to FILE &gt; PRINT AREA &gt; SELECT PRINT AREA. Then go to FILE &gt; PRINT &gt; under Print What select SELECTION.



</answer>



<answer from>



CaptainT...
Member since: 07 August 2007
Total points: 1568 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



By far the easiest way is to copy them all onto a sheet then print the new sheet. To copy them all at once select the rows you want (2, 3, 10 300, 350) by holding down the Ctrl key while clicking the row numbers. Then click copy, go to the new sheet and click paste. Resize any columns that need it then print.



</answer>

<original file>15938.html</original file>

<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



eject
Member since: 11 April 2006
Total points: 139 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



I have a excel problem?



well i am using office 2007 and i am having this problem please look at the image.
http://www.pixelshack.com/img/830190prob...



the figure in cell L36 is correct but it must not repeat itself in cell L37 and L38. as i am using the formula =IF(OR(K36=30,K36&lt;30),J36,"0")



the cell numbers have been chages accordingly the part k36&lt;30 (30) indicates the number of days.



can some tell me how i can put a filter or condition where the amount in cell L36 is not repeated in L37 and L38.



Many thanks
p.s. please no V.B i am an amateur and know very little of excel.



</question>



<answer from>



imapirat...
Member since: 04 April 2007
Total points: 6884 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



not sure im understanding this correctly so if this is way off im sorry, but try doing something like:
=if((IF(OR(K37=30,K37&lt;30),J37, "0"))=L36,"",L37



something along those lines.



basically its saying if L37 is has the same value as L36, then stay blank, otherwise repeat the formula you used in the previous cell (but for the next cell over)



</answer>



<answer from>



jmorge
Member since: 30 January 2006
Total points: 7392 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



first, for your info, if you want to compare a number less than or equal to something, you don't have to do an OR(xxxx, xxxx) statement. You can simply put IF(K36&lt;=30, xxxx).  So if K36 is less than, or equal, to 30, then it's true.



without seeing the formulas in each of the cells it's hard to determine the problem.  But since the column headings suggest that Col L is 1-7 days, Col M is 8-30 days and Col N is 31-90 days then each column simply needs an IF statement to determine the answer.



in Col L formula should be



IF(K36&lt;=7, J36, 0)



in Col M formula should be



IF(AND(K36&gt;=8, K36&lt;=30), J36, 0)



in Col N formula should be
IF(AND(K36&gt;=31, K36&lt;=90), J36, 0)



</answer>

<question>



Is limewire safe? please answer?



my mate told me that limewire gave him a camputer virus, so i was wondering is lime wire safe



</question>



<answer from>



anonymou...
Member since: 07 August 2007
Total points: 3608 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



true, it is full of viruses but there's a trick on how to detect it. when downloading files using limewire or frostwire, "preview" it at 1% or higher. if it plays, it's a genuine mp3 file, if not then there's a very good chance it is a virus. scanning the file w/ an antivirus program like avg should verify this for you.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



thanks



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



taylorma...

no not really mate the first time i use it i got a virus off it and had to wipe my computer off use AVG to scan all your downloads which is what i do lime wire scan all other computers that are using lime wire and if they have viruses than you will get them use AVG its good and safe and best of all free

<answer from>



David D

<answer>



Most of the content available via Limewire is illegal, infested with viruses, or more easily available elsewhere.

<question>



Should I download Vista Service Pack 1?



Will it cause any problems to my computer?



</question>



<answer from>



zerogabe...
Member since: 13 July 2008
Total points: 376 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



My uncle would say "if it aint broke, dont fix it"  but If I were you I would DL it, It will no doubt have security fixes and other goodies to make your QoL better.



</answer>



<answer from>



JC
Member since: 31 May 2006
Total points: 4164 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



It shouldn't. I recommend you visit your system manufacturers website and check for the latest drivers. A few drivers were poorly coded and caused SP1 installation to hang and fail badly, but most systems are fine and most of these drivers will be detected by the SP1 installer before it actually starts the upgrade.



Once you have it, it includes security fixes and makes Vista run a little smoother (less bugs/crashes, a little more responsive in certain apps).



Hope this helps!



Source(s):



I have two pcs running Vista Ultimate 64-bit edition, Service Pack 1 installed fine on both.



</answer>



<answer from>



David R
Member since: 17 December 2006
Total points: 9222 (Level 5)

<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



Wendy b
Member since: 25 May 2007
Total points: 3691 (Level 4)



</question from>



<question>



Is there a specific way to trash cd's ? read:?



My 85 year old mom asked me if she could just throw them in the garbage, they are from my dad and she doesn't know if there is any personal info on them. Is there a way she can scratch them or ruin them just incase. ? Sorry to seem so paranoid, I'm close to 60 and I don't know either :) thanks so much.



</question>



<answer from>



Dick
Member since: 05 September 2006
Total points: 8052 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Easiest sure way is to put one inside a plastic grocery bag and snap them in half if you are strong enough to do so.  The reason for the bag is that when it break it will explode little mirror like shiny pieces of metallization off the CD that will litter your carpet.
Just snap them one at a time.



One other method is to take something pointed and scratch them on the top surface.  The side with the imprinted brand name/logo etc.  Even if it has a paper label on it this will work if you scratch them deeply and in several places.



The best bet is to break them or you may have a friend that has a paper shredder that will shred them for you.  My shredder does CD's and DVD's and doesn't even pause on them.



Hope this helps.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



great ideas, thanks so much ;)



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



lostdog
Member since: 07 April 2008
Total points: 1221 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Take a power drill and load it with one of those wire brushes.
Hold the cd with pliers and on the top side - scrape off all the shiny stuff with the drill.
Unorthodox maybe, but makes CDs unreadable.



</answer>



<answer from>



scot_wit...
Member since: 27 April 2007
Total points: 687 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



first scratch the cd using any sharp objects like your keys ...then with a lighter ... lightly burn the surface of the cd .... and then throw it away ... its safe.... no one can ever read the cd again.



</answer>



<answer from>



www.terf...
Member since: 05 October 2008
Total points: 145 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Put them in the microwave and turn it on, as little as 5 seconds would destroy them, but possible also damage your microwave.



</answer>



<answer from>



Connor
Member since: 02 March 2008
Total points: 166 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Just breaking them in half should be sufficient. Although, I tried breaking one in half by hand and it shattered. You should just cut it in half with scissors.



</answer>






<original file>1635.html</original file>

<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



Mr. Nacho
Member since: 28 January 2008
Total points: 464 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



How do I install a clean version of XP?



Hello, I have 2 partitions right now: C and D. I have a copy of XP. How to I install a fresh version of XP from my CD, and clearing out both C and D? Like I got a brand new computer?



Help is appreciated.



Thanks!



</question>



<answer from>



xioxenna
Member since: 18 June 2008
Total points: 889 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



ok, beware altering partitions, all data will be lost....



that said, set the PC to boot from CD (done in the bios)



hit a key when prompted and you'll be brought into the xp installation screen...



from there, follow the instructions, and when it comes to selecting where you should install, there'll be an option to press the likes of T to delete the partitions.... delete both then you can create a single, (or 2,3,4+) partitions on your black hard drive....



oh and always do a complete format, it takes about 1 1/2 hours longer, but it's worth it in the end.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Thanks!



</asker's comment>

<question from>



Himanshu M
Member since: 06 October 2008
Total points: 95 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How to upload software on a blog?



</question>



<answer from>



Carling
Member since: 01 December 2006
Total points: 17002 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



you can't if it is copy write material it is illegal



</answer>



<answer from>



Ben Who
Member since: 22 September 2008
Total points: 101 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



You can't upload software to a blog. But you can post a link. To know why, you have to understand what a blog is. it is just a page of text with style sheets, and links. If you would like to offer others to download some programs that are already online, you may add a link. If you would like to post your own software, you would have to find a server that would host your file, and then add a link to that file. Any furthur questions? feel freee to ask and i will answer more in detail. At your service



Source(s):



my Brain



</answer>



<answer from>



Marc B
Member since: 05 August 2008
Total points: 273 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



We will need more details. What software? a plugin for your blog? a piece of software you want to share with people? What blog are you using?



</answer>

<question>



Is there any way of getting Word 2007 / office 2007 to automatically save files in Word/Office 2002 format?



Any advice would be appreciated :-)



</question>



<additional details>



Excellent - thanks! (No more answers needed)



</additional details>



<answer from>



Wickedpe...
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 312 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Click on the Office button in the upper left corner
Click Word Options
Click Save
change Save files in this format to Word 97 - 2003 Document
Click OK



</answer>

First of all, Photoshop CS3 costs a lot of money (try over $700), so you can't really complain that i doesn't work, when you try to download the cracked version :)

After you have done that - just install it again, it should work.

<question from>



JRAY
Member since: 08 July 2008
Total points: 52 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Need URGENT Sony Vegas 8 Help?



Okay I need help! The movie i am making has hit many problems and i need help with one of them, I need to know how to put Text over pictures, so the pics in the background and the text on them.



Thanks for all your help!



</question>



<answer from>



Christine W
Member since: 30 August 2008
Total points: 253 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Well, I have Vegas 6.0, but it should be pretty similar. Click on Media Generators. If you don't see it anywhere on your screen, go to View&gt;&gt; and make sure Media Generators is checked. Then, select Text. Once you select your style, make sure you put it a layer above your pictures so it can be seen. And also make sure it is a text generator that has a transparent background (the checkered gray and white). If it isn't transparent, then you won't be able to see your pictures. Once you place the text generator a layer above your pictures, you can edit it by right clicking and selecting Edit Generated Media. You can also change the color and size as well, hopefully you'll figure it out from there!



Good luck! I hope that helped. Remember, my directions might be a little off because I have 6.0, but it should be pretty similar.



</answer>



<answer from>



The Trespasser
Member since: 12 July 2006
Total points: 2024 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>

http://forums.creativecow.net/readpost/2...



hope I helped u... u may mail me if u hv any doubt...

</answer>

<category>

<question from>



Brij Mohan

<question>

<original file>16140.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk6826.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



knowledg...
Member since: 15 June 2008
Total points: 107 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Can you have windows xp and vista os's?



I was just wanted to know thinking about new desktop sometime I do know company's will include xp but a majority of newer computers have vista pre-installed on the system I really like xp but I do know that vista is good for graphic applications I know about multi os just wasn't sure because of them being both window os



</question>



<answer from>



AJ
Member since: 01 May 2007
Total points: 8413 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Yes you can do this in different ways. You can set up the machine to dual boot. To do this you would need two disks or two partitions and you install an OS on each partition. Windows will automatically create a start up option where you choose which OS you want to boot into.



The second alternative is to install a virtual machine inside your main Windows OS (doesn't matter if it is Vista or XP) and then install your second OS into the virtual machine. With this method you would go into your main OS as normal and then when you wanted to access the other OS you just go into your VM software.



There are pros and cons to each of these so give them a try and see which suits you best - the VM route is probably the easiest to experiment with. I have given you links to a couple of free Virtual Machines below.



Incidentally you will need a legal copy of each of the Operating Systems to do this



AJ



Source(s):



Microsoft Virtual PC 2007
http://www.microsoft.com/windows/downloa...
Sun Virtual Box
http://www.virtualbox.org/



</answer>



<answer from>



QQQ
Member since: 11 May 2008
Total points: 12274 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



Yes, Google up "Dual boot Vista and XP" and you'll get a large list of guides that tell you how to multi-boot your system.



I won't usually suggest the Virtual machine option, seeing that if you actually prefer using XP to Vista, you may as well install it on a seperate partition and set it to your default OS.



</answer>

<answer>

Frogz
Member since: 30 March 2007
Total points: 4802 (Level 4)

<answer>

</answer>



<answer from>



Aninepon...
Member since: 20 August 2008
Total points: 483 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



yes there is way if i understood your question correctly. Your trying to shorten th song but quickly? when the song is in the timeline, you cant see the whole song obviously and on the right hand side of the screen where the song is there should be a little sideways triangle. hold onto that with your mouse and pull it left and it should shorten it instantly



EDIT: you can also maybe use the zoom out button to see the whole song and then drag it so it will go faster.



Hope this helped



</answer>

<question from>



somebody...
Member since: 05 February 2007
Total points: 845 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Is there any way of getting Word 2007 / office 2007 to automatically save files in Word/Office 2002 format?



Any advice would be appreciated :-)



</question>



<answer from>



Wickedpe...
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 301 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Click on the Office button in the upper left corner
Click Word Options
Click Save
change Save files in this format to Word 97 - 2003 Document
Click OK



</answer>



<answer from>



Leonhart
Member since: 20 September 2008
Total points: 223 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Open Word 2007 &gt; Click the office logo at the left top (the circle button) &gt; Click on "Word Options" next to "Exit Word" &gt; A window will pop-up and click on "Save" on the left pane of the window &gt; look for "Save files in this format" and choose "Word 97-2003 Document (*.doc)" &gt; Click on OK and you're done.



</answer>

<question>



I want to restore my computer, but I would like to copy a couple of my programs to a CD, so I can use again.?



One of the programs I am trying to copy is my :"Roxio Easy Media Creator 7". An acquaintance of mine loaded this for me a year or so ago, and I don't know how to get in touch with him anymore. If this is possible, please give me a step-by-step detail. Thanks!!!

Member since: 06 October 2008

<answer from>



justme
Member since: 04 February 2007

<answer>



Go to My Computer&gt; Local Disc (C)&gt;Programs. Scroll down to find the program you want, right click, and select 'send to'. Click on the CD drive.(make sure you have a CD in the drive.)

<question>



How can I run The Sims 2 in DirectX 10 mode?



</question>



<answer from>



Mercuri
Member since: 06 May 2008
Total points: 5469 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Software



Other - Computers



Laptops & Notebooks



</answer from>



<answer>



You can't.  The Sims 2 isn't DirectX10.  Even assuming you could run it in DirectX10, it's not set up to take advantage of any of the added features so there would be absolutely no difference.  You'll just have to run it in DirectX9.



</answer>



<answer from>



SWARAJIT
Member since: 24 November 2007
Total points: 414 (Level 2)

</answer>

<question from>

</question from>



<question>



Whats better? VLC media player or K-lite codec pack FULL?



I basically want to play every single video file i can using windows media player. Which would be better? To install VLC or k-lite codec pack? Will either of these slow my pc down? Im running vista 32 bit



</question>



<answer from>



Manoj
Member since: 31 May 2008
Total points: 301 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



For playing in WMPlayer,you need to install VFW(Video For Windows)codecs,so i recommend installing K-Lite Codec Pack,On the other hand,if you use VLC,you need not install codecs as VLC has inbuilt codecs



</answer>



<answer from>



Eran Y
Member since: 11 February 2008
Total points: 799 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



The difference between the two is that a codec pack will simply allow you to play your files in *any* video player you like, and VLC is a *specific* player who can play almost any video.
If you want to use windows media player you will need the codec pack. If you want to use the VLC player alone, use VLC. Neither of them will slow your PC down as codecs are not running without playing a video, and VLC doesn't run without manual running it.



</answer>



<answer from>



The Trespasser
Member since: 12 July 2006
Total points: 2040 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



first of all I like to tell you that VLC is a Player where as K-lite is a codec Pack.



&gt;&gt;&gt;
CODEC (compressor/decompressor)



(Computers) technology used to compress and decompress computer data (such as sound or video files, etc.)



AND



WMP is just a player... which wont support to all kind of files...



Other than WMP you hv to keep VLC also...



Use VLC Player. Its really awesome... It looks very tiny... but it is a very powerful software...

<answer>



V Ultimate only....



If you use the same computer at home and for your daily work, Windows Vista Ultimate is an excellent choice. You can smoothly shift between the things you want to do and the things you need to do. For fun, you'll love the extensive options you get for music, images, live and recorded TV, and online entertainment. For work, you'll find improved document sharing and networking support. If your PC is a laptop, you'll appreciate how easily you can manage and extend your battery life. And you'll get the most advanced, layered security protection of any Windows release yet.
Easier
See what you're doing, find what you need
The first things you'll notice about Windows Vista Ultimate are its elegant looks and how it helps you with essential tasks. It's easier to work with and visualize your information with Windows Aero. You can conveniently arrange and manage your open windows using Windows Flip and Flip 3D. And you won't have to click to see your content because live taskbar thumbnails reveal it.



Windows Aero helps you quickly locate the window you need.
Every day you have to hit the ground running at full speed. Now, with Instant Search, you have a faster way to find whatever you need on your PC, on your network, or on the Internet. Whether you're looking for an e-mail from a colleague, a picture of your mom, a spreadsheet from last quarter, or the website for your kid's homework, you only need to start typing in the Search box on the Start menu.



As soon as you start typing, Instant Search begins showing results containing the letters you've entered.
It's easier and faster to find anything, no matter where you may have saved it, with the consistent, streamlined menus, toolbars, and preview panes in the improved Explorers in Windows Vista. Explorers include Search boxes too, so you can search within a particular type of information, such as all your documents.



Explorers include Search boxes so you can find what you need fast.
You can organize your files any way that you want and immediately sort and filter information based on file type, saved date, or the name of the file creator. Watch this demo to see how Windows Vista helps you find and organize information.
Back up without fuss, roll back file changes
If you've used a PC for long, chances are good that you know the sick feeling you get in your stomach after you've accidentally deleted a picture or a document you spent hours writing. And you know you can avoid that feeling by routinely backing up your files. But you can find yourself procrastinating because it seems like it will take a lot of time and trouble.
Now you can avoid the procrastination because you can easily use the Windows Backup and Restore Center. If you want to back up just your files and data, you can choose Automatic Backup. Or you can choose Windows Complete PC Backup and Restore, which can get your entire PC back to normal in one easy step if you experience a catastrophic hardware failure.



The Backup and Restore Center makes this essential task simple to do.
What do you do if you've made a lot of changes to a document and realize you want to go back to a previous version? In the past, you had only the version you'd most recently saved. Now, Shadow Copy automatically creates and archives copies of your files as you work on them. So if you accidentally saved over a document or a document becomes corrupted, you can easily retrieve any previous version of that file.
Use multiple languages
Windows Vista Ultimate is available in 35 languages—simultaneously. If you have a multilingual household or are learning a new language, you can install as many languages as you want and even switch between them as easily as logging off and back on again. And if your family shares a single PC, each family member can use his or her preferred language to interact with the PC.
Easily fax and scan
Once in a while you might need to send or receive a fax or scan a document or image. You have flexible, integrated faxing and scanning capabilities in one convenient location with Windows Fax and Scan. For faxing, you don't need a fax machine. And if you have a locally connected or network-connected scanner, you can scan documents and images with a single click.



Create, send, and receive faxes, documents, and images from one spot.
Enjoy easier setup and simplified maintenance
If being an IT support person isn't your idea of fun, you can relax. For one thing, you can get up and running fast using Windows Easy Transfer to automatically copy your files, photos, music, e-mail, and settings from your old PC to your new Windows Vista–based PC.
After your computer is set up, you will be pleased that system disruptions are kept to a minimum with little or no effort on your part. Built-in diagnostics alert you to disk failure, defective memory, and other potential issues so they can be resolved before affecting your everyday tasks.
Behind the scenes, new self-healing technol



</answer>

<category>

</category>



<question from>



lilaznra...
Member since: 13 March 2006
Total points: 1319 (Level 3)



</question from>



<question>



HP registering help please?



I formatted my vista computer. I got a pop up to register my hp. I clicked do not remind me again. It popped up again, so I registered. It still pops up. What do I do?



</question>



<answer from>



lostdog
Member since: 07 April 2008
Total points: 1221 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



1. Navigate to "Start-&gt; Programs-&gt; Accessories-&gt; System Tools" and click
on "Task Scheduler"



2. When the task folder appears, delete any entry that starts with



"Webreg" (i.e. "Webreg 20031218075500" or similar)



The above steps should clear out all reminders.



Also, if you open HP Software update you can deselect to do updates as opposed to removing it.



Source(s):



http://discussions.hardwarecentral.com/a...



</answer>



<asker's comment>



ty it worked



</asker's comment>

<answer from>



Ronald
Member since: 05 December 2007
Total points: 2224 (Level 3)



Contributing In:



Credit



</answer from>



<answer>



Did you buy a FULL version of OFFICE or just an upgrade?  If just an upgrade you needed to leave the trial version on the machine to get the upgrade installed.  IF the full version then try reinstalling.



</answer>



<answer from>



Mysterious Rose
Member since: 21 September 2008
Total points: 667 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



The one you bought is the full package so you need to uninstalled the trial version first or use it until it runs out before installing the full package that you bought and then remove it when it runs out. That is why you get a message saying it doesn't match. They may be both office 07 versions but they are two different packages. One is trial and the other one you bought is the full package.



I know this may seem a minor thing but to a computer it is different.



</answer>

<answer from>



Tizio 008
Member since: 21 July 2008
Total points: 12501 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Programming & Design



Software



Other - Computers



</answer from>



<answer>



even though nowadays sw are overbloated, likely they don't need the whole code at the same time. so the "code" is splitted into pieces. according to what funcs you are using, these pieces are in memory or not. keeping the interface and input waiting (it is all word does 80% of its time) is not so memory consuming.
anyway, if the memory space is really too few, no matter if it exists the f*cked virtual mem, the loader of the OS will refuse to load it.
the usability of programs in such a low-mem situation is another fact

<answer>



The registry cleaner included in Glary Utilities isn't bad at all
http://www.snapfiles.com/reviews/glary-u...



Comodo Registry Cleaner doesn't provide any detailed info but it does backup your registry before cleaning
http://registry-cleaner.comodo.com/



If you have the money, try Registry Mechanic - safe and reliable
http://www.pctools.com/registry-mechanic...



</answer>

<question from>

</question from>



<question>



HELP ME!! PLEASE!!!!!?



i have had my dell desktop for a while now but have not ben able to use It because i forgot the password! i have tried everything that i can think of to get into it there are things on there that i need but if worse comes to worse i don't care if i have to erase things on it i just want to be able to use it again!! PLEASE HELP!!



</question>



<answer from>



You
Member since: 17 September 2008
Total points: 1146 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



http://support.microsoft.com/kb/321305



</answer>



<answer from>



zimmi200...
Member since: 24 March 2007
Total points: 1914 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



The only method provided by Windows to reset your password is to use a Password Reset Disk. Windows typically bugs you to create a Password Reset Disk when you first create the password-protected account so that you can recover your data. Unfortunately, if you don't have a Password Reset Disk, the only option available is to reinstall your copy of Windows, which will likely result in a loss of data.



I hope this helps!



Source(s):



http://windowshelp.microsoft.com/Windows...



</answer>



<answer from>



Aninepon...
Member since: 20 August 2008
Total points: 497 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



boot it up in safe mode (this makes you become an administrator) go into the "change profiles and password" section in the control panel.  Then change your password for your account and log on to yours! to go into safemode i think its F8 when the computers booting up.



If that doesnt work use this



Place your Windows XP CD in your cd-rom and start your computer (it’s assumed here that your XP CD is bootable – as it should be - and that you have your bios set to boot from CD)



Keep your eye on the screen messages for booting to your CD Typically, it will be “Press any key to boot from CD”



Once you get in, the first screen will indicate that Setup is inspecting your system and loading files.



When you get to the Welcome to Setup screen, press ENTER to Setup Windows now



The Licensing Agreement comes next - Press F8 to accept it.



The next screen is the Setup screen which gives you the option to do a Repair.
It should read something like “If one of the following Windows XP installations is damaged, Setup can try to repair it”
Use the up and down arrow keys to select your XP installation (if you only have one, it should already be selected) and press R to begin the Repair process.



Let the Repair run. Setup will now check your disks and then start copying files which can take several minutes.



Shortly after the Copying Files stage, you will be required to reboot. (this will happen automatically – you will see a progress bar stating “Your computer will reboot in 15 seconds”



During the reboot, do not make the mistake of “pressing any key” to boot from the CD again! Setup will resume automatically with the standard billboard screens and you will notice Installing Windows is highlighted.



Keep your eye on the lower left hand side of the screen and when you see the Installing Devices progress bar, press SHIFT + F10. This is the security hole! A command console will now open up giving you the potential for wide access to your system.



At the prompt, type NUSRMGR.CPL and press Enter. Voila! You have just gained graphical access to your User Accounts in the Control Panel.



Now simply pick the account you need to change and remove or change your password as you prefer. If you want to log on without having to enter your new password, you can type control userpasswords2 at the prompt and choose to log on without being asked for password. After you’ve made your changes close the windows, exit the command box and continue on with the Repair (have your Product key handy).



Once the Repair is done, you will be able to log on with your new password (or without a password if you chose not to use one or if you chose not to be asked for a password). Your programs and personalized settings should remain intact.



Hope this helped!



</answer>

<question from>



Nancy

<question>



Saving photoshop work..please help?



ive used photo shop on some photos and then saved them when ive finished, but when i reopen the completed pictures they open up on photoshop... i dont want them to do that! i want them to open up as a normal picture would.
does anyone know whats going on and tell me how to fix this?
thanks



</question>



<answer from>



ny
Member since: 06 October 2008
Total points: 104 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



yes, there is how. Open your photos in the photoshop again. Click



Save as in the file menu. When the directory where you want to save



them opens, below there will be File name field. It will be filled



with the name of your file - you can keep it, unless you want to



rename it. Below the name field there will be format field. Click it.



There will be a drop down menu, with the list of file formats. Select



the one you want - if these are photos, you will probably want JPG,



the most popular image format. Click save. A window will appear,



asking you if you want to save it anyway, because it will "lose the



format". Say yes - your photos will be fine, it just means that some



of the photoshop properties will be lost, it's nothing. Click save



again. Go to the directory where you saved your files, and open them



as images, without photoshop.



</answer>



<answer from>



rodro.br...
Member since: 24 July 2008
Total points: 149 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



After finishing edit go to file &gt; save as &gt; choose the filetype as Jpeg. . . This is should work !



There's another way. . . Right click the picture you want to open. Than open with &gt; choose the programme &gt; now select with which programme you want to open &gt; put right mark on "Always use the software to open this kinda file" &gt; ok . . . It's doNe. . !



Happy now?



Ahem! Make me happy now :D



Source(s):



Ahem ! My brain B-)



</answer>



<answer from>



Francisc H
Member since: 09 July 2007

<answer>



Open the images in photoshop, go to "File" -&gt; "Save As..." and choose a format like png or jpeg/jpg or bmp, definitely NOT psd. Photoshop probably saved your images in psd format. If it didn't do that then you probably set photoshop to open every kind of picture (or it set it itself).



</answer>



<answer from>



dimitris...
Member since: 03 March 2008
Total points: 760 (Level 2)

Open with ....

Select Windows Picture and Fax  viewer



Make sure "Always use this program" is checked
OK



</answer>



<answer from>



Mel
Member since: 21 August 2008
Total points: 471 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Did you save them in the native photoshop format (they will have a .psd at the end of them) or as jpegs (with a .jpg at the end of them)? If it's the former, you'll need to convert them to jpegs.



Alternately, your computer may be set to open them in photoshop by default. If this is the case, and if you're using a pc, open up the folder in my computer and then right click on the individual pictures. A menu will open up with a selection of different programs you can use to open the picture.



One of the options may be a picture gallery - use that to view them as pictures without opening them in photoshop.



</answer>

<question from>



Ise
Member since: 23 June 2008
Total points: 305 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Software problem with LG E500 notebook: Bluetooth?



I've recently bought myself a new notebook computer, LG E500.



I want to use the Bluetooth connection for my cellphone (Nokia 6300).
I installed the driver for Bluesoleil and the small icon appeared to the right on the task bar. Now, when I click on "Turn Bluetooth on" it just says that bluetooth-software wasn't found...wtf! I just checked the files for the BT drivers and even though I'm not a computer-genius, it seems like the install-files is not supported by the OS (that is Windows Vista home premium)...
Is it possible that this would wok if I install XP as a second OS? Or is there another way around?
In the product description of the notebook at the webshop, it says that BT is optional an may not be installed on every notebook: how can I find out if there's installed a bluetooth-receiver/antenna in my pc??



Sorry if I seem confused -I really am! Hope some of you smart guys can help me solve this one ;)



Thanks!



</question>



<answer from>



good isn't it?
Member since: 25 September 2006
Total points: 3744 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Physics



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



There is usually a warning light which illuminates when an internal Bluetooth card is active, but doesn't for an external device.  Also, in Windows XP at least, there is a Bluetooth icon in the Control Panel if an internal card is present.  However, if you contact the LG Service Desk or the place where you purchased it from, they should be able to confirm if your machine had one installed during the build.



If there isn't a card installed, you can buy a USB Bluetooth device for about £15 / $25 which is generally cheaper than an internal card and that will come with its own drivers.



Also, as you probably know, you have to activate Bluetooth in your phone before it can be detected by the computer.



Hope this helps



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Thanks for excellent help!



</asker's comment>

<question from>



ayushdhi...

</question from>



<question>



Which is better torrent or utorrent?



</question>



<answer from>



crossroa...
Member since: 02 May 2008
Total points: 1914 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



You can't compare the two because they are different.  Torrent is the file extension and it tells the application (which is the utorrent) where to download the file.  Utorrent is the application used for downloading and sharing the torrent.



</answer>



<answer from>



inclusiv...
Member since: 05 September 2007
Total points: 56065 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



Assuming you are comparing the official BitTorrent client to uTorrent, there is no effective difference. The official client is now based on uTorrent's code, just with different branding.



</answer>



<answer from>



TheHowToGuides .
Member since: 21 August 2007
Total points: 645 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



.torrent is just an extension name.
Bit like .mp3, .jpeg, .avi.



.torrent is what you download from a tracker site to start a downloading a torrent.



uTorrent is a good torrent program (Called a Client)



Guides on Downloading, Making torrents at the link below



Source(s):



http://www.phpbbserver.com/stevie19605/v...



</answer>

<answer from>



mete
Member since: 11 June 2007

<answer>



What operating system are you using?
if you are on windows look for a bluetooth software in your start menu a window will pop up look for an option to "add a device", "look for a device" or "pair a device" and also make sure you have turned on bluetooth on your PC as well as on your phone.

<answer from>



angel-ba...
Member since: 06 November 2007

</answer from>



<answer>



if u have a bluetooth adapter on ur pc, then just switch ur bluetooth on,on both ur pc and phone and then sync ur phone wud ur pc by searching devices on ur phone (should be under bluetooth settings) then just click on the items u wanna send to ur pc 4rm ur phone normally like how u would send from 1 phone 2 another.



PS : when synchronizing the phone wud pc, it might ask u for a code. u can make up watever code u like. but most ppl just use 1 or 0. its easy 2 rem.
Hope this helped



</answer>



<answer from>



versusni...
Member since: 19 February 2008
Total points: 257 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



depends on what phone you have and what program the pc is using for bluetooth.. but for the most part its pretty easy,



1st. activate bluetooth on both pc and phone
2nd. find picture you want to send, click send, via bluetooth



the phone will then search devices from your phone
-- at this point you should see the pc name on your phone
3rd, connect them.. ( it might ask for you to set a password.. just put like a four digit caracter you will remember, like 1111 or 0000)



it should start sending after that..



if phone doesnt have option to send it via bluetooth then you might not be able to do it at all and a usb cord would really come in handy



Source(s):



PC Tech.. ive also done it before many many times...



</answer>



<answer from>



Nick
Member since: 18 September 2008
Total points: 238 (Level 1)

<answer>



Use usb cable for data transfer.
Or use card readers if you have a memmory card and reader.
You can use bluetooth which is much slower than above methods only if you dont have the facilities.
Try in the sameway as you receive photos from computer to send them back.
Make your P.C bluetooth settings as discoverable for other devices.



</answer>

<question from>



♥

<question>



Which is the best free email site to use for personal use?



I've tried Hotmail and Yahoo (lol!), but am keen to try another site as I want to open another email account.



Thanks in advance!



</question>

<answer>



I use Yahoo Mail, Gmail (both very good) AND Hotmail as a "throw away".



I've found that Yahoo Mail has better SPAM filtering, so that is my personal recommendation.  To start fresh with Yahoo, just create a new account.  Remember to Export all your Yahoo Contacts FIRST.



TIP:  Use your Yahoo Mail for Friends & Family, and Gmail for everything else, except:  Use Hotmail if you  don't trust a website that demands your Email address.



</answer>

<answer>



There are many types of Audio files.



Wma, Mp3, RM, Flac.



Media players need to know how this file is made and how to play it.



These bits are called Codecs which gives the player the info.



VLC as said should ply it but if that fails you need to post the file extension for better help.



.Mp3, .Wav. .ra ???

<question>



Can you make the startup of windows xp the same thing as when you do ctrl+alt+del on the welcome page?



If you are on the welcome screen of Windows XP, and you hit Ctrl + Alt + Del, it takes you to a box where you type in username and password. Is there anyway to make it automatically start like this each time you log out/turn on computer?

<answer from>



inclusiv...
Member since: 05 September 2007
Total points: 56069 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



In the Control Panel, open "User Accounts." Click "Change the way users log on or off", and then uncheck "Use the Welcome screen."

<answer>



Double check that you have enough memory free when you start the program Press ctrl+alt+del and go to performance and it should say available physical memory. If you don't have over 800Mbs free then it may throw the error.



You should need alot to install something like that, for safety reasons because if it runs out, it can crash the installer thus rendering your computer useless.

- a virus or spyware

- full harddrive/registry

<answer from>



Danielle P
Member since: 11 September 2008
Total points: 191 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



you probably are running out of memory on your computer. go to your control panel and click unistall programs. if you have any programs, music downloads, game downloads, etc that you really don't use or want anymore, unistall it off of your computer, and that will definitely clear up some space...



if you basically want to keep most of the stuff on your computer, then consider going to a computer store and buy more memory for your computer.



</answer>



<answer from>



Scott A
Member since: 09 July 2008
Total points: 164 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Firstly, You should usually re-install Windows every year or so in order to keep the PC running efficiently. Obviously make sure that you have all your data backed up, and choose to repair install for Windows, not REFORMAT, or else you will lose all data. You should have recieved a manufacturer recovery disc when you purchased the machine.



If you don't wish to do this, it could be that you have lots of spyware or a virus on your machine. Make sure that you run a virus/spyware check with your current antivirus software.



Refrain from using CPU hungry virus programs like Norton & Kaspersky. All be it good programs, they make your machine ridiculously slow.



As mentioned by another user. Try disk defragmentor, this should run for a while and make your computer run more efficiently. Start --&gt; All programs --&gt; Accessories --&gt; System Tools.



The last thing i can think of is the possibility that you may have a faulty fan. If this is damaged in anyway, and your machine is still under warranty, then its worth getting this checked out. Only as a last resort though, ensure you do everything else mentioned first.



Hope this is of some help.



</answer>



<answer from>



Jack J
Member since: 06 October 2008
Total points: 102 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



It is the most possible reason that there are many invalid entries and empty keys stuck in the registry,which slow down your computer.You can learn more solutions on this problem here:
http://www.repairproblems.com/junk-files...



Source(s):



http://www.repairproblems.com/
http://www.advancedpctweaker.com/



</answer>

<original file>767.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk73138.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



Melissa of the Rodents
Member since: 29 May 2008
Total points: 664 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Can only access Vista through BIOS?



Hi, I know nothing about computers.
When I turn on my laptop all I get is flashing line unless I first press the key for BIOS and cancel through there to go to loading. It has me select from the cd dvd drive/ usb drive, and another one that sends me where I need to go when I choose it. The laptop is fine otherwise. I was wondering how I can skip this. Thanks :)



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



When you go into BIOS, look for the boot order.  Make sure your Hard Drive is listed as the first boot item.



Also, If you have a CD in the drive, you might want to take it out.  It can sometimes cause a hang up at boot.



Finally, if you have anything connected via USB, try disconnecting it before booting.  Sometimes that will hang your computer also.



Good Luck.



</answer>

<question from>



Chelsea_...
Member since: 07 September 2008
Total points: 104 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Is there Any Way to increase my utorrent download speed?



I have utorrent and i have a local area connection of 100.0 mbps is there any way of increasing my speed to more than 26 kbps



</question>



<answer from>



oracle12...
Member since: 27 January 2007
Total points: 17671 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Programming & Design



</answer from>



<answer>



100Mbps is the speed of your PC's connection to your modem/router. The speed of your modem to your ISP is completely different, it's whatever your ISP charges you for. As well as a bunch of other factors, like what speed the server is uploading at.
If you want faster internet, you should pay your ISP for a faster connection.



</answer>



<answer from>



Big D
Member since: 05 October 2008
Total points: 119 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



the only way you can really improve speed is to find healthy torrents with lots of seeds.



also, with programs such as bitlord, download speed is directly linked to upload max speed. if you allow faster uploads, you should have faster downloads



:)



</answer>



<answer from>



nandish
Member since: 06 October 2008
Total points: 114 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



The speed indicated might not be your true speed.Check up with ur internet service provider to see what scheme is yours and try internet download manager.its better and utorrent does not specialize in increasing internet speed.100.0 mbps is not at all the true speed.It just shows the maximum speed ur LAN card can handle.Virus check your Comp.un-install utorrent.



www.internetdownloadmanager.com



</answer>

<answer from>



Joshua T
Member since: 11 May 2008
Total points: 230 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



I don't think the people above know what .fla is. the FLA format is the format used by Flash. You can't convert it to anything. You need to compile the FLA by opening the FLA with Flash and then pressing Ctrl Enter. Then you can go back to where the FLA was saved and there should be an SWF file with the same name as the FLA. This is the file you can convert.



</answer>

opensour...
Member since: 02 August 2008

<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



james
Member since: 16 August 2007
Total points: 63 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



My computer's images, as far as internet and everything that I see on the screen has been rotated how can ?



I get it back to normal, thanks, please help



</question>



<answer from>



Teaching Assistant
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 131 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



You probably accidentally hit the shortcut keys for screen rotation. By default on Intel graphics, it's CTRL + ALT + Up to return to normal. If that doesn't work, go to your graphics control in Control Panel and change the rotation back to normal that way.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



thank you, it worked



</asker's comment>

<original file>8697.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk74279.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



Rocky S
Member since: 30 June 2008
Total points: 96 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How to install icon pack in windows xp?



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



Windows  XP not only support changing icons for shortcuts and file associations but they allow changing the system icons as well. This is accomplished from the Effects dialog box available in the Display settings of Control Panel.



To view your new icons, run Windows Explorer and open your icon folder. If you have a collection of individual icon files (ending in .ICO), you will see the icons displayed for you in the Explorer's window. If necessary, select Large Icons from the View menu to properly see them.



To view the icons stored in a .DLL collection of icons, you will need to take the same steps you would normally take to actually change the icon of any shortcut.



Source(s):



http://www.trvidcom.com.au/Products/desk...



</answer>

<answer>

<question from>

</question from>



<question>



I have accidentally changed the date on a document after modifying it?



I modified a word doc and wanted to save the original, and "save as" the new doc to a new date. But I hit save first, so the old doc is now saved under the new date.
Can I recover the original doc?



</question>



<answer from>



Rommel Olido
Member since: 16 September 2008
Total points: 361 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I dont think you can change the date on a document after you have save the file.  The file will still be the same but the date will change according the the last save of the file.



Source(s):



http://www.trvidcom.com.au/Products/desk...



</answer>



<answer from>



Medium Dave
Member since: 16 October 2007
Total points: 13144 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



if all you want to do is change the date, set your computer clock to the relevent date and resave the file.



If you want to recover the older file, prior to modifications, you'll have to look for word backups - they're usually hidden, and called wrl~somethingorother.



</answer>

<question from>



Mark Starr
Member since: 30 August 2008
Total points: 27 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



DID I LOSE A BET?? info please!!?



i bet a buddy of mine that i could go one month without downloading porn, i know oh well, well all i  did was browse this one site and he says that counts, does it?
i didn't think just looking at a site counts as downloading it.
info please, $50 is on the line (btw, i'm no addict, i just find it fun, wink)



</question>



<answer from>



Angie
Member since: 08 January 2007
Total points: 5537 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Computer Networking



</answer from>



<answer>



Pictures on a website get downloaded to your computer (even if you're just looking at them).  They are what get stored in your Temporary Internet Files.



</answer>



<answer from>



Tomk
Member since: 26 June 2007
Total points: 10978 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



Did you download or not?



Did the bet forbid you to even browse porn?



If the answer to both the above is "no", then you have not lost the bet.



Often, when bets are made in fun, people don't go into a lot of discussion about what specifics are and are not allowed.  He may have understood the bet to be that you wouldn't have anything to do with porn for a month while you understood it to mean that you could watch 24/7 so long as you didn't actually download anything.



Watching streaming video IS considered downloading even though the data is in a temporary file which you probably can't retrieve.  You are still downloading the data to make the video play.



So, I'd say chances are pretty good that you've lost the bet.



</answer>



<answer from>



Ebony
Member since: 13 October 2008
Total points: 314 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



You might not choose me as a best answer after I say this, but you lost the bet, sorry. Pictures are downloaded automatically when you browse. So, shut up and hand over those 50$ to your friend you porn maniac ;-P



</answer>

<question>



Youtube video quality?



how do you get your videos on high quality on youtube non eof min esay watch in high quality PLEASE HELP ME.



</question>



<answer from>



hotdog
Member since: 25 October 2008
Total points: 97 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



simply type this code in at the end of a url. its very fast and easy.



so if you are on youtube and watching a vid, go to the adress bar and type this code in right at the end .::



&fmt=18



some videos might be too rubbish and this code might not doo much but try it on a few videos you'll see the difference.



heres an example:



normal quality
http://uk.youtube.com/watch?v=x8mM0Pj20n...



hd coded quality:
http://uk.youtube.com/watch?v=x8mM0Pj20n...



hope this helps!!!!!!!



Source(s):



i do computing and programming



</answer>

<question>

<question>



Style Tagging Mac Word 2004?



In MS Office for the PC, when I view the document in "Normal" mode, I can see the different styles applied to the majority of lines of text (usually the majority say "normal", but they can also say "H1"/"Heading 1") and then I am able to change them quite easily by click on the style name and selecting a new style. I cant seem to find this feature in Mac Word 2004. I have used this feature in multiple versions of MS Office, so I this is not a new feature.



Thank you!



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>

Look for "Style" in the Index, all will be revealed.



</answer>

<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



kangkung...
Member since: 24 April 2008
Total points: 336 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Installing xp and ubuntu in one physical HDD?



I just want to ask how can i install Ubuntu together with Xp in single 2 partition HDD? Win XP are already installed on local disk C and im planning to install Ubuntu in Local Disk D. I don't want to use virtual pc or other like program so don't recommend me that.
One thing more is Ubuntu are easy to use? Can you recommend other free Operating system that has same windows?



</question>



<additional details>



im planning to install the latest version of Ubuntu 8.10(Intrepid Ibex).
I had Intel Pentium processor Dual Core 3.0 Ghz  512 Mb RAM.



Local disk D is partition of my HDD.
C=40Gig, D=40Gig.
I had some files on D, is this files will erase when i install Ubuntu in that partition?



</additional details>



<answer from>



short_pa...
Member since: 05 August 2007
Total points: 1103 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



I'm lazy so i'm just going to paste something i said elsewhere. The only thing that's different in your case is that i'm guessing drive d is a partition on the same drive as C. You didn't need to make a new partition in windows, but it's easier that way because you know exactly what's gonna get wiped out.



Here's a recycled answer:



Ubuntu's differentiator is
1. it comes in a zillion languages
2. it's easy to use
3. it tends to 'just work'.
4. installing software is easier (in my experience) than anything else. its package manager, synaptic, allows you to search up what you want, select a batch of programs, and download and install them all automatically. All in one place. What's more, you can upgrade all the software you have, including the linux kernel, at once, with a few clicks.



You can keep XP. What you want to do is to resize your xp partition to make room, or install linux on another drive. You need 15 gigs free, tops. 10's fine. 1 gig for 'swap'.



To do this, first defrag your disk to get all the data on one side. The resizer will just chop off the last few gigs no matter what's on there, so margin of error is good.



Then you can just resize your xp partition as part of the ubuntu install, it will detect your windows install and give you the choice of what operating system you want to use at boot.



If your computer's fast and comes with a nvidia card and you like eye candy, there's a package called compiz-fusion you may want to look at.



If your computer's not fast and a bit old, you may want to try xubuntu or an older version of ubuntu (6.06 preferably) so it doesnt run so slow. Ubuntu's competitive with vista in more ways than one, if you know what i'm sayin'.



Ubuntu comes with an interface called GNOME. It's pretty simple, not very configurable. It may sound wierd to a windows user, but you can change that window manager out for something else. An alternative is KDE, which is slightly more similar to windows, except it is extremely customizable.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



thanks for the information it helps me to decide what im going to do



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



spam_swa...
Member since: 27 May 2008
Total points: 141 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



First off, if you choose to install Ubuntu on the secondary partition, it will erase any files on there during the install.
Second, yes Ubuntu is easy to use. To be honest, the only things I've found I can't do on Ubuntu are watch DVDs and play Windows Games (even with WINE).
I cannot recommend any other free OS which is as good for a new user as Ubuntu.
Here's how the installation will begin: Insert the installation disc, reboot the PC, and it will auto start the installation process from there,



Source(s):



I installed Ubuntu on my PC's secondary partition myself.



</answer>



<answer from>



TingPing
Member since: 24 July 2008
Total points: 463 (Level 2)



</answer from>

</answer>

<question>



How do I use visual custom themes again?



after Windows update service pack 3, i can't use my custom theme anymore and i've had it for years! is there a way to get around this? i hate the default xp themes :-(



</question>



<answer from>



J
Member since: 13 January 2008
Total points: 2244 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



there is a quick and easy way to do this...



go to this website, download SP3 UxTheme Patcher and then all themes in your



windows/resources/themes



area will be active and selectable



Source(s):



http://www.ajuaonline.com/2008/05/02/ena...



</answer>



<asker's comment>

</answer from>

</answer>



<answer from>



masterof...
Member since: 30 October 2008
Total points: 110 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



no you cant.  downloading torrents is not like regular downloading.  you need a torrent client to download torrents.  think of it like this.  when you download a regular file you get one large file from one large server.  when you download from bit torrent you are downloading from other peoples computers so you get lots of small files from many different computers.  hope this helps : )



</answer>

<question from>



Y.Casper
Member since: 02 October 2008
Total points: 455 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Which anti-virus is better for a laptop?



I have 2 anti-viruses Norton 360 (came with the laptop FREE) or Avast anti-virus which one is better and which keeps me best protected?



</question>



<answer from>



mediaban...
Member since: 22 October 2008
Total points: 756 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Norton is better, but if you've got limited ram you may want to use Avast. Avast uses far less ram.



I use Avast, simply because I hate that most Anti-virus programs use around 10% of my cpu's ram. With that, I've never had any issues with Viruses. I don't know if that's because I've been lucky or Avast is working -so take that however you want.



If you visit a large number of "enjoyable" sites, or bootleg sites, I'd go with a more powerful protector though.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



ill go with norton because i have a high ram



thanks!!



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Barry
Member since: 18 August 2008
Total points: 988 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Norton is very good but a very heavy program which will slow your pc down if you have low specs!



Avast is also very good and i have used before fine!



Remember to only use one at a time, but if i had to choose, i would keep Avast out of the two you mentioned...



Here are other free Anti Virus programs that are free and also good you may want to look at including reviews.
http://pcsecuritycentral.blogspot.com



</answer>



<answer from>



Alex
Member since: 26 April 2008
Total points: 253 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



A couple of free ones



Avast 4 Home Edition
http://avast-4-home-edition.lastdownload...



AVG Free Edition
http://avg-anti-virus-free-edition.lastd...



Likely you do not want to have real time protection on as it will slow your laptop. Just install one of these are regulary scan for viruses



</answer>

<question>



I have Photoshop CS3 but want to go to CS4, how do I transfer my Filters, brushes, patterns, etc.. possible?



Do I have to reinstall the filters? And can I just drag the other presets over to the CS4 directory?



</question>



<answer from>



amybeade...
Member since: 21 February 2006
Total points: 19723 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



You may be able to drag them, but a suggested way is to use the Preset manager and save all those things that you want to transfer into a separate folder. You can create your own groups of brushes, filters, etc. Then when you want to load them into CS4, you would just point to the appropriate folder.



</answer>

<answer from>
