</answer from>



<answer>



You mean the START button on the bottom of the screen has disappeared?



Press the Windows button on the keyboard it will show you where it is hiding .  Possibly just repositioned if so just drag and drop it to it's proper place.



</answer>



<answer from>



The Phlebob
Member since: 24 March 2007
Total points: 83122 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Programming & Design



Software



Other - Computers



</answer from>



<answer>



One of several things might have happened:



1) You may have accidentally put the screen in Full Screen mode.  Try pressing the F11 key to fix this.



2) The taskbar may be hiding.



1.	Look for a thin line on one edge of the screen.



2.	Click on it.  The Taskbar should open up.
3.	Right click in the Taskbar and select Properties.
4.	Uncheck the Auto-Hide the Taskbar menu item.
5.	Click OK.



3) The taskbar may have shrunk or moved to another edge of the screen.  To fix this:



1.	Look for a thin line on one edge of the screen.



2.	Right click in the thin line.
3.	Drag it towards the center of the screen to make it big again.
4.	If it's not on the bottom of the screen, drag and drop it back to the bottom of the screen.
5.	Right click in the taskbar, and select Properties.
6.	Check the Lock The Taskbar item.
7.	Uncheck the Auto-Hide the Taskbar menu item.
8.	Click OK.



If none of these help, then the process that runs the desktop, explorer.exe, has probably died.  You can do this to get it back:



1.	Press the CTRL, ALT and DEL keys at the same time.
2.	If you’re running Windows Vista, click Start Task Manager.
3.	Task manager should open up.  Click the File-&gt;New Task (Run) menu item.
4.	In the text box, enter



explorer.exe



5.	Click OK.
6.	Close Task Manager by clicking the X in the upper right corner or by the File-&gt;Exit Task Manager menu item.  There is no button to close it.



Hope that helps.



</answer>

</category>



<question from>



highkick...
Member since: 24 July 2008
Total points: 18 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



My wife downloaded an ovulation program and it had a virus in it and she uninstalled the programs set up files?



and i got rid of the virus but this program won't uninstall with the setup files am wondering if there is a FREE program that can fix this issue



</question>



<answer from>



Asked, But Never Chose Best Ansr
Member since: 13 October 2007
Total points: 2163 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



This is typical.  Virus creators don't want the source of their virus uninstalled.



The program's files may be in  a folder, something like:



C:\Program Files\Ovulation\



If My Computer or Windows Explorer has an Address Bar, you can copy and paste that line into it, to delete the folder of the program that won't uninstall.



After that, I recommend cleaning your Windows Registry, using software designed for that purpose.  I have had good service using Registry Cleaners from EasyDesk Software.  They provide a 10-day trial version, which is more than enough time to repair your Registry.



Source(s):



http://www.easydesksoftware.com/down.htm



</answer>

<question>



My internal lappy hard drive says 250gb on it, but when I go to "my computer" it says total size 232gb?



and I'm not looking at the total available space. Also, when i reinstalled windows and partitioned, it listed partition 2 and partition 3, as though there's an invisible partition 1 somewhere. Did the comp manufacturer create a secret partition and how can I get rid of it?



</question>



<answer from>



A C
Member since: 24 October 2008
Total points: 404 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>

</answer>



<answer from>



lucyhu.c...
Member since: 30 September 2008
Total points: 128 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



232*1024*1024*1024 = 250,000,000,000



</answer>



<answer from>



Mercuri
Member since: 06 May 2008
Total points: 12356 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



Other - Computers



Laptops & Notebooks



</answer from>



<answer>



I assume you have a Dell.  The hidden partition is about 50 megabytes in size and only contains HD diagnostic utilities.  Anyway, you do indeed have 250GBs of HD space... in decimal.  It just shows up as 232GBs in binary (which is what computers run at).  If you look at the actual number of bytes on your hard drive, it's something around 250x10^9 bytes.  However, you have to look at how memory is stored on a computer.  1 kilobyte is 1024bytes (not 1000).  1 Megabyte is 1024 kilobytes.  1 gibabyte is 1024 megabytes.  So if you take your 250x10^9 bytes and divide it by 1024^3, you get 232GBs.



</answer>



<answer from>



Albert S
Member since: 22 October 2008
Total points: 111 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



its known for this to happen...theres some space the operating system takes up



as for partitions...you can get partition magic which is software you can use to create, split or delete any partitions on your hd.



</answer>



<answer from>



CanadaRA...
Member since: 26 August 2008
Total points: 13649 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



Other - Computers



Laptops & Notebooks



Security



</answer from>



<answer>



No, that is correct. Your hard drive has 250,000,000,000 bytes
Which humans count as 250 Giga (billion) bytes



Your computer however counts by binary Gigabytes
1 GB = 1024 MB and 1 MB = 1024 KB and 1 KB = 1024 bytes
So 1 GB to the computer is not 1 billion bytes, but 1,073,741,824 bytes



232.83 * 1,073,741,824 = 250,000,000,000 bytes, so what we call 250 GB the computer calls 232.83 GB = its the same number of bytes.



This is all explained in the fine print in your owner's manual.



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigabyte#Co...



(Don't listen to the answerers who say it's 'lost to formatting' or 'there's another partition with the 18 GB in it' - they are just wrong)



</answer>



<answer from>



Katydid
Member since: 25 May 2006
Total points: 886 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>

There is a small portion of the computer that is in 'setback' mode and I think it is for shutdowns, overloads, etc. I think it said that it was Something a service worker needs when you have a crash.
Wish I could be more technical.
Best wishes.



</answer>



<answer from>



Anthony2...
Member since: 21 October 2008
Total points: 1090 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



This is true with all hard drives. It is caused by the difference in number systems. When a hard drive is advertised as 250GB, it is assuming 1GB=1000MB. In reality, computers use the binary number system, where 1GB=1024MB.



</answer>

<question>



Whats the best music making software ?  if i wanted to create a death metal/heavy metal song?



</question>



<answer from>



Lexi
Member since: 02 September 2008
Total points: 1361 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Pro Tools... But I would highly recommend making the music yourself and putting it through an Mbox or something, not using loops. Or get a midi controller.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



ty



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



massiv_x
Member since: 19 April 2006
Total points: 1423 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



i write deathmetal music myself...



i use fruityloops to make the drums, but i use my own drum recordings (individual acoustic drums i sampled and processed myself and i actually have to screw with the bar/beat settings to give more space per beat for death metal as the drums are generally really fast, with my bar/beat settings, i track the drums at like 700bpm).  The idea here is to make them sound like natural drums being played by a real drummer...



i record using logic on a mac or protools and audition (cooledit) on pc.



i mix all these things in either protools or audition.  I actually prefer audition because i can do real mastering, editing, and postproduction there, not just simple bounces with hit-or-miss effects and processing like in protools.



Source(s):



i record live instead of tracking whenever i can...but the neighbors dont always like this method.



</answer>

<question>



Microsoft Word 2003 question?



Grrr. If i wasn't so impatient I could probably fix it on my own, but I am impatient, so I'm asking you. When I type a quotation mark followed by a vowel ("A, "E, "I, "O, "U, and their lowercase counterparts) Word automatically turns them into Ä, Ë, Ï, Ö, Ü, and their lowercase counterparts. How can I stop it? It's extremely annoying.



</question>



<additional details>



I'm putting quotes in front of them because I'm typing a quotation....(duh) As in "All your base are belong to us." Word would make that into Äll your base (blah blah blah). And it's not in autocorrect, I already tried that.



</additional details>

<answer from>



Yahzmin (US)
Member since: 28 June 2006
Total points: 223241 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Yahoo! Answers



Other - Yahoo! Products

<answer>



Try checking under 'Tools' &gt; AutoCorrect Options. There may be a setting there that you can turn off, or a list of 'autocorrections' there you can delete those from.



Also, remember: "Whenever AutoCorrect makes an unwanted correction, you can undo the correction by pressing CTRL+Z. If you select the Automatically add words to list check box in the AutoCorrect Exceptions dialog box, the unwanted corrections that you undo are added to the list of exceptions. " (from their HELP section).



</answer>



<answer from>



Devon Steele
Member since: 23 October 2008
Total points: 98 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



i am sorry i can not think of it right now it is right there in front of me.  But it is in the corrections menu some where under auto corrections type like !A in the first box and it should come up with what it auto corrects into delete  that and it wont do it anymore.



</answer>



<answer from>



gospiele...
Member since: 01 May 2006
Total points: 12498 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



Probably you change your keyboard layout to an international layout, example from "US keyboard layout" to "US INTERNATIONAL keyboard layout".



The layout controls which characters appear on the screen when you press the keys on your keyboard. An international keyboard layout makes it easy to type specials characters, where only two keystrokes are required. Example: ú = ' + u



ñ = ~ + n



ü = " + u



To change your layout (assuming Windows XP) :
1.- Click Start and then Control Panel
2.- In Control Panel, if you are in Classic View, click on Control Panel Home (top left corner)
3.- Open Clock, Language, and Region
4.- Click on Regional and Language Options.
5.- Click the Keyboards and Languages tab and then click Change keyboards.
6.- To set the new layout as your default, select it from the list. Click OK to save your changes



You can switch between different input languages (keyboard languages) by:
• Clicking on the Language Bar button



• Pressing the Alt + Shift keys



Psst ... smile



</answer>



<answer from>



The Phlebob
Member since: 24 March 2007
Total points: 83122 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Programming & Design



Software



Other - Computers



</answer from>



<answer>



It's possible someone set up AutoCorrect entries for this.  Try this:



In Word versions prior to Word 2007 (Vista):



1. Click the Tools-&gt;AutoCorrect Options menu item.
2. Click the AutoCorrect tab.
3. In the Replace text box, put a quote mark and an A.
4. If an entry in the lower list box with the Ä gets selected, click the Delete button.  Repeat as necessary.
5. Click the OK button.



In Word 2007:



1. Click the round Office button in the upper-left corner of the window.
2. Click the Word Options button.
3. Click the Proofing task.
4. Click the AutoCorrect Options button.
5. Continue as in Step 2, above.



Hope that helps.



</answer>

<question from>



DzignDiv...
Member since: 13 August 2007
Total points: 121 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



What computer program do you need to digitize images for embroidery and where can I purchase ?



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



There are alot, but it is basically a better idea to have the shop do it.



The problem is that embroidery places don't use just point by point images, they rely on stitches.  Typically the place you have embroidery done will process an image into that for a small-ish fee. To do so yourself is usually a huge pain, as image conversion automated things still leave alot of custom work on the stitching to be done.



</answer>

<original file>4813.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk79949.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



nanderxm...
Member since: 02 October 2007
Total points: 92 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



In Excel, how can I find out the frequency of each word in a one-word-per-cell column?



I'm entering a lot of data (for a project on the frequency of certain first names in a large data sample), and is there a way for me to find out the frequency of each name with a certain command?



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



assuming the first name is in a cell by itself (ie: one name per cell) you could use the COUNTIF function.  For example



if you data is in A1 to A5000, in B1 enter
=COUNTIF(A1:A5000, "BILL")
this will count the # of times BILL is in your data range.



you could also do it like:
=COUNTIF($A$1:$A$5000, A1)
and then copy/paste this formula all the way down from B1 to B5000.  This will look at what is in A1 and count the # of times it occurs in your range.  In B2, it will look at what is in A2 and count the number of times it occurs, etc, etc, etc,



</answer>

<question from>



ramone35
Member since: 13 February 2008
Total points: 80 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Are newsgroups illegal?



i download from usenet newsgroups from a service that I pay $15 a month for. I always thought it was legal since i'm paying for it and not getting content for free. so what's the deal?



</question>



<answer from>



Random Time
Member since: 19 October 2008
Total points: 807 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Usenet usegroups are leigal, but if you download music that is put there illigally, the downloading of such content is illigal



</answer>



<answer from>



amybeade...
Member since: 21 February 2006
Total points: 19723 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



Usenet newsgroups are perfectly legal. What makes you think they are illegal?



</answer>



<answer from>



roo2
Member since: 20 March 2006
Total points: 24374 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Drama



</answer from>



<answer>



Newsgroups are legal.  Downloading any file that's under copyright (commercial music, movies, software etc)without paying for it is illegal.  It doesn't matter how you do it, the act itself is a crime.  You're paying for access to a service, not for the files.  If you're using newsgroups to download open source software, home movies, or music by unsigned bands looking for an audience then it's legal.  But if it's commercial software, music or movies then it's illegal.  It's copyright infringement.  The penalty is a fine between $750.00 and $150,000.00 per file and up to five years in prison.



</answer>

<answer from>



Joshua T
Member since: 11 May 2008
Total points: 422 (Level 2)

<answer>



You can just download a plugin for Office 2007 (it would only work on 2007): http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/detai...
Then you can save a document as a PDF. (Click "Save As", and select "PDF or XPS")



If you have Office 2003, I suggest downloading PrimoPDF, which is freeware. http://www.primopdf.com/



</answer>

<question>



I asked this before and never got a good answer?



When I connect a device to my PC I can hear the little bubble pop that tells you the device is connected but don't actually see the bubble. Is there a way to fix this?



</question>



<answer from>



ian_jt20...
Member since: 30 October 2008
Total points: 107 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



The sound you are hearing is an indication that a device that has been previously installed with plug and play has been connected to your computer; you will only see the notification in the taskbar when you plug a hardware component that has not been previously connected and windows needs to install the drivers necessary.



</answer>



<answer from>



Debbie s
Member since: 31 December 2007

<answer from>



ELfaGeek
Member since: 18 February 2007
Total points: 53846 (Level 7)



Contributing In:

<answer>



"I can hear the little bubble pop that tells you the device is connected"



It's built-in to Windows, and that's exactly what it's for.



The only way to stop it, that I know of, is to mute your speakers.



Or, you could waste some time, editing Window's default sounds, in the Control Panel.



</answer>

<question from>



Rolyn dal yma o hyd!
Member since: 29 July 2008
Total points: 1074 (Level 3)



</question from>



<question>



What's the difference between using a program like 'RegCure' and defragmenting?



What do they do?Do they do the same job?Why and when should we use them? Which is the best? Please use lay-man's language as I'm not the most computer-literate person on here (by a long way).



</question>



<additional details>



Oh, dear, I've already bought 'RegCure' as it was recommended by someone here to help as my computer had become very slow at downloading videos etc.
How will it mess up my registry and should I de-install it?
I've already paid for it but if it's going to do more harm than good should I just get rid of it?



...or should I just delete it by using 'file-assassin?'



</additional details>



<answer from>



Peter K
Member since: 17 December 2006
Total points: 40476 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



Defrag just arranges your disk to use the space more efficiently. A PC can run faster with an organised disk. Do a defrag every few months.



RegCure is scamware that you DO NOT NEED! Just about everything that claims to fix or clean your registry is fraudulent.



</answer>



<answer from>



Paul B
Member since: 18 July 2006
Total points: 1858 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



RegCure probably mucks up the registry on a Windows PC and defragmenting is the process of tiding up the disk on a computer.
Defragmenting a Hard Disk is a good idea as it can improve the performance of the computer.



Source(s):



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defragment



</answer>



<answer from>



Denz
Member since: 16 September 2006
Total points: 629 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Regcure fixes and configures the registry system of your computer if your not keen on computers better stay away from altering it you might damage your computer settings.



defragmaneting is different from regcure, in theory it organizes data from your harddrive so your hardrive can find data faster, think of it as your drawer if it is well organized you can find clothes easily.



you can use defragment if you want but it does not make a difference. but make sure you finish it! you could ruin some programs or  lost files if you terminate it halfway (defragmenting could take hours depending on how big your harddrive is)



Source(s):



me and myself



</answer>



<answer from>



ishida63...
Member since: 28 September 2007
Total points: 210 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Actually, there are two types of defragmentation: registry and disk.



If you mean 'registry defragmentation,' this is the process where the program would compress the registry (a database that lists all of the configuration settings that determine how Windows looks and behaves). Fragmentation of registry is caused by several install and uninstall of programs.



If you mean 'disk defragmentation,' this is the process where the program would defragment (compress) the disk to save space. This process will just leave the unused files unmoved, while the ones you are using will be left untouched. Defragmentation of disks don't require a restart, but defragmenting the registry requires a reboot (restart).



RegCure is not a registry defragmenter neither it is a disk defragmenter. It is just a software that 'cleans up' unused registry keys. Using these kinds of programs is not reliable. Such programs doesn't know which keys are used, and it could delete the ones your system use.



A word from Microsoft Help and Support:



"Some products available for free on the Internet suggest the registry needs regular maintenance or cleaning. Occasionally, a registry setting can become corrupt but, in general, the registry is self-sufficient. If you do decide to install a registry cleaner, be sure to research the product and only download and install programs from software publishers that you trust."



My only suggestion is, do not use the so-called "registry cleaners." These kinds of programs could corrupt (destroy the configuration) the registry and make your system unbootable.



Source(s):



Microsoft Help and Support, and also books.



</answer>

<answer>



Answer 1:



just do the following..



start-&gt;run-&gt;cmd



now type the following in the prompt



&gt;ping "www.google.com"



use the site name for which u want to find the ip instead of "www.google.com"

<answer from>



rowlfe
Member since: 30 July 2006
Total points: 27626 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



You should have two programs (which come with windoze in most versions) which will help you, PING and TRACERT. Both are run in a command window from a command prompt. The usage is PING &lt;domain name&gt; which will show something like this, as I did for yahoo dot com:



===== in the command window ====
C:\PING yahoo.com



Pinging yahoo.com [68.180.206.184] with 32 bytes of data:



Reply from 68.180.206.184: bytes=32 time=75ms TTL=52
Reply from 68.180.206.184: bytes=32 time=75ms TTL=52
Reply from 68.180.206.184: bytes=32 time=72ms TTL=52
Reply from 68.180.206.184: bytes=32 time=73ms TTL=52



Ping statistics for 68.180.206.184:



Packets: Sent = 4, Received = 4, Lost = 0 (0% loss),
Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds:



Minimum = 72ms, Maximum =  75ms, Average =  73ms
=====



Essentially, this tells you two things, the IP address of the domain and the response time for a packet of data to be returned. Now for TRACERT: (usage is the same)



===== In the command window =====
C:\TRACERT yahoo.com



Tracing route to yahoo.com [206.190.60.37]
over a maximum of 30 hops:



1



1 ms



1 ms



16 ms  192.168.0.1



2



64 ms



54 ms



57 ms  v-static-145-254.avvanta.com [206.124.145.254]



3



51 ms



125 ms



60 ms  core-01-ge-0-2.sttl.isomedia.com [207.115.64.163]



4



59 ms

152 ms  yahoo.com [206.190.60.37]



Trace complete.
=====



Note from this that IP 192.168.0.1 is my router and avvanta dot com is my ISP. Note also you do NOT see the IP address of the machine I am using which is 192.168.0.10. "Self" does not count as a hop in the route. Again, note the times which is a measure of the speed of your connection and the speeds of the connections between hops. AND you get the name of each domain AND IP address of each server which handled the packet as it traveled to and from the destination.



</answer>



<answer from>



Colinc
Member since: 15 March 2007
Total points: 74563 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



Any attempt to trace an IP address comes back to the owner of the address. This will normally be the ISP who issued it, which may be in a totally different town to the person using the address.



</answer>



<answer from>



MostWanted uNm
Member since: 28 October 2008
Total points: 202 (Level 1)

<answer>

</answer>



<answer from>



fivetoze
Member since: 24 July 2008
Total points: 2408 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



nightmare...



just reinstalling Xp wont work... the errors remain as your only overwriting.. not reinstalling.



theres two ways to do this;



1 get another hard drive, and connect it thru a USB port... anf transfer from A to B in safe mode. (press F8 at startup)



and the other way is to get a copy of LINUX. (Linspire Xp2007) it boots off teh CD, and then you can use that to transfer your files, and then reformat the drive using XP disk.



Source(s):



sad experience



</answer>



<answer from>



AJ
Member since: 01 May 2007
Total points: 8413 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Yes it is but it is a pain. You must install it to the same disk/partition, you must not format or delete any partition, you must use the same user name, you must use the same password. Do all this and you should be able to access and backup your files.



Once your files are safe then I would do a completely clean install formatting your OS partition as you install



AJ



</answer>



<answer from>



Ken S
Member since: 07 September 2008
Total points: 360 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



if you re-instal windows you may lose all your data..you could however obtain a new hdd and install windows os then set you old drive as a slave and try to access the data that way.

Daniel G
Member since: 12 December 2007

<answer>



I have had this happen to a laptop much worse than a desktop.



Nightmare's Solution  is right on try using a live linux disc, there are many flavors.  They boot linux off your cd-rom and let you run the linux os off the disk.  You can access all your files on your hard drive.  You will need something to transfer them onto another hard disk or a flash drive. That's your best bet. DistroWatch has Tons of linux variants, linux mint is really simple to use good luck,

<question>



Utorrent help please!!!!?

Thanks for your time

<answer from>

Member since: 14 August 2008

</answer from>



<answer>



go to the upper left corner, click add torrent, then pick what u want to use,wait 4 it to download, can take awhile, u can either watch it or add it to a video/dvd



Source(s):



me myself and i



</answer>



<answer from>



KROFS
Member since: 09 February 2006
Total points: 23700 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Other - Internet



Software



Other - Computers



</answer from>



<answer>



You go to torrent search sites to find the content you want.  This article discusses the most popular torrent search sites:
http://www.techsupportalert.com/content/...



When you find content you want, then you download a small file (the torrent) associated with the content.  When the torrent is opened in uTorrent, the transfer of the associated content begins.



This is a guide to setting uTorrent up for best speed:
http://www.techsupportalert.com/content/...



</answer>



<answer from>



peterkab...
Member since: 29 September 2008
Total points: 120 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



You probably want to download torrents, right? If im right, there is 2 options: first is to find the torrent do you want to download. It should be a .torrent file. You simply double click, and it asks you where you want it to be downloaded. The  second is to open utorrent, File/add torrent by URL, but for this, you must know th exact link to the torrent, so i would use the first one. You can use www.piratebay.org  or www.isohunt.com to find these torrent files. Usually when u succesfully download one, its in many many .rar files or in .iso format. In first case, u just need to open one of them with WinRar and extract like normal. In the second case, you will need a program called daemon tools ( http://www.daemon-tools.cc/dtcc/download... ) , install it, and an icon near the clock should spawn. Click it then click Mount image and find the file you donwloaded. Thats all!



</answer>

<question from>



atominfi...
Member since: 03 January 2008

</question from>



<question>



Spore used to run on my computer but now it won't load. It tells me Spore is not working.?



I have Vista and I have all the requirements to run.



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



Well either the CPU/ram usage increased because of another installed application. Either the hard disk is in more usage than before...



It wont load or it just takes more time? Not responding usually means you have loaded RAM and CPU to max so the program doesnt respond now, it may respond after waiting a little



You can still reinstall it, since you usually keep saves (but backing them up in a different location wouldn't harm)
....



Try using Ctrl+Shft+Escape to close unnecessary applications
before and retry



</answer>

<question from>



Compiz-git Ubuntu
Member since: 27 May 2007
Total points: 32506 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Software



</question from>



<question>



Ubuntu. Is there a third party active source for unsupported repositories?



I was thinking of Ubuntu 6.10 and Ubuntu 7.04



</question>



<answer from>



inclusiv...
Member since: 05 September 2007
Total points: 57375 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



There are still a few mirrors of the repositories for older releases. There is also an archive on an official Ubuntu server, but moved off the one that supports more recent ones. No one to my knowledge is still doing backports or security fixes for them, though.



http://old-releases.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/di... (Feisty will probably be moved here in a month or so)
http://komo.vlsm.org/ubuntu/dists/
http://63.211.210.90/mirror/ubuntu/dists...



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Brilliant just what I was looking for .



</asker's comment>

<answer>

Cucusoft Ultimate Converter Suite converts all the media file to play on almost any portable device including iPod, iPod touch, iPod video nano, iPhone, Zune, PSP, video capable MP3 players, video capable mobile phones, and Pocket P.C., etc.  Meanwhile, it can also support output almost any audio/video format including Video format(H264, MP4, WMV, AVI, MOV, RM, 3GP, flv, SWF, mpeg-1, mpeg-2, VCD, SVCD, DVD, etc.) and Audio format(AC3, AAC, MP2, MP3, MP4, RA, WMA, etc.).

<original file>14331.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk88119.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



Lori T
Member since: 28 October 2006
Total points: 635 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



My Shift and Control keys are not functioning to select multiple documents, How can I fix this?



I have followed all Windows support instructions to fix this issue.  When I am in my documents- I am no longer able to select multiple files to upload.



</question>



<additional details>



Yes, I have Windows  Vista- Thank you



Note, I can select multiple files from my desktop, but not when I am in the desktop folder or in my documents file. geez



</additional details>



<answer from>



deanyour...
Member since: 26 January 2006
Total points: 3776 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



If you are using Windows Vista, have you turned on the feature to use Check Mark Boxes?



If you have turned on that feature, you don't need to use Ctrl and Shift keys.



If you want to use the Ctrl and Shift keys, turn off the Check Mark Box feature.



If you are not using Windows Vista, or you have not turned on the feature I mention above, or if that feature is not the issue, perhaps someone else will provide different insight.



Good luck.



</answer>



<answer from>



rMøMmÅjøk£mÅ§t£r ♥
Member since: 16 October 2008
Total points: 197 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



get a new pc



</answer>






<original file>14332.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk88120.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



top secret!!!
Member since: 08 May 2007
Total points: 581 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Should I use windows vista 64 bit or 32 bit?



Okay i am a gamer. I also create movies and stuff
but i am mainly a gamer
should i use 64 bit or 32 bit
does it affect the type of hardware i have on my computer if i get 64 bit?



</question>



<answer from>



Minion of Satan
Member since: 04 July 2008
Total points: 3505 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



64 bit can access more memory your better off using that



</answer>



<answer from>



aldaysof...
Member since: 01 July 2008
Total points: 949 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I would go with the Windows Vista X64 OS...



However, there is a requirement to run a X64 OS by installing more RAM, my recommendation 4GB total... on a X32 OS it will only read 3.5 GB but the X64 OS will read the complete ram.



</answer>



<answer from>



jesse
Member since: 19 October 2008
Total points: 972 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



gamer = 32 bit.
64 bit you have to have a 64 bit OS + all software compatible with 64 bit. and drivers as well. now the 64 bit works but you have to have over 4GB of RAM to actually see a difference, because 64 sees over 4GB, 32 bit edition will only see up to 3.5 no matter if you have 4GB in your mb. the 64 bit affects hardware, if you do not have a x64 process and mb to go with it you will not be able to use it. no one really writes games for it anyways. 32 bit is much more stable, unless you are using it as a server or file hosting and webhosting ftp and such.....stick with 32 bit editon.



</answer>



<answer from>



M W
Member since: 27 October 2008
Total points: 255 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Let your favorite applications be your guide. That is assuming that your hardware will support both. Write down your top five or ten app's and check them one-by-one.



</answer>



<answer from>



rajesh_k...
Member since: 31 October 2008
Total points: 103 (Level 1)



</answer from>

<question>



What is the best program to download music?

<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



LimeWire, Ares Galaxy, FrostWire, LemonWire and eMule are all free.  I think MP3 Rocket is too, though they have a Pro version with a one-time fee.  LimeWire has a Pro version also.  There are also torrents which are free.  Bear Share and iMesh are pretty much the same and charge a monthly fee for unlimited downloads but you can only listen to them; if you want to put them on a CD or anything you have to buy the songs at 99 cents each.



There are also search engines like MP3 Search and SkreemR MP3 Search where you can type in the name of an artist and it will find places where you can download their songs.

<question from>



unitedbo...
Member since: 26 July 2008
Total points: 45 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



D:\ is not a valid win32 application?



i got the pc to start up but it wont read anything it wont work even if i do it manually it is a samsung dvd-rw if you need more info please ask



thank you



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



This error comes up when the machine is instructed to run a program which isn't a program file, or that doesn't exist.



You may be infected with the RavMon virus or another variant
It has inserted an autorun file into your root directory which is referencing a non existent file.



To get your machine to boot again, boot from a Windows CD or from a floppy, and delete the autorun.ini file from your hard drive
Then run a complete antivirus scan.



</answer>

<original file>1707.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk90221.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



nich0142
Member since: 30 October 2008
Total points: 97 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Excel Help. How do I link "Max" to the contents of another cell?



I am looking for a way to do the following in Excel.



I currently have a B1 Cell that is set up to =Max(A451:FQ451). I have Cell A1 = A451 & Cell A2 = FQ451. How can I change =Max(A451:FQ451) so that it is linked to "contents" of cells A1 & A2. Therefore I can change Cells A1 = A452 & Cells A2 = FQ452 and the formula in B1 is automatically updated to =Max(A452:FQ452)



Thanks



Dave



</question>



<answer from>



jmorge
Member since: 30 January 2006
Total points: 8643 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Software



Other - Computers



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



you can do this with the INDIRECT formula.  With INDIRECT, you can type a cell reference in a cell and INDIRECT will use that cell reference as the cell reference in your formula (did that makes sense).  In your case just enter



=MAX(INDIRECT(A1) : INDIRECT(A2))



in A1 enter A451 and in A2 enter FQ451.  Max interpret the range as MAX(A451:FQ451).  And changing the cell refs in A1 & A2 will automatically change the MAX references.



Source(s):



I know because I stayed at a Holiday Inn last night



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Thanks for the answer



</asker's comment>

<answer>



You cannot copy a piece of hardware. You must be referring to the software on your hard drive? <answer>

<question from>



Raychel L
Member since: 12 July 2008
Total points: 91 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How do you put mp3 music on your desktop so you can put it in powerpoint?



i need help



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



It doesn't necessarily need to be on your desktop to be put in a powerpoint. So long as you have the song on your computer, all you need to do is go to "Slide Transition" in powerpoint, "Modify Transition," click on the little drop down arrow next to "Sound:" and browse to the song on your computer.



</answer>

<answer>



"the rating on vista for my graphic card is 1.0."



That's probably because your nVidia drivers are not being recognized in Vista.

now you're in boot settings
there adjust the first boot device second -third etc.

<answer>

<answer from>



ELfaGeek
Member since: 18 February 2007
Total points: 49828 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



'non system disk or disk error insert new and strike key'



This means your hard disk Master Boot Record is damaged.



Boot from your Windows disk and go into the Recovery Console and run "fixmbr".



For full details, Google for:



Recovery Console "fixmbr"



</answer>



<answer from>



DJ Mei De
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 111 (Level 1)

<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



zartbot
Member since: 04 April 2008
Total points: 131 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Need help for excel formula?



Greetings



I have this spreadsheet question for homework but am having difficulties understanding what to do.  I haven't used excel before so the whole formula thing has me completely stumped.



I have a $122,740.45 loan to pay back and I am charged a 6.95% interest fee per month.  What formula do I need to type in for it to work out how much interest it takes out each time?



Many thanks for your assistance
Zartbot



</question>



<additional details>



Thank you very much for your help.  The second one worked a treat.  I can't believe how far off I was in my formulas lol.



Cheers Zartbot



</additional details>



<answer from>



Adziwa
Member since: 05 March 2008
Total points: 3643 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Religion & Spirituality



</answer from>



<answer>



Hi there,



More information would be helpful... For instance - do you have a set payback amount? Are you wanting to know what the decreasing interest charge is per month as you pay back the loan? Or do you simply want to know what the interest is per month at 6.95%?



I'm going to assume the last one in my first answer to you so:



In cell A1 type '$122,740.45'
In cell B1 Type '6.95%'
In cell C1 type '=A1*B1'



That should tell you what 6.95% of A1 is.



Alternatively if 6.95% is the annual interest charge and you want to know what the monthly interest charge is then type into C1:



=A1*(B1/12)



Does this help?



If you want to know what the monthly payment should be to pay it back over a certain period of time then you can use the =PMT() function but I'd need to know more (such as what the repayment term is) in order to give you the formula for that one.



Best of Luck,



Alex



</answer>



<answer from>



suman p
Member since: 31 October 2008
Total points: 141 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



software engineering tools-



http://tigri.org/



</answer>

<question from>



super_sa...
Member since: 10 March 2006
Total points: 154 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Can Someone help me to repair my Girlfriend's PC?



I am a newbie technician... Most familiar to easy formatting using windows CD in BIOS... My problem is in the case of my Girlfriend's PC... 1st scenario is I set the first boot in the CD option and the others are set to None... then save and exit BIOS set up then... 2nd Scenario it doesn't boots on the windows CD and it says "put a removable media and press any key" so I put a DOS disk but it does not boot... what shall I do now? Her PC is accessible but I probably doubted it that it won't boot after it requires to restart the PC... The cause of this Problem of why it needs to be reformatted is a virus that cannot be fixed because my Girlfriend doesn't have any internet connection.



</question>



<answer from>



Colinc
Member since: 15 March 2007
Total points: 74671 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



If she does not have a connection, how does she have a virus? What you are setting in bios will not work anyway. You need to set the cd as first boot, but will need to allow the hard drive to boot, as it will stall the installation otherwise. you can NOT use dos disks on a current Windows system, it can not handle the drive sizes or file system. From your obvious lack of knowledge I would take it to a shop before your totally destroy it.



</answer>



<answer from>

<question from>



ashira ♥
Member since: 11 May 2007
Total points: 2589 (Level 4)



</question from>



<question>



Windows xp product key question?



I need to reformat but I dont have the xp disk that came with my computer, can I use someone elses xp disk with the product key for my computer or do I have to use theirs?



</question>



<additional details>



Tommy M: No I mean reformatting, and no its not pirating. I have a windows sticker on my computer with a product key number but the person I bought the compuer from didnt give me a recovery disk or anything.



</additional details>



<answer from>



WebNexus
Member since: 04 December 2007
Total points: 607 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



The product key affixed to the side of your computer IS your license for that computer.  You can use a disc from an OEM computer but not from another mass produced computer like Gateway, HP, Dell, etc.  Those discs already have keys in them and it will make your computer appear invalid and most likely shut the OS down.  When you do this method, however, you will most likely have to call Microsoft to get the key validated, but only the first time and it will be in the system if you format again.



OR, you could pony up the cash and call whoever made your computer and ask for the disc.  It might cost you $30 or so.



OR, if it's been made somewhat recently they probably didn't give you a disc, they put the install files on a partition on your hard drive and you just need to use the correct key strokes to access that partition and reload the system.



Source(s):



25 years computer and network services experience.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



thanks =)



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



ddrcasey
Member since: 15 July 2006
Total points: 449 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



As long as the XP disk matchs the version you have. If you have XP Home you need the home disk if you have Professional you need the Professional disk. But you can install using a different disk and using your serial number.



</answer>

<question from>



Colleen M
Member since: 26 October 2008
Total points: 96 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How do I take my music in my media player to an e-mail folder?



I have windows vista would like to send music in media player to family, Been told youtube, but still can't figure it out.



</question>



<answer from>



suman p
Member since: 31 October 2008
Total points: 139 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



webdesign software-
http://hapycog.com/



</answer>



<answer from>



Joshua T
Member since: 11 May 2008
Total points: 418 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I'm not sure what you are trying to say, but I'll try answer your question.



The typical music format is MP3, and you can't just upload MP3 files to Youtube. There are other formats but MP3 is the most common. Youtube is a video website, and videos is what you can upload. MP3 files are music-only. You can't really "send music in media player" to anyone. You can send the MP3 music files (or whatever format your music happens to be in) to your family, but you can't "send it in media player". As long as they have a media player installed on their computer, they should be able to play your music. There is a default Windows Media Player that comes with Windows, so having a media player shouldn't be a problem. Just send them the music file and you should be good to go.



How you send it depends on how much music you want to send. If you just wanna send one piece of music, you might be able to get away with sending it as an email attachment. But if you are mass-sending music, you should use a file host. Popular (free) file hosts include Rapidshare, Sendspace, and others. How it works is that you upload your music into the file host, and then they give you a download link. Just give your family the download link and when they click on the link, they will go to a website where they can download your uploaded files. Generally file hosts give one download link per file, so you should compress your music into one file before you upload it.



Hope this helped.



</answer>

<question>



How do i play Pukka Torrents on windows media player? ?



Do i need to get different software to play pukka torrents?



</question>



<answer from>



lolly
Member since: 17 January 2008
Total points: 8416 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Singles & Dating



</answer from>



<answer>



If It's a torrent you need to use the torrent to download the actual file before you can play it in any media player. Is that what you mean? You have just downloaded a torrent for something and you want to watch it? If you have just got a torrent then you will need to get a programw hich will use the torrent to actual download the file such as u torrent. And then you use that to get what you actually want to download wiht the use of the torrent. And you will then be able to watch the file after that.



Oh and also, alot of the time you cant play downloaded movies or shows in windows media player as it doesnt have the right codecs to support the file format. So you need to download a different media player such as vlc media player which works for most file formats.



Source(s):



http://www.utorrent.com/download.php



</answer>



<answer from>



KROFS
Member since: 09 February 2006
Total points: 29617 (Level 7)



Contributing In:

Software



Other - Computers



</answer from>



<answer>



Pukka is the release group for the torrent.
It looks like pukka releases are all avi encoded in XviD.
WMP at default does not have the codecs to play XviD.



Easiest thing is to get the free VLC.  It has codecs installed within and will play that and most anything downloaded:
VLC Download
http://www.videolan.org/vlc/



</answer>

<question>



How do I send an Excel document?



I just downloaded a 60 trial of Office. There's an Excel document I'm trying to send. I get an error message saying "no profiles have been created. To create a new profile, use the mail icon in control panel".



I don't see a mail icon in the control panel.

Thanks for any help.



</question>



<answer from>



mrsdeli
Member since: 06 August 2007
Total points: 12740 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



The two are not compatible, that's why you can't send it.



</answer>



<answer from>



jmorge
Member since: 30 January 2006
Total points: 6992 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Software



Other - Computers



</answer from>



<answer>



the "send as an attachment" option in excel is setup to use the outlook email program. Since you haven't set up outlook (or maybe didn't even install it), you won't be able to use the option in excel (there's no way to tell excel which email program you are using).  Instead, you'll just have to attach your file to an email message directly from your email program (ie: the same way you would send any file from whatever email program you use).



</answer>

<answer from>



chezzrob
Member since: 27 September 2007
Total points: 20303 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



set your ie7 like this and try.  the cache probably was full.



IE7
=======
Over time IE7 seems to set its own (or programs do) tick boxes in the advance tab.
In IE7 Tools &gt;Internet Options &gt;Advance Tab
Click Restore advance settings defaults button.
Then scroll the listings down to near the bottom and:
Tick empty temp files when browser closes (this empties the cache, which if not empty, will stop you from going online).
Bullet disable phishing filter (optional. Leave it on if you want that type of protection, usually for financial data like internet banking)
Delete Browser History, cookies, add ons,  the whole lot regularly.
Close the browser to set the settings.



</answer>

<question from>

<question>



What programs should be removed on a new pc for optimization?



i just got the acer aspire one, and it lags a little. I want to optimize the performance for web browsing, and I want to know in what way to computer techs remove files and which files do you usually need to remove on a new pc? <answer from>



Peter G
Member since: 04 September 2008
Total points: 1828 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Uninstalling programs will not make your PC run any faster. If it lags, consider adding more RAM. And keep doing defrags, scans for spyware, malware and viruses to keep it performing well.
Also, use CrapCleaner to clean your computers rubbish files and clean the registry to keep your PC performing at its best.
There are probably processes that you can cancel to make your PC run better but i wouldnt advise messing with those unless you know what you're doing.



</answer>



<answer from>



Carling
Member since: 01 December 2006
Total points: 17872 (Level 6)



</answer from>

<answer>



If your trying to optimize it for web browsing, then removing applications won't help.



If you want to get rid of some stuff then take out all of the trial software that they give you, such as mcafee or norton antivirus. Dowload AVG free.



then go to the start menu click run, type msconfig (or in Vista just type msconfig in the search bar) then go to the start up tab and disable all the programs that you don't need to start when you turn your computer on. (I.E. msn messanger, yahoo messanger, quicktime etc..)

<answer>

<question from>



Mushroom...

<question>



How does Skype work!!!?



I have looked at it and read about it, but how does is it used for, how could i use it? is it worth getting? i wanted to know, thx.



</question>



<answer from>



Dean B
Member since: 30 May 2008
Total points: 14950 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



PlayStation



Video & Online Games



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



At a technical level it uses Voice Over IP to send your voice as bits of data across hte interwebs.



As for what it does, well you can use it for free call's to other Skype users, as well as free video calls(webcam needed) and IM chats.
It can also be used to call Mobile phones and landlines, at pretty competitive rates, espcially when calling internationla numbers(costs are listed on the website)
I use it to call my parents, Im at Uni so thers no phone in the dorms, so Skype is an excelent choice to use, it would be even better if any of my parents could use a Pc good enough to use Skype, then it would be free.
You can download it for free, and it usually comes with about £5 balance included so you can start straight away. all you need is aheadset, which some are 'skype approved'(usualy a rip-off costs though) but include Skype credit too, and some Skype certified handsets(look liek a normal phone, has buttons n stuff, though headsets are probale more comfortable)
Some mobile phones and the PSP includes Skype too, and some landline phones may have Skype built in.
If you find that it is not much use in your particluar sitiatio then jsut uninstall it. simple.



Source(s):



http://www.skype.com/intl/en-gb/



</answer>

<answer>



. Shutdown, restart as long as 1 second



if you want an instant shut down Windows XP, you can press the CTRL + ALT + DEL, and then pop in the Task Manager, click on the "off" → "shutdown" At the same time hold down the CTRL, less than 1 second, you will find it closed system, in the blink of an eye on it. By the same token, if the "off" menu, select "restart" to restart quickly.



To reduce the load when starting the project



in many applications in the installation system will be given a free hand to add the group to start each time your system will run automatically, not only to extend the start time and resources to start after the completion of the system has eaten a lot of ! We can reduce the system starts to load the program, is to: "start" menu "Run" and type "msconfig" start "the System Configuration Utility" into the "Start" label window in this list to start the system When loading the project and sources carefully to see whether you need it to load automatically, Otherwise, remove the check box before the item, the less load the project, to start the sooner the natural speed. The need to re-start before taking effect.
the link may help you http://www.error-remover.com/



</answer>

<original file>833.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk97579.txt</current file name>




<category>



Computers & Internet



Software



</category>



<question from>



Mark Starr
Member since: 30 August 2008
Total points: 27 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



I am confused about DOWNLOADING!!?



as you can tell i am not the most computer savvy guy in the world so bear with me.
does just going on a site mean you have downloaded it?
example: am i know downloading yahoo answers cause i am on it?
what counts as downloading?



</question>



<answer from>
Member since: 26 August 2008
Total points: 13534 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



Other - Computers



Laptops & Notebooks



Security



</answer from>



<answer>



As you are viewing Yahoo Answers, the web page is 'downloading' to your web browser, so that counts as traffic on your net connection, but we don't usually call that downloading, because it is not permanently saved on your machine.



Downloading is where you click a web link to save a file to the hard drive of your computer, or where you use a program like a FTP program, Limewire, P2P or torrent program to transfer a file from the Internet and save it on your computer.



Watching streaming videos is kind of in the middle -- you aren;t permanently saving the video to your machine, but you are receiving a large amount of data, which consumes the same amount of traffic as if you had downloaded the video file.  So watching videos becomes significant if you have a limit on the # of MB you can 'download' on your Internet account (and particularly on cell phone internet use where overages on data traffic can cost you big bucks)



</answer>



<answer from>



Jonny Hugh
Member since: 07 May 2007
Total points: 141 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



You're not downloading it in the same fact that you can access it anytime from home without being online. However, windows does save parts of it so that when you log on it can load faster. These can be deleted by emptying your cookies and history. Some things are downloaded though.



</answer>



<answer from>



cutebadg...
Member since: 24 October 2008
Total points: 290 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Hi,



Going or browsing a site, is not downloading. If you enter a site and you browse it, that's all! It's simply browsing the site.



But if for example, you're looking for a software, games, pictures, etc. there is a download button and after clicking that, a prompt like "save as" will appear, and when you click yes, that is downloading.



If you are to download something in the net, there is always a prompt that will appear and from there, you will know that you are downloading something.



Enjoy! Hope this helps!



</answer>



<answer from>



David D
Member since: 05 March 2007
Total points: 55684 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



Downloading is the transfer of data from a remote machine (e.g. answers.yahoo.com) to a local machine (e.g. the one you are sitting at) when the request is initiated from the local machine.



When you request the Yahoo! Answers homepage, your browser downloads the Yahoo! Answers homepage. It doesn't download the whole of Yahoo! Answers - because it consists of many thousands of pages.



</answer>



<answer from>



Jim Maryland
Member since: 31 January 2007
Total points: 15005 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



Yes, visiting a site is downloading a portion of a site.  You don't download the entire site, just what you are viewing.  There are differences in the type of download though, which is what may be confusing to you.  When you view a page, the information is transferred to your computer, otherwise you wouldn't be able to view it.  This is often in the form of "caching" the data to memory or to a file on disk.  The browser handles this form of downloading internally with minimal input from the user (you can always configure the browser for caching options, but for the most part, it works without user input).  The other type of download is where you get a copy of a file from the server with the intention of using it "offline".  What I mean by this is you can download an application (examples: iTunes software from Apple, a trial version of a game, etc...) and use it without being connected to the Internet.



</answer>



<answer from>



ELfaGeek
Member since: 18 February 2007
Total points: 53852 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



Everything you ever wanted to know about downloading (and uploading) is here:



TIP:  Learn to use Google and Wikipedia and you'll be a Computer Whiz in no time!!!  BTW, I searched on Wikipedia for:



download



That's the REAL secret, use one word or a very short phrase, like convert .MP2 to .mov (Simple. eh?)



Source(s):



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Download



</answer>

<question>



What internet browser gives you the option of never having a history and cookies?



I have to delete my history after every session. My friends try to spy on me when they're at my house, but I am a weak person so I can't stop them.



</question>



<answer from>



chezzrob
Member since: 27 September 2007
Total points: 20303 (Level 6)

<answer>



Delete history
========
http://www.google.com/support/bin/answer...



there are 2 instructions to alter



for IE, MSN, Firefox and Safari



click the Red 1, 2 , 3 circles in the link.
Note there are instructions to clear them once only, but if you expand the info in there, it tells you how to alter the browser settings to never have them.



For History set the Days to 0.



</answer>

<answer>



Google Chrome



Mozilla Firefox
maybe Internet Explorer too but i haven't really looked into it



</answer>



<answer from>



Christopher F
Member since: 29 July 2008
Total points: 107 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Well I know in Firefox you can select options to automatically delete personal information on exit.



Tools &gt; Options &gt; Privacy



Down the bottom you will see the check box for clearing data on exit. If you click the settings button you can select which information is cleared.
There is also a check box there to require you to confirm clearing.



As for a program that just plain doesn't save history or cookies I don't know of one. Cookies are required for most websites that you are required to log in to so doing so would cause problems.



Best bet is probably to enable an auto delete of your personal data.



</answer>



<answer from>



vishnu r
Member since: 11 March 2007
Total points: 874 (Level 2)

<answer>



I used to have the same problem. Now I use Google Chrome and my online time is all kept to myself and I can look at whatever I like. Once in Google Chrome, press ctrl+shift+n. This will open an incognito window. I always close the original, spy-welcoming  window afters, just in case I use that by mistake during a browsing session.



</answer>



<answer from>



QQQ
Member since: 11 May 2008
Total points: 12274 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Software



</answer from>



<answer>



Firefox and Stealther Extension (google them up).



Or use Google Chrome, and use the Incognito browsing mode.
Any browsing you make while in Incognito mode will be made private and will leave no traces (no history, no cookies, no autofills) on the computer.



</answer>

<category>



Computers & Internet

</category>



<question from>



h4x0r
Member since: 01 November 2007
Total points: 1423 (Level 3)



</question from>



<question>



Does anybody know of any software that does what I'm describing?



Okay, I have a small home network and I need a program that will allow me to view and control computers from another computer. I also need a program that allows my to launch applications, send messages, logoff/shutdown, lock input devices, block websites and some applications.



Any ideas. AB Tutor Control doesn't work on my network. I have previously used Net Control 2 and I liked it but it crashes to much.



Price doesn't bother me.



Thanks in advance, I'm looking forward to reading your suggestions.



= ]



</question>



<answer from>



oni-kun 卍
Member since: 27 July 2008
Total points: 11731 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Programming & Design



</answer from>



<answer>



You're looking for RADMIN- or remote administrator.



That is the only software which can control your computer. But no software of that sort all in one can block websites, you can do that yourself by editing the c:\ Windows\ system32\drivers\ etc\HOSTS file and adding an entry like:



127.0.0.1 www.website.com



to block all and any access to the website.



</answer>



<answer from>



Sima
Member since: 04 June 2008
Total points: 78 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



software news-



http://conferensealerts.com/



</answer>
